original: gang zhig yang 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang zhig yang 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: And this is also stated:🔽“The bodhisattva is not apprehended.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma dmigs zhes bya ba des nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma dmigs zhes bya ba des nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the emptiness of internal phenomena should be understood.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid gzhan rnams la yang rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid gzhan rnams la yang rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the other forms of emptiness should be understood.

original: ji skad du slob dpon phyogs kyi gang po'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du slob dpon phyogs kyi gang po'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa /
translated: As Ācārya Pūrṇavardhana says:

original: rnam pa bcu drug rab dbye bas //🔽go rims ci ltar stong nyid kyi //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug rab dbye bas // go rims ci ltar stong nyid kyi //
translated: The sixteen aspects are distinguished🔽in accordance with the order in which they are taught

original: brgyad stong pa las bstan pa ni //🔽ming gzhan gzhan gyis ni shes par bya //
analyzed: brgyad stong pa las bstan pa ni // ming gzhan gzhan gyis ni shes par bya //
translated: in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They should be understood by means of their other names.

original: 'on te stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gcig pu kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gcig pu kho na ste /
translated: Or, emptiness is just one thing,

original: gang la chos thams cad gnyis su med pa nyid kyis gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la chos thams cad gnyis su med pa nyid kyis gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: in which all phenomena become one through nonduality.

original: de bas na ci ltar de nyid kyi rnam pa mang por dbye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na ci ltar de nyid kyi rnam pa mang por dbye ba yin zhe na /
translated: So how can it be divided into many aspects?

original: bden te / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa mang du tha dad par 'gyur te rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bden te / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa mang du tha dad par 'gyur te rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: True, but they are differentiated by the various aspects of the bodhisattvas' mental attentions, etc., not by their own nature.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid yid la byed pa la rab tu sbyar bar gyur pa ni 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te chos rnams thams cad med pa stong pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid yid la byed pa la rab tu sbyar bar gyur pa ni 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te chos rnams thams cad med pa stong pa nyid yin na /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva who is engaged in mental attention to emptiness should reflect in the following manner: If all things are empty, i.e., non-existent, then what is the referent of the word self?

original: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon po ste //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon po ste //
translated: The Buddha has said, “One is one’s own protector;

original: bdag nyid kyis ni byas pa'i las //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni byas pa'i las //
translated: one’s own deeds are one’s witnesses.🔽One is one’s own master;

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams la bdag ces bya ba gang yin zhes bsam par byed cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams la bdag ces bya ba gang yin zhes bsam par byed cing /
translated: one is one’s own friend.🔽One is one’s own enemy;🔽one is one’s own relative.”🔽Thus, he reflects on what is the referent of the word self.

original: dang po nang gi chos rnams gang zhig gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa de rnams bzung nas bsam zhing bdag ces bya ba'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba dngos po cung zad don dam par mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po nang gi chos rnams gang zhig gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa de rnams bzung nas bsam zhing bdag ces bya ba'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba dngos po cung zad don dam par mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: First, he does not see any internal thing, such as form, feeling, etc., as the referent of the word self, as a real entity in the ultimate sense.

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir zab po bdag ces bya ba phyi rol pa rnams smra ba de'i don du gang zag med pa nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir zab po bdag ces bya ba phyi rol pa rnams smra ba de'i don du gang zag med pa nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: Thus, because of the profundity of the self, which is spoken of by the non-Buddhists, one should reflect on the non-existence of the person for that purpose.🔽Those who are devoted to the profundity of the internal sense-fields should reflect on the non-existence of the internal sense-fields for that purpose.

original: gang zhig nang gi skye mched zab po zhes bya ba 'dir mos pa rnams de'i don du nang gi skye mched rnams la med pa nyid bsam par byed de de gnyi ga'i don du nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig nang gi skye mched zab po zhes bya ba 'dir mos pa rnams de'i don du nang gi skye mched rnams la med pa nyid bsam par byed de de gnyi ga'i don du nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of both is the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: de la mi ni bdag gi bas ston ngo //
analyzed: de la mi ni bdag gi bas ston ngo //
translated: In this regard, the self is taught by the word “man.”

original: de bzhin du rna pa zhes bya ba sogs pas gang zag gi bdag med pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid 'ga' @284b zhig tu bstan pa ste /🔽'ga' zhig tu mig ni mig gis stong /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna pa zhes bya ba sogs pas gang zag gi bdag med pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid 'ga' @284b zhig tu bstan pa ste / 'ga' zhig tu mig ni mig gis stong /
translated: Similarly, in some places, emptiness is taught from the perspective of the selflessness of persons, as in the statement, “The eye is empty of the eye.”🔽In some places, it is taught from the perspective of the selflessness of phenomena, as in the statement, “The eye is empty of the eye, the ear is empty of the ear.”

original: rna ba ni rna bas stong zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos kyi bdag med pa'i sgo nas de'i phyir gnyi ga ltar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba ni rna bas stong zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos kyi bdag med pa'i sgo nas de'i phyir gnyi ga ltar bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be explained in both ways.

original: de la mig la brtag pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la mig la brtag pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In this regard, the eye is investigated in four ways:

original: mig nyid bdag ste zhes bya ba dang / bdag ni mig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang mig la bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag la mig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig nyid bdag ste zhes bya ba dang / bdag ni mig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang mig la bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag la mig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The eye itself is the self and I am endowed with an eye and the eye is mine and the self has an eye.

original: mig nyid bdag ces bya ba 'di ni mig la bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mig nyid bdag ces bya ba 'di ni mig la bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The statement the eye itself is the self is the apprehension of the self in the eye.

original: bdag ni mig dang ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum ni mig la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni mig dang ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum ni mig la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The three statements beginning with I am endowed with an eye are the apprehension of the self as belonging to the eye.🔽 The apprehension of the eye in these four ways is the apprehension of the eye as mine.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as mine is the apprehension of the eye as I.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as I is the apprehension of the eye as mine.

original: de la 'di rnams 'dzin pa rnam pa bzhi po mig la mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang ci lta ba bzhin du shes pas sngangs te /
analyzed: de la 'di rnams 'dzin pa rnam pa bzhi po mig la mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang ci lta ba bzhin du shes pas sngangs te /
translated: The apprehension of the eye as mine is the apprehension of the eye as I.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as I is the apprehension of the eye as mine.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as mine is the apprehension of the eye as I.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as I is the apprehension of the eye as mine.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as mine is the apprehension of the eye as I.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as I is the apprehension of the eye as mine.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as mine is the apprehension of the eye as I.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as I is the apprehension of the eye as mine.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as mine is the apprehension of the eye as I.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as I is the apprehension of the eye as mine.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as mine is the apprehension of the eye as I.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as I is the apprehension of the eye as mine.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as mine is the apprehension of the eye as I.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as I is the apprehension of the eye as mine.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as mine is the apprehension of the eye as I.

original: yang dag par rab tu shes shing mig ni bdag dang bdag gi bas stong ngo zhes bya ba ci lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //🔽de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba 'di ni gang zag gi bdag med pa'i sgo nas nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu shes shing mig ni bdag dang bdag gi bas stong ngo zhes bya ba ci lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //🔽de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba 'di ni gang zag gi bdag med pa'i sgo nas nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The apprehension of the eye as I is the apprehension of the eye as mine.🔽 The apprehension of the eye as mine

original: chos kyi bdag med pa'i sgo nas mig ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med pa'i sgo nas mig ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The eye is threefold from the viewpoint of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: kun brtags kyi mig dang / rnam par rtog pa'i mig dang / chos nyid kyi mig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi mig dang / rnam par rtog pa'i mig dang / chos nyid kyi mig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The imagined eye, the conceptually differentiated eye, and the eye of reality.

original: de la brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i rnam pas 'dzin pa'i mig ces bya ba'i dngos po kun du brtags pa'i mig go //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i rnam pas 'dzin pa'i mig ces bya ba'i dngos po kun du brtags pa'i mig go //
translated: The imagined eye is the entity called “eye” in the sense of the object of expression and the means of expression.

original: de nyid kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i mig go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i mig go //
translated: The conceptually differentiated eye is the appearance of the eye in the form of the subject-object dichotomy, which is the nature of the conceptual differentiation of that very [imagined eye].

original: de nyid kyi brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa dang bral ba dang mig gi rnam par snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir so so rang gis rig par bya ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos nyid kyi mig ces bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa dang bral ba dang mig gi rnam par snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir so so rang gis rig par bya ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos nyid kyi mig ces bya bar brjod do //
translated: The eye of reality is the perfected nature, which is to be personally experienced, because it is free from the aspect of the object of expression and free from the appearance of the eye.

original: de la mig ni mig gis stong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la mig ni mig gis stong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that the eye is empty of the eye.

original: mig ces bya ba ni chos nyid kyi mig go //
analyzed: mig ces bya ba ni chos nyid kyi mig go //
translated: The eye is the eye of reality.

original: mig gi bya ba ni kun brtags dang rnam par rtog pa'i mig gis so //
analyzed: mig gi bya ba ni kun brtags dang rnam par rtog pa'i mig gis so //
translated: The function of the eye is the imaginary eye and the discriminating eye.

original: stong ngo zhes bya ba ni rnam par bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong ngo zhes bya ba ni rnam par bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Empty means devoid.

original: de bzhin du rna ba ni rna bas stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba ni rna bas stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the ear, etc.

original: 'on te don dam pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin ba mig gi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te don dam pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin ba mig gi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But the ultimate is not the nature of the eye, since it is inexpressible.

original: gal te mig gi ngo bo nyid du gyur na brjod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur @285a * //
analyzed: gal te mig gi ngo bo nyid du gyur na brjod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur @285a * //
translated: If it were the nature of the eye, it would be expressible.

original: ro ; / de bas na ci'i phyir chos nyid kyi mig ces bya ba brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ro ; / de bas na ci'i phyir chos nyid kyi mig ces bya ba brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, why is it said to be the eye of reality?

original: 'di ni bden te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te /
translated: This is true,🔽but it is said to be the eye of reality because it is the object of the eye of reality.

original: de lta na yang gang zhig mig la sogs pa dang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'du byed kyi chos rnams kyi yongs su gyur pa'i rnam pa 'di cha dang bral ba rnam pa gcig pa yang de gang gi tshe rab tu ston pa'i don du rnam par
analyzed: de lta na yang gang zhig mig la sogs pa dang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'du byed kyi chos rnams kyi yongs su gyur pa'i rnam pa 'di cha dang bral ba rnam pa gcig pa yang de gang gi tshe rab tu ston pa'i don du rnam par
translated: However, when one wishes to teach that this aspect, which is the transformation of the phenomena of compositional activity such as eyes, forms, sounds, etc., is indivisible and of one taste,

original: 'byed pas brjod par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'byed pas brjod par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: then it is analyzed and described by the word “suchness.”

original: de'i tshe 'gro ba gzhan med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang sgra'i de bzhin nyid dang dri'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyi sgra rnams kyis so sor byas nas bstan pa yin gyi de bzhin de ni de'i rnam pa can dang
analyzed: de'i tshe 'gro ba gzhan med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang sgra'i de bzhin nyid dang dri'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyi sgra rnams kyis so sor byas nas bstan pa yin gyi de bzhin de ni de'i rnam pa can dang
translated: At that time, because there is no other world, the words “suchness of form,” “suchness of sound,” “suchness of smell,” etc., are used to teach it individually.

original: des brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: However, suchness is not of the aspect of that and is not described by that word.

original: de ltar na gang zhig 'di chos nyid kyi mig la sogs pa de ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na gang zhig 'di chos nyid kyi mig la sogs pa de ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba nang stong pa nyid ces bya bar brjod do //
translated: Thus, that which is the eye, etc., of reality is free from the nature of the internal sense bases of the eye, etc., and is called “the emptiness of the internal.”

original: de ltar nang gi dngos po rnams la rnam pa gnyis kyang zab po'i 'dzin pa log par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar nang gi dngos po rnams la rnam pa gnyis kyang zab po'i 'dzin pa log par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the grasping at the two kinds of inner entities is reversed.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la ni /
translated: In this Blessed Mother,

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: as it is said:🔽“I do not apprehend a bodhisattva,”

original: bdag byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs shing zhes bya ba de nyid kyis nang stong pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: bdag byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs shing zhes bya ba de nyid kyis nang stong pa nyid bstan te /
translated: inner emptiness is taught,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi ngo bo dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma mthong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi ngo bo dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma mthong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a bodhisattva does not see the essence of self and the nature of form, etc.

original: ci skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' mi mthong ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi mthong ste //
translated: “A bodhisattva is not seen,

original: gang zhig bdag ces thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag ces thub pas gsungs //
translated: what is called ‘self’ by the Sage.

original: nang gi dngos po zab po'i //🔽de ni stong nyid brjod pa yin //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po zab po'i // de ni stong nyid brjod pa yin //
translated: The inner entities are profound,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: that is said to be emptiness.”

original: slar phyi'i dngos po rnams la bza' bar 'dzin pa log pa'i don du phyi stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: slar phyi'i dngos po rnams la bza' bar 'dzin pa log pa'i don du phyi stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Again, outer emptiness is presented in order to reverse the grasping at outer entities as food.

original: bza' bar 'dzin pa yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams la phyi rol pa rnams kyi bdag gi ba'i lta ba dang / chos 'di la spyod pa rnams kyi yul nyid kyi rnam par rtog pas so //
analyzed: bza' bar 'dzin pa yang gzugs la sogs pa rnams la phyi rol pa rnams kyi bdag gi ba'i lta ba dang / chos 'di la spyod pa rnams kyi yul nyid kyi rnam par rtog pas so //
translated: The grasping of food is also due to the view of the non-Buddhists that form, etc. are mine, and due to the discrimination of the object by those who practice this Dharma.

original: de la snga ma log pa'i don du gzugs ni stong ste bdag dang bdag gi bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la snga ma log pa'i don du gzugs ni stong ste bdag dang bdag gi bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the first is negated in the sense of the emptiness of the self and of what belongs to the self, as in the statement: “Form is empty, being devoid of self and of what belongs to the self. ”

original: gnyis pa log pa'i don du gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong sgra ni sgras stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa log pa'i don du gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong sgra ni sgras stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: The second is negated in the sense of the emptiness of one form, etc. by another form, etc., as in the statement: “Form is empty of form, sound is empty of sound. ”

original: de ltar na phyi rol gyi yul rnams la bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral ba de rnams nyid kyi gzungs dang chos nyid kyi rnam pa dang bral ba ni phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol gyi yul rnams la bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral ba de rnams nyid kyi gzungs dang chos nyid kyi rnam pa dang bral ba ni phyi stong pa nyid ces bya bar brjod do //
translated: Thus, the external objects are devoid of the self and of what belongs to the self, and they are also devoid of the aspects of form, etc. and of the intrinsic nature of form, etc. This is called the emptiness of external objects.

original: bcom @285b ldan 'das ma 'di la gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par bral ba zhes bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa des 'di bstan to //
analyzed: bcom @285b ldan 'das ma 'di la gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par bral ba zhes bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa des 'di bstan to //
translated: The Blessed Lady has stated: “Here, form itself is devoid of the intrinsic nature of form. ” This is what is taught by that statement.

original: phung po rnam par gzhag pa la ni dbang po lnga mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya zhes ba'i yul rnam pa lnga ni gzugs su bya ba so sor 'joms pas na gzugs zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnam par gzhag pa la ni dbang po lnga mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya zhes ba'i yul rnam pa lnga ni gzugs su bya ba so sor 'joms pas na gzugs zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: In the presentation of the aggregates, the five faculties are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body. The five objects are form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility. Form is so called because it is individually destroyed by contact.

original: de la nang gi gzugs la sogs pa rnams la nang stong pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi gzugs la sogs pa rnams la nang stong pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: Among them, the internal forms, etc. are only internal emptiness.

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs dang rnam pa la sogs pas gzung par bya ba'i sgra la sogs pa rnams med pa ni phyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs dang rnam pa la sogs pas gzung par bya ba'i sgra la sogs pa rnams med pa ni phyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: The non-existence of forms, etc. that are grasped by the eye, and of sounds, etc. that are grasped by aspects, is external emptiness.

original: ci skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Form is empty by the nature of form.

original: stong pa zhes bya brjod pas slar //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya brjod pas slar //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: phyi yi skye mched rnams 'dir ni //
analyzed: phyi yi skye mched rnams 'dir ni //
translated: Here, the external sense-spheres

original: bza' bya rnams ni dgag par mdzad //
analyzed: bza' bya rnams ni dgag par mdzad //
translated: are prohibited as food.

original: de ltar nang dang phyi'i zab po dang bza' ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar nang dang phyi'i zab po dang bza' ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas /
translated: Thus, having abandoned the conception of food as inner and outer,🔽and having abandoned the view of self and mine in the body, which is the collection of inner and outer sense spheres, one should think,

original: nang dang phyi'i skye mched 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus la yang bdag dang bdag gi bar lta ba spangs pa'i phyir gang zhig 'di nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams kyi tshogs pa de yang bdag dang bdag gi pa'i ngo bos stong pa zhes bsam par byed pa
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i skye mched 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus la yang bdag dang bdag gi bar lta ba spangs pa'i phyir gang zhig 'di nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams kyi tshogs pa de yang bdag dang bdag gi pa'i ngo bos stong pa zhes bsam par byed pa
translated: “This collection of inner and outer sense spheres is empty of the nature of self and mine.”

original: 'di ni phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of inner and outer.🔽One should think again, “If all phenomena are empty, how is this world of the animate and inanimate seen to arise dependently?”

original: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin ci ltar brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba 'di ci ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba slar 'di ltar nges par byed de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba
analyzed: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin ci ltar brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba 'di ci ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba slar 'di ltar nges par byed de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba
translated: One should ascertain this:

original: zhes bya ba chos gang yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba chos gang yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: “There is no phenomenon whatsoever that arises dependently.”

original: 'on kyang med par gyur pa nyid kyis chos rnams 'di ci srid du ci lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa med pa de srid du las dang nyon mongs pa yongs su smon pa'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su gyur pa thog ma med pa'i rgyu🔽'bras kyi ngo bos 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang med par gyur pa nyid kyis chos rnams 'di ci srid du ci lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa med pa de srid du las dang nyon mongs pa yongs su smon pa'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su gyur pa thog ma med pa'i rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bos 'jug pa yin no //
translated: However, as long as there is no realization of the way things really are, as long as there is no direct realization of things as they are, for that long, due to the power of karma and afflictions, the nature of the transformation of the beginningless continuum of causes and effects occurs.🔽Karma and afflictions are the causes of the transformation of the continuum.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rnam par smin pa de rnams kyang rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du stong pa yin no //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rnam par smin pa de rnams kyang rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du stong pa yin no //
translated: Those karmas and afflictions are also completely empty.

original: de ltar na stong pa'i chos rnams la stong pa nyid kyi rgyu 'bras kyi bdag nyid kyis 'jug pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba brjod do //🔽ci ltar sgyu ma mkhan pos sgyu ma'i sngags kyis @286a * //
analyzed: de ltar na stong pa'i chos rnams la stong pa nyid kyi rgyu 'bras kyi bdag nyid kyis 'jug pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba brjod do // ci ltar sgyu ma mkhan pos sgyu ma'i sngags kyis @286a * //
translated: Thus, the engagement of empty phenomena through the principle of empty causes and effects is called dependent origination.🔽Just as a magician binds the perceptions of sentient beings with the spells of illusion

original: sems can rnams kyi lta ba bcings nas glang po che la sogs pa rnams bstan par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lta ba bcings nas glang po che la sogs pa rnams bstan par byed de /
translated: and displays elephants and so on,

original: mig bcings pa de rnams la sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa de rnams rang gi snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig bcings pa de rnams la sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa de rnams rang gi snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those bound eyes are conditions for the production of consciousnesses that are their own appearances, such as illusory elephants.

original: rnam par shes pa de rnams kyang sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa de rnams la mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de rnams kyang sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa de rnams la mthong ba yin no //
translated: Those consciousnesses see those illusory elephants and so on.

original: glang po che la sogs pa de rnams dang rnam par shes pa rnams la rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bos 'jug pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa de rnams dang rnam par shes pa rnams la rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bos 'jug pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The engagement of those elephants and so on and consciousnesses in the nature of cause and effect is called dependent arising.

original: 'di rnams gsum la yang don dam par yod pa nyid 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams gsum la yang don dam par yod pa nyid 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Also, in these three, ultimate existence does not arise.

original: de bzhin du byis pa rnams la ma rig pas mthong ba bcings pa las dang bzo dang kun brtags kyi chos rnams sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa rnams ltar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa rnams la ma rig pas mthong ba bcings pa las dang bzo dang kun brtags kyi chos rnams sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa rnams ltar mthong ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, for the childish, due to the bondage of seeing through ignorance, phenomena such as karma, crafts, and imputations are seen like illusory elephants and so on.

original: chos de rnams rang gi snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos de rnams rang gi snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those phenomena are conditions for the production of consciousnesses that are their own appearances.

original: rnam par shes pa de rnams chos de rnams la mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de rnams chos de rnams la mthong ba yin no //
translated: Consciousness sees those phenomena.

original: de ltar na kun brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyi rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bos 'jug pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa nyid 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na kun brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyi rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bos 'jug pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa nyid 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the causes and effects of imputed external phenomena are engaged, they do not arise as ultimately existent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos rnams rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos rnams rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that phenomena are essenceless.

original: gal te chos rnams kyi ma bcos pa lhan cig skyes pa la la zhig rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na de'i tshe de rnams rang gi bdag nyid kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos rnams kyi ma bcos pa lhan cig skyes pa la la zhig rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na de'i tshe de rnams rang gi bdag nyid kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the unfabricated, connate phenomena were to have an essence, then they would arise by their own power.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gzhan du gyur pa skye ba'i don du ltos par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gzhan du gyur pa skye ba'i don du ltos par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: They would not depend on other causes and conditions for the purpose of arising.

original: ltos pa yang yan te de bas na de rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos pa yang yan te de bas na de rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they do depend on them, it is understood that they do not have an essence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rang bzhin bcas pa zhes bya ba //
analyzed: rang bzhin bcas pa zhes bya ba //
translated: Those with essence

original: slar ni ci ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: slar ni ci ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: How could they arise again?

original: gang phyir rang bzhin ma bcos pa //
analyzed: gang phyir rang bzhin ma bcos pa //
translated: Because their nature is unfabricated,

original: gzhan du ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: they do not depend on another.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said:

original: gang gi phyir 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de lta bas na 'di rnams rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de lta bas na 'di rnams rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because these do not exist by intrinsic nature, therefore they are said to be essenceless.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin med pa de nyid kyi phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin med pa de nyid kyi phyir stong pa'o //
translated: Because they are essenceless, therefore they are empty.

original: de bas na rang bzhin med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don @286b dang stong pa nyid kyi don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don @286b dang stong pa nyid kyi don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of essencelessness is the meaning of dependent origination, and the meaning of emptiness is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa //
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa //
translated: As it is said:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang //
translated: Whatever is dependently originated

original: stong nyid de nyid khyod kyis 'dad //
analyzed: stong nyid de nyid khyod kyis 'dad //
translated: Is explained to be emptiness.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: That, being a dependent designation,🔽Is itself the middle way.

original: gang gi tshe ci lta ba bzhin gyi mthong ba skyes pa'i ma rig pa'i sngags kyis zhugs pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur na de'i tshe glang po che la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i chos de rnams dang des 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i chos rnams dang rten
analyzed: gang gi tshe ci lta ba bzhin gyi mthong ba skyes pa'i ma rig pa'i sngags kyis zhugs pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur na de'i tshe glang po che la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i chos de rnams dang des 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i chos rnams dang rten
translated: When the spell of ignorance that causes the perception of things as they are not is pacified, then the phenomena that are like elephants and so on, the phenomena of consciousness that apprehend them, and the basis of that consciousness, the self, will not be perceived.

original: cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang nyid kyis nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang nyid kyis nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the spell of ignorance that has entered into the arising of seeing things as they are is pacified, then those phenomena that are like elephants, etc., and the phenomena of consciousness that apprehend them, and dependent origination itself, will disappear.

original: de 'di gnas par gyur pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten la sogs pa rnams kyi stong pa ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de 'di gnas par gyur pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten la sogs pa rnams kyi stong pa ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya bar brjod do //
translated: The emptiness of the great world of the environment that is the basis of that [consciousness] is called the emptiness of the great.

original: slar yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar bsam par byed de /
analyzed: slar yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar bsam par byed de /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva should think in this way:

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos kyi rnam pas ci zhig yod dam yang na med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos kyi rnam pas ci zhig yod dam yang na med ces bya ba'o //
translated: What is called emptiness is either a phenomenon that exists or a phenomenon that does not exist.

original: bsam par byed cing de'i 'di ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam par byed cing de'i 'di ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thinking in this way, he should think as follows:

original: ci ltar su dag gis dri za'i grong khyer mthong nas grong khyer gyi blo skyes pa phyis btsal nas mthong zhing grong khyer gyi blo nyams pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar su dag gis dri za'i grong khyer mthong nas grong khyer gyi blo skyes pa phyis btsal nas mthong zhing grong khyer gyi blo nyams pa ste /
translated: Just as when someone sees a gandharva city and thinks it is a city, but later, on searching, does not see it and thinks it is not a city.

original: stong pa'i blo skyes pa der stong pa'i blo skyes pa las grong khyer stong pa zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan cung zad yod pa zhes smra bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa'i blo skyes pa der stong pa'i blo skyes pa las grong khyer stong pa zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan cung zad yod pa zhes smra bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: When the thought of emptiness arises, it is not possible to say that there is some other existent called an empty city, apart from the thought of emptiness.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang btags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams mthong ba las chos kyi blo skyes pa phyis ci lta ba bzhin pa'i yongs su tshol bas ci lta ba bzhin gyi ye shes kyis mthong bas chos kyi blo nyams pa stong pa'i blo skyes
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang btags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams mthong ba las chos kyi blo skyes pa phyis ci lta ba bzhin pa'i yongs su tshol bas ci lta ba bzhin gyi ye shes kyis mthong bas chos kyi blo nyams pa stong pa'i blo skyes
translated: In the same way, here, when the thought of things arises from seeing the nature of imputed form and so on, later, through searching for the real, the thought of things is destroyed by the wisdom that sees reality, and the thought of emptiness arises.

original: pa de ltar na stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos gzhan yod ces bya ba smra bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa de ltar na stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos gzhan yod ces bya ba smra bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus it is not possible to say that there is some other existent called emptiness.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: kun brtags thams cad spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun brtags thams cad spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because all imputations are abandoned,

original: stong nyid bdud rtsi bstan pa ni //
analyzed: stong nyid bdud rtsi bstan pa ni //
translated: The teaching of the nectar of emptiness🔽is for the purpose of eliminating

original: gang gi de la yang 'dzin pa //🔽khyed kyi de ni chung zos pa //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi de la yang 'dzin pa // khyed kyi de ni chung zos pa // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the grasping of those who grasp🔽the emptiness of that.

original: de ltar na stong pa nyid ni med pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba ma yin te gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad stong pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid yod ces bya ba yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na stong pa nyid ni med pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba ma yin te gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad stong pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid yod ces bya ba yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, emptiness should not be expressed as “nonexistence,” because all things are empty. Therefore, emptiness should not be expressed as “existence.”

original: gal te spyad par gyur pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos gzhan cung zad yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te spyad par gyur pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos gzhan cung zad yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: If emptiness were a certain other thing called “the emptiness of what is practiced,” it would not be the emptiness of emptiness.

original: stong pa @287a * //
analyzed: stong pa @287a * //
translated: Emptiness is the emptiness of that🔽by which form, etc. is known to be empty.

original: nyid ni 'dir mdo 'di la shes pa gang gis gzugs la sogs pa de stong pa zhes shes pa des nang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i phung pos bsdus pa de'i stong pa nyid brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyid ni 'dir mdo 'di la shes pa gang gis gzugs la sogs pa de stong pa zhes shes pa des nang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i phung pos bsdus pa de'i stong pa nyid brjod pa nyid de /
translated: In this regard, in this discourse, by that knowledge by which form, etc. is known to be empty, the emptiness of that is expressed as the emptiness of the internal sense bases.

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught by that.

original: 'dir ni don 'di rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni don 'di rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning that should be understood here.

original: stong pa nyid kyang kun tu brtags pa dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dang yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang kun tu brtags pa dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dang yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Emptiness also has three types: the imagined, the other-dependent, and the perfected.

original: de la kun tu brtags pa ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba thams cad du nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la kun tu brtags pa ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba thams cad du nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: Among them, the imagined is like the horn of a rabbit. It is not applied everywhere.

original: gzung ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of the object apprehended, nor is it the representation of the subject apprehending.

original: yongs su grub pa ni mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i ye shes kyi rig par bya ba rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas rnams nyid kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i ye shes kyi rig par bya ba rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas rnams nyid kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The perfected is the object of the knowledge of the Buddhas themselves, which is the object of the knowledge that abides in the nature of the equality of all things, as the object of the knowledge that is the agent of observation and the observed.

original: 'dis ni stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rnam pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su 'dris pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'dis ni stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rnam pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su 'dris pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: This is the object of the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas, which is the sixteen aspects of emptiness.

original: mngon du byed pa'i ye shes la ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i ye shes la ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gcig kho na ste /
translated: The intuition that is realized has the nature of the emptiness of the non-apprehension of all things, and it is only one.

original: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not one or two or three, etc.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa bsgom pa de nyid kyi 'phel par bya ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams lhag mthong gis mang bar byas pa'i mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i ye shes kyis so sor rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa bsgom pa de nyid kyi 'phel par bya ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams lhag mthong gis mang bar byas pa'i mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i ye shes kyis so sor rtogs par byed do //
translated: In order to increase that very cultivation of the non-apprehension of all things, the bodhisattva, by means of the intuition of non-concentration, realizes with the insight of the aspects of emptiness.

original: des zhi gnas zhes bya ba'i rkyen gyi rnam par rtog pas mngon du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des zhi gnas zhes bya ba'i rkyen gyi rnam par rtog pas mngon du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not realize it by the discursive thought called “tranquility.”

original: slar zhi gnas kyang ci zhig skye bar mi byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: slar zhi gnas kyang ci zhig skye bar mi byed dam zhe na /
translated: But does he not also generate tranquility?

original: snying rjes 'khor ba yongs su mi 'dor ba'i bsam pas sems yid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rjes 'khor ba yongs su mi 'dor ba'i bsam pas sems yid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because his mind is disgusted with samsara by the intention not to abandon it out of compassion.

original: de ni tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed cing nyan thos bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed cing nyan thos bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the collections are not complete, he realizes the limit of reality and attains final nirvāṇa like a śrāvaka.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: pha rol phyin pa 'di rnams kun //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa 'di rnams kun //
translated: all these perfections

original: kun rdzob nyid du bskrun pa ni //
analyzed: kun rdzob nyid du bskrun pa ni //
translated: are generated in the relative.

original: nam mkha' la ni sa bon ltar //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni sa bon ltar //
translated: Like a seed in space,

original: stong pa nyid ni mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mi skyed pa'o //
translated: emptiness does not generate anything.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rgyal sras 'di ni yang dag mtha' //
analyzed: rgyal sras 'di ni yang dag mtha' //
translated: this child of the victors

original: mngon du byed par 'gyur @287b ba ste //🔽snying rjes yongs su 'gegs byed par //
analyzed: mngon du byed par 'gyur @287b ba ste // snying rjes yongs su 'gegs byed par //
translated: does not realize the limit of reality.🔽If he were not completely blocked

original: gal te 'di ni mi 'gyur na'o //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni mi 'gyur na'o // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: by compassion, he would.

original: 'di nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the same text:

original: 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi mngon du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi mngon du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “This is the time to become familiar with emptiness, but not the time to realize it.”

original: de bas na mnyam par bzhag pa nyid kyi dmigs pa la sems nye bar bcing bar byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na mnyam par bzhag pa nyid kyi dmigs pa la sems nye bar bcing bar byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he binds his mind to the object of meditation while in meditative equipoise.

original: de ltar yongs su 'dris pa shes pa'i dus la lhag mas gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang gnas par 'gyur ba de yang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su 'dris pa shes pa'i dus la lhag mas gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang gnas par 'gyur ba de yang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, when the time of the knowledge of thorough familiarity has come, the other dependent nature is empty. That is also the nature of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa med pa nyid kyis de med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa nyid kyis de med pa'o //
translated: It does not exist because consciousness does not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa med pa ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: The nonexistence of consciousness is stated in the passage: “Venerable Śāriputra, consciousness is free from the intrinsic nature of consciousness.”

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang gis de mthong gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: gang gis de mthong gang gsungs pa //
translated: What is seen and what is said

original: de ni nang gi zhes byar med //🔽ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni nang gi zhes byar med // ces bya ba'o //
translated: does not exist internally.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of emptiness.

original: slar bsam par byed de ci zhig don dam pa'i chos kyang med dam /
analyzed: slar bsam par byed de ci zhig don dam pa'i chos kyang med dam /
translated: One might think, “Are even ultimate phenomena nonexistent?”

original: gal te de stong par 'gyur na ci ltar de'i don dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te de stong par 'gyur na ci ltar de'i don dam pa nyid do //
translated: If they were empty, how could they be ultimate?

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ni de la ci ltar dmigs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ni de la ci ltar dmigs /
translated: How can the vajra-like concentration of the buddhas focus on that?

original: gal te de ni yod par 'gyur na de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad yod pa zhes thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ni yod par 'gyur na de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad yod pa zhes thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that exists, then all phenomena would exist.

original: slar 'di ltar nges par byed de /
analyzed: slar 'di ltar nges par byed de /
translated: But this is ascertained:

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni chos 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni chos 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: What is called “ultimate” is that nothing exists.

original: gang zhig 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i grub pa'i gnas skabs de ni chos kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i grub pa'i gnas skabs de ni chos kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: That which is the state of the establishment of the essence of the tathāgatas is not the nature of phenomena.

original: de ni yod pa zhes bya ba smra bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni yod pa zhes bya ba smra bar mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be said to exist.

original: gang gi phyir de yongs su brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //🔽gang gi phyir med pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes bya ba smra bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yongs su brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no // gang gi phyir med pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes bya ba smra bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is established as having the characteristic of the nonexistence of the duality of the imagined object and subject.🔽Because it cannot be said to exist, having the characteristic of nonexistence.

original: de ni med pa zhes bya ba yang smra bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de ni med pa zhes bya ba yang smra bar mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said to be nonexistent.

original: gang gi phyir gnyis dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not exist by way of an intrinsic reality that is separate from the two.

original: gal te de yod pa zhes brjod pa yin na dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa zhes thob pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de yod pa zhes brjod pa yin na dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa zhes thob pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said to exist, then because it is obtained as existing by way of the intrinsic reality of a thing, it would be an extreme of superimposition.

original: 'on te med pa zhes brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te med pa zhes brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is said to not exist,

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin du shin tu yang med pa zhes bya ba thob pa'i phyir @288a * //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin du shin tu yang med pa zhes bya ba thob pa'i phyir @288a * //
translated: then because it is obtained as utterly nonexistent, like the horn of a rabbit,

original: skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be an extreme of denial.

original: de bas na gnyi ga ltar yang brjod par mi nus pa de'i phyir med pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga ltar yang brjod par mi nus pa de'i phyir med pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because it cannot be said to be either of the two, it is like a non-existent.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ni de la dmigs zhes bya ba gang zhig yang brjod pa de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes ni cung zad dmigs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ni de la dmigs zhes bya ba gang zhig yang brjod pa de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes ni cung zad dmigs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The vajra-like concentration is said to focus on that. But that also is not a slight observation of the non-conceptual supramundane wisdom of the buddhas.

original: 'on kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa la sngar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis goms pa de'i tshe la yang shes pa po'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid las gzung ba med kyang rang gi bdag nyid 'dzin bzhin du 'jug pa zhes nye bar brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa la sngar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis goms pa de'i tshe la yang shes pa po'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid las gzung ba med kyang rang gi bdag nyid 'dzin bzhin du 'jug pa zhes nye bar brtags pa yin no //
translated: However, since samsara is beginningless, it is imagined that at the time of the habit of the self as the grasper, there is no object, but the self as the nature of the knower engages in the habit of grasping its own nature.

original: 'di ni de mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the object of the sameness of that sameness and the nature of the grasper and the grasped.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa ni de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa ni de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The grasper and the grasped are called thatness.

original: mnyam pas mnyam pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyam pas mnyam pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said to be the sameness of sameness.

original: 'di ni 'di ltar 'jug pa ste don dam pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar 'jug pa ste don dam pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is how it engages: since there is no other phenomenon called the ultimate, this is called the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: khyod kyi cung zad skyes ma yin //
analyzed: khyod kyi cung zad skyes ma yin //
translated: Nothing whatsoever is produced

original: cung zad 'gag par byed pa yin //
analyzed: cung zad 'gag par byed pa yin //
translated: And nothing whatsoever is ceased.

original: snga ma ji ltar de bzhin phyis //
analyzed: snga ma ji ltar de bzhin phyis //
translated: As before, so after;

original: de bzhin nyid ni khyod kyis rtogs //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni khyod kyis rtogs //
translated: You have realized suchness.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis 'di rten pa //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis 'di rten pa //
translated: The noble ones are based on this,

original: bsgom pa la ni mi rten pas //
analyzed: bsgom pa la ni mi rten pas //
translated: not on meditation.

original: ye shes mtshan ma dang bral ba //
analyzed: ye shes mtshan ma dang bral ba //
translated: The wisdom free from signs

original: rnam pa gang gis yod ma yin //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist in any way.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la ni lha'i bu dag chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la ni lha'i bu dag chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: In this Blessed One, the sons of the gods say, “All phenomena are like illusions, like dreams.

original: ci srid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: ci srid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: Up to the perfect Buddha is like an illusion, like a dream.🔽The sons of the gods, I say, even nirvana is like an illusion, like a dream.”

original: lha'i bu dag mya ngan las 'das pa yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu zhes bdag smra'o zhes bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa de nyid kyis 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag mya ngan las 'das pa yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu zhes bdag smra'o zhes bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa de nyid kyis 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by just that.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos rnams so sor tshol ba ni //
analyzed: chos rnams so sor tshol ba ni //
translated: The investigation of phenomena

original: rtag pa zhes su brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes su brjod pa yin //
translated: is called “permanent.”

original: de bas don dam med pa ste //
analyzed: de bas don dam med pa ste //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate does not exist,

original: chos rnams kyi zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: as it is said of phenomena.

original: ci ltar don dam pa'i rnam pas mthong ba de'i stong pa nyid ni don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci ltar don dam pa'i rnam pas mthong ba de'i stong pa nyid ni don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: yang bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyang stong par @288b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyang stong par @288b 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, one might think, “If all phenomena are emptiness, then conditioned phenomena would be empty.

original: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs grangs med gsum gyis rnyed pa'i yang 'dus byas pa nyid kyi stong pa la byang chub nyid mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs grangs med gsum gyis rnyed pa'i yang 'dus byas pa nyid kyi stong pa la byang chub nyid mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But that is not reasonable, because enlightenment would not be possible through the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, which are attained through the three incalculable aeons of the accumulation of merit through generosity and so on.”

original: slar nges par byed de 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slar nges par byed de 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: One should ascertain this: there is no other phenomenon called “conditioned.”

original: gal te yod par 'gyur na 'dus byas zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod par 'gyur na 'dus byas zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it existed, it would not be called “conditioned.”

original: gang gi phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ba 'dus byas nas yang dag par 'byung zhing rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ba 'dus byas nas yang dag par 'byung zhing rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes brjod do //
translated: Because that which is called “conditioned” arises from conditions, and because it is created by causes and conditions, it is called “conditioned.”

original: gal te 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chas 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de ni gzhan rnams kyis byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chas 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de ni gzhan rnams kyis byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were some factor called “conditioned,” it would not be produced by others.

original: gang gi phyir don dam pa'i chos gang gis kyang byed mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam pa'i chos gang gis kyang byed mi nus so //
translated: Because no ultimate factor is capable of producing anything.

original: de bas na byis pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa las kun nas 'byung ba'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa ming de lta bur gyur pas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byis pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa las kun nas 'byung ba'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa ming de lta bur gyur pas brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the name “conditioned” is given to that which is produced by the imagination of the childish.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba gang zhig 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de rnams kyang tha snyad du yod pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba gang zhig 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de rnams kyang tha snyad du yod pa'o //
translated: Birth, duration, and cessation are the characteristics of the conditioned. They exist conventionally.

original: de bas na mtshan gzhi yang tha snyad du yod pa nyid kyis 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan gzhi yang tha snyad du yod pa nyid kyis 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the basis of those characteristics exists conventionally.

original: gang gi phyir don dam pa'i chos la tha snyad du yod pa'i mtshan nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam pa'i chos la tha snyad du yod pa'i mtshan nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not reasonable for an ultimate factor to have the characteristics of a conventional factor.

original: chos gcig la ni mtshan nyid gsum rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gcig la ni mtshan nyid gsum rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for a single factor to have three characteristics.

original: gal te don dam pa 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te don dam pa 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, it would be a conditioned phenomenon.

original: de bas na 'di ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, this is the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig brten nas de ma skyes //🔽gang gi bdag po khyod kyis gsungs //
analyzed: gang zhig brten nas de ma skyes // gang gi bdag po khyod kyis gsungs //
translated: What is dependent is not produced.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: You have taught that it is unconditioned.

original: slar bsam par byed de 'o na 'dus ma byas rnams ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin yod de 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: slar bsam par byed de 'o na 'dus ma byas rnams ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin yod de 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: One might think, “Well, the unconditioned exists as the nature of the ultimate because it is unconditioned.”

original: de med pa la don dam par dge ba thar pa 'byung zhes bya ba'i tshig gis don dam par dge ba mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi thob pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa la don dam par dge ba thar pa 'byung zhes bya ba'i tshig gis don dam par dge ba mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi thob pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “The ultimate is virtuous. Liberation arises from it,” this statement implies that the attainment of the ultimate virtue, nirvāṇa, will not occur for bodhisattvas.

original: slar 'di ltar nges par byed de 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slar 'di ltar nges par byed de 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to this, one should ascertain the following: the so-called unconditioned does not exist as a separate phenomenon.

original: 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba 'dus byas med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba 'dus byas med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: The so-called unconditioned is not described as the absence of the conditioned.

original: 'di lta ste don dam pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no //🔽'di lta ste nam mkha' ni 'dus byas @289a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste don dam pa nyid kyi phyir ma yin no // 'di lta ste nam mkha' ni 'dus byas @289a * //
translated: It is not so, because of the ultimate itself.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Space is the characteristic of the unconditioned.

original: 'di las gzhan grub pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'i yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan grub pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'i yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from this, there is no other characteristic of the established.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The cessation due to deliberation is the characteristic of the non-existence of all conditioned things.

original: de bzhin du so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa yang 'dus byas kyi chos 'jigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa yang 'dus byas kyi chos 'jigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the cessation not due to deliberation is the characteristic of the fear of conditioned things.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi lugs kyis kyang 'di dag don dam pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi lugs kyis kyang 'di dag don dam pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Therefore, even according to the Śrāvakas, these are not of the nature of the ultimate,

original: stong pa nyid kyi tshul gyis lta smos ci dgos /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi tshul gyis lta smos ci dgos /
translated: how much less so according to the method of emptiness?

original: de rnams la stong pa nyid rtogs pa 'di ni 'dus ma byas pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams la stong pa nyid rtogs pa 'di ni 'dus ma byas pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The realization of emptiness in regard to them is called the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge ba gnyis ni thob don du //
analyzed: dge ba gnyis ni thob don du //
translated: For the sake of attaining the two virtues,

original: zhes bya ba la dge ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dge ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: Virtue is both compounded and uncompounded.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di las ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di las ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: What has been said in this Blessed Lady?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'phel ba dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'grib pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la 'di ltar 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'phel ba dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'grib pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la 'di ltar 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not occur to the bodhisattva-mahāsattva that this perfection of giving increases or that this perfection of giving decreases.

original: 'on kyang slar 'di la 'di ltar 'byung ste 'di ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang slar 'di la 'di ltar 'byung ste 'di ni ming tsam mo //
translated: But rather, it occurs to him thus: This is mere name.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad do //
translated: the perfection of giving, and so on.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i don gyi slar ci zhig 'phel ba'am 'grib pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i don gyi slar ci zhig 'phel ba'am 'grib pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, for the inexpressible meaning, what increase or decrease could there be?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is not so.

original: des na sbyin pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi dge ba la sogs pa rnams la yang dmigs pa 'jug pa nyid kyis skyon dang bcas pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don dam pa'i dge ba 'dus ma byas kyi 'gog pa la mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis skyon med pa la stong pa nyid gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na sbyin pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi dge ba la sogs pa rnams la yang dmigs pa 'jug pa nyid kyis skyon dang bcas pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don dam pa'i dge ba 'dus ma byas kyi 'gog pa la mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis skyon med pa la stong pa nyid gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, with respect to conditioned virtues such as generosity and so on, since they are objects of observation, they are flawed, and with respect to the ultimate virtue of unconditioned cessation, since it is not an object of observation, it is flawless.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /🔽skyon dang bcas dang skyon med pa'i //
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa / skyon dang bcas dang skyon med pa'i //
translated: This is what is said:🔽Because there is no increase or decrease

original: 'phel dang 'grib pa med pa'i phyir //🔽'dus byas 'dus ma byas rnams kyi //
analyzed: 'phel dang 'grib pa med pa'i phyir // 'dus byas 'dus ma byas rnams kyi //
translated: of the flawed and the flawless,🔽the virtues of the conditioned and the unconditioned

original: dge ba rnams ni 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba rnams ni 'gag pa'o //
translated: are stopped.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is like that.

original: slar byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: slar byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na de'i tshe /
translated: The bodhisattva should think in this way: If all phenomena are emptiness,

original: sems can rnams gang zhig 'khor ba thog ma med pa la dus gsum du @289b 'khor bar 'khor ba gang dag gi sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen nas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams gang zhig 'khor ba thog ma med pa la dus gsum du @289b 'khor bar 'khor ba gang dag gi sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen nas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The Bhagavān is called omniscient because he knows the mental activities of those sentient beings who have been wandering in cyclic existence without any beginning in terms of the three times.

original: de rnams dus gsum du son pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams dus gsum du son pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: They exist in terms of the three times.

original: slar 'di ltar nges par byed de sems can gcig nyid la mtha' gsum la ming gsum 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: slar 'di ltar nges par byed de sems can gcig nyid la mtha' gsum la ming gsum 'byung ba yin te /
translated: One should ascertain this point as follows: In the case of a single sentient being, three names occur in terms of the three times.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are called future, present, and past.

original: gal te sems can don dam par yod par 'gyur na ming gcig nyid yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sems can don dam par yod par 'gyur na ming gcig nyid yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If sentient beings existed ultimately, only one name would exist.

original: de bas na 'das pa'i mtha' yang mtha' las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'das pa'i mtha' yang mtha' las 'das pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the past limit is beyond limits.

original: de bzhin du gnyi ga la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyi ga la yang ngo //
translated: The same applies to both the future and the present.

original: de'i stong pa nyid ni mtha' las 'das pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid ni mtha' las 'das pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: Its emptiness is the emptiness of what is beyond limits.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rtag tu sems can la phan phyir //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can la phan phyir //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Always for the sake of sentient beings.

original: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de /🔽byis pa rnams la 'khor ba ring //
analyzed: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de / byis pa rnams la 'khor ba ring //
translated: One should reflect in the following manner:🔽The Fortunate One has said:🔽“Monks, this cyclic existence is without a beginning or end.”

original: zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa dge slong dag 'khor ba 'di ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa zhes bya ba ste de bas na 'khor ba yod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa dge slong dag 'khor ba 'di ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa zhes bya ba ste de bas na 'khor ba yod do //
translated: Thus, cyclic existence exists.

original: de yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang de'i sgo nas chos thams cad yod pa zhes thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang de'i sgo nas chos thams cad yod pa zhes thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Since it exists, cyclic existence and all the entities that are included in it exist.

original: yang 'di ltar nges par byed de 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni chos 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te thog ma dang tha ma med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: yang 'di ltar nges par byed de 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni chos 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te thog ma dang tha ma med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: One should also reflect in the following manner: Cyclic existence does not exist as an entity, as indicated by the phrase “without a beginning or end.”

original: gal te 'khor ba zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de'i thog ma yang yod par 'gyur ba dang tha ma yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de'i thog ma yang yod par 'gyur ba dang tha ma yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If cyclic existence existed as an entity, then it would have a beginning and it would have an end.

original: thog ma med pa dang tha ma med pa yod par 'gyur ba 'ga' ni mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa dang tha ma med pa yod par 'gyur ba 'ga' ni mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not seen that anything exists that is without a beginning or end.

original: 'on te thog ma dang tha ma dag med na dbus ma bkag pa'i phyir yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te thog ma dang tha ma dag med na dbus ma bkag pa'i phyir yod do zhe na /
translated: But if it has no beginning or end, it exists because its middle is not refuted?

original: gang gi thog ma dang tha ma dag med pa de'i ci ltar dbus yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi thog ma dang tha ma dag med pa de'i ci ltar dbus yod par 'gyur /
translated: How can that which has no beginning or end have a middle?

original: thog ma dang tha ma dag la ltos nas dbus zhes bya ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma dag la ltos nas dbus zhes bya ba yod pa yin no //
translated: The middle is said to exist in dependence on the beginning and end.

original: gal te 'khor ba med na gang du sems can rnams 'khor zhe na 'khor ba ni 'di nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin te gal te la la zhig 'khor bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba med na gang du sems can rnams 'khor zhe na 'khor ba ni 'di nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin te gal te la la zhig 'khor bar gyur na /
translated: If samsara does not exist, where do sentient beings cycle? Samsara itself does not exist ultimately. If someone were to cycle in samsara,

original: de ni rtag par 'gyur ram mi rtag par 'gyur rtag pa ni 'khor ba ma yin te de mi 'gyur pa'i phyir 'khor ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag par 'gyur ram mi rtag par 'gyur rtag pa ni 'khor ba ma yin te de mi 'gyur pa'i phyir 'khor ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: would he be permanent or impermanent? He would not be permanent because it is untenable that a permanent being cycles, since he would not change.

original: mi rtag pa yang 'khor ba ma yin te skad cig ma de dang der 'jig pa rnams la gang gi @290a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang 'khor ba ma yin te skad cig ma de dang der 'jig pa rnams la gang gi @290a * //
translated: Nor would he be impermanent, because it is untenable that an impermanent being cycles, since those who disintegrate in this moment and that moment

original: 'khor ba 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: would not cycle.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /🔽rtag pa'i 'khor ba med pa ste //
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa / rtag pa'i 'khor ba med pa ste //
translated: As it is said:🔽There is no permanent samsara,

original: mi rtag pa la 'khor ba med //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la 'khor ba med //
translated: Nor is there an impermanent samsara.

original: rmi lam bzhin du 'khor ba gsungs //
analyzed: rmi lam bzhin du 'khor ba gsungs //
translated: Samsara is said to be like a dream.

original: khyod kyis de nyid rig pa mchog / de bas na thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis de nyid rig pa mchog / de bas na thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since it is the supreme knowledge of reality, therefore, because it is without beginning and end, samsara is said to be nonexistent.

original: de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of what is without beginning or end.

original: stong pa nyid gnyis po 'di ni mdo 'di las /
analyzed: stong pa nyid gnyis po 'di ni mdo 'di las /
translated: These two kinds of emptiness are taught in this sutra:

original: koo shi ka gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i bskal par gnas par 'gyur zhing sems can sems can zhes tshig tu brjod kyang 'on kyang der sems can 'ga' zhig skye ba'am 'gag par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: koo shi ka gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i bskal par gnas par 'gyur zhing sems can sems can zhes tshig tu brjod kyang 'on kyang der sems can 'ga' zhig skye ba'am 'gag par 'gyur ram /
translated: Kausika, if the Tathagata were to remain for the duration of an eon equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River and were to say the word “sentient being,” “sentient being,” would any sentient being arise or cease?🔽Sakra said:

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /🔽de ni ma lags te zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa / de ni ma lags te zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan to //
translated: “No, Blessed One.”

original: skye med 'gag pa med pa'am //
analyzed: skye med 'gag pa med pa'am //
translated: The nonarising and noncessation

original: sems can zhes bya sogs pas gsal //
