analyzed: sems can zhes bya sogs pas gsal //
translated: of sentient beings and so on are taught.

original: sems can dang ni 'khor ba la //
analyzed: sems can dang ni 'khor ba la //
translated: Since sentient beings and samsara

original: des na stong nyid bden par bstan //
analyzed: des na stong nyid bden par bstan //
translated: are empty, emptiness is taught to be real.

original: yang ci skad du gsungs pa /🔽'khor ba mi 'dor don du yang //
analyzed: yang ci skad du gsungs pa / 'khor ba mi 'dor don du yang //
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Samsara is not to be rejected, even for the sake of nirvana.”

original: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te dge ba'i chos thams cad stong pa yin na de'i tshe ci ltar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba ji srid gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te dge ba'i chos thams cad stong pa yin na de'i tshe ci ltar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba ji srid gnas par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, one should think in this way: If all virtuous qualities are empty, then how does the Bhagavat remain for as long as samsara lasts with the Enjoyment Body?

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la yang dge ba rnams yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la yang dge ba rnams yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat has virtuous qualities even in attaining nirvana.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni bsod nams dag gi rgyu mthun pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams chud mi 'dza' ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni bsod nams dag gi rgyu mthun pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams chud mi 'dza' ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The Tathagata is not subject to the destruction of the roots of virtue that are the cause of merit.”

original: de bas na dor ba ni rnam par skul bar byed pa'i phyir 'dus byas gzhan rnams la dor ba yod kyang dge ba'i chos rnams mi 'dor ba'i ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na dor ba ni rnam par skul bar byed pa'i phyir 'dus byas gzhan rnams la dor ba yod kyang dge ba'i chos rnams mi 'dor ba'i ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the rejection of other conditioned things is for the sake of encouraging, the virtuous qualities do exist, even though they are not rejected.

original: slar nges par byed de mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ni re zhig cung zad yod pa ma yin te slar de la brten pa rnams kyi chud mi zos ci'i phyir yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: slar nges par byed de mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ni re zhig cung zad yod pa ma yin te slar de la brten pa rnams kyi chud mi zos ci'i phyir yod par 'gyur /
translated: And again, nirvana definitely does not exist in the least, so why would it exist as the nonexpiration of those who rely on it?🔽

original: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid gang gis kyang chos gzhan nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //🔽@290b de nyid kyi phyir dngos por brjod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'gog pa dang 'du byed thams cad nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis brjod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid gang gis kyang chos gzhan nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi nus so // @290b de nyid kyi phyir dngos por brjod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'gog pa dang 'du byed thams cad nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis brjod de /
translated: Again, nirvana is definitely not a thing, because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.

original: 'on te yod par gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa med pa la ci'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba mi 'byung /🔽de bas na de rnams kyi skye ba gzhan 'gog par 'gyur ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa nyid ce na /
analyzed: 'on te yod par gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa med pa la ci'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba mi 'byung /🔽de bas na de rnams kyi skye ba gzhan 'gog par 'gyur ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa nyid ce na /
translated: Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a thing because it is not tenable that a thing is not perceived.🔽Nirvana is not a non-thing because it is not tenable that a non-thing is perceived.

original: 'di ltar rigs pa ma yin te 'du byed rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad yod pa ma yin te rtag pa rnams la dus thams cad du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs pa ma yin te 'du byed rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad yod pa ma yin te rtag pa rnams la dus thams cad du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that, because there is no such thing as the nirvana of compounded things, because things that are permanent do not change at all,

original: mi rtag pa rnams la yang cung zos pa rnams la yang skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnams la yang cung zos pa rnams la yang skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and things that are impermanent do not arise again.

original: de bas na rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa la mya ngan las 'das pa ni cung zad byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa la mya ngan las 'das pa ni cung zad byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, nirvana does not do anything to non-arising that exists by intrinsic nature.

original: 'on te yang 'gyur na slar 'du byed gzhan rnams la de'i rgyud la skye ba la gegs byed ce na /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'gyur na slar 'du byed gzhan rnams la de'i rgyud la skye ba la gegs byed ce na /
translated: But if it did, then it would prevent the arising of other compounded things in its continuum.

original: de yang yod bam yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod bam yin te /
translated: But that is not the case,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa dang phung po'i sa bon ma lus par tshig pa'i phyir slar mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa dang phung po'i sa bon ma lus par tshig pa'i phyir slar mi skyed pa'o //
translated: because the transcendent path completely burns up the seeds of the afflictions and the aggregates, and they do not arise again.

original: rang bzhin can gyi skye ba med pa de la ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin can gyi skye ba med pa de la ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: That non-arising that exists by intrinsic nature is called “nirvana.”

original: de bas na nyan thos kyi lugs kyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan cung zad yod pa ma yin na stong pa nyid kyi lugs kyis lta smos ci dgos mya ngan las 'das pa med pa nyid kyis de la brten pa'i yang dge
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos kyi lugs kyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan cung zad yod pa ma yin na stong pa nyid kyi lugs kyis lta smos ci dgos mya ngan las 'das pa med pa nyid kyis de la brten pa'i yang dge
translated: Therefore, if even in the Śrāvaka system there is no so-called nirvāṇa that is some other thing, what need is there to mention the system of emptiness?

original: ba mi 'dor ba'i ngo bo nyid rnams kyi med pa nyid ces bya ba 'di ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba mi 'dor ba'i ngo bo nyid rnams kyi med pa nyid ces bya ba 'di ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since there is no nirvāṇa, the nonrejection of the entities of virtue are also nonexistent. This is called “the emptiness of the nonrejectable.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di las ni ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di las ni ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: In this Bhagavatī it is said:

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gang yang bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa de yang stong pa nyid ces bya ba nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gang yang bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa de yang stong pa nyid ces bya ba nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, the merit that the bodhisattvas create is said to be emptiness.

original: de bas na de nyid kyis dge ba rnams spyir stong pa nyid mi zad par dor ba med pa'i ngo bo rnams kyi yang stong pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid kyis dge ba rnams spyir stong pa nyid mi zad par dor ba med pa'i ngo bo rnams kyi yang stong pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by that very statement, the emptiness of the nonrejectable is stated in general for the virtues that are the nature of the nonrejectable.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge ba rnams kyi stong nyid la //
analyzed: dge ba rnams kyi stong nyid la //
translated: The emptiness of virtues

original: de 'gro mi zang pa de bzhin //
analyzed: de 'gro mi zang pa de bzhin //
translated: is the going of the world, and it is not exhausted.

original: rtag pa nyid de dbye ba rnams /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid de dbye ba rnams /
translated: Eternity is the divisions

original: stong pa nyid la de gang du //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la de gang du // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in emptiness, and where is that?

original: slar byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar @291a * //🔽bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad ni stong pa yin pa gang zhig 'di sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang gang zhig sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bsam
analyzed: slar byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar @291a * // bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad ni stong pa yin pa gang zhig 'di sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang gang zhig sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bsam
translated: The bodhisattva should reflect in this way:

original: pa dang bag la nyal dang lhag par mos pa rnams dang rigs shes pa la sogs pa de rnams rig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa dang bag la nyal dang lhag par mos pa rnams dang rigs shes pa la sogs pa de rnams rig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “If all phenomena are empty, then the phenomena of attachment, etc. which are the natures of sentient beings, and the thoughts, latent tendencies, and aspirations of sentient beings, and the natures of sentient beings, and the knowledge of the lineages, etc. of sentient beings, would not be known.”

original: gang dag gi dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsam pa dang bag la nyal mkhyen pa dang lhag par mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsam pa dang bag la nyal mkhyen pa dang lhag par mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: By whose power do the Buddhas engage in the qualities of a Buddha, such as the knowledge of the aspirations and latent tendencies of sentient beings, the knowledge of the various superior resolves of sentient beings, and so on?

original: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de /
analyzed: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de /
translated: One should think in this way:

original: chos rnams 'di dag ni chos gzhan nyid du brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams 'di dag ni chos gzhan nyid du brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to express these dharmas as other dharmas.

original: gang gi phyir sems kyi rgyud la 'gro ba gnas skabs kyi khyad par 'di rnams so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems kyi rgyud la 'gro ba gnas skabs kyi khyad par 'di rnams so //
translated: Because these differences in the states of sentient beings are in the continuum of mind.

original: de bas na 'di dag ni chos gzhan nyid du med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag ni chos gzhan nyid du med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, these do not exist as other dharmas at all. This is the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: gang zhig yang brjod pa rigs ni rang bzhin te zhes bya ba de ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig yang brjod pa rigs ni rang bzhin te zhes bya ba de ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And what is expressed as the inherent nature of the lineage is the primary [cause].

original: gang gi phyir rigs rnam par dag pa'i phyir ci srid du byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jug go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs rnam par dag pa'i phyir ci srid du byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jug go //
translated: Because the lineage is purified, the bodhisattvas engage [in the path] for as long as [they are on the path].

original: de la yang mig gi skye mched nas ci srid yid kyi skye mched ces bya ba thog ma med pa nas grub pa skye mched drug gi khyad par ni rigs zhes bya bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang mig gi skye mched nas ci srid yid kyi skye mched ces bya ba thog ma med pa nas grub pa skye mched drug gi khyad par ni rigs zhes bya bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the special six sense bases, which have existed since beginningless time and are called the eye sense base up to the mind sense base, are called the “lineage.”

original: 'on kyang der yang snying rje dang shes rab nyid gtso cher shin tu rnam par dag pa 'gro ba ci srid du 'gro ba'i don sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir snying rje dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs zhes bya bar brjod🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang der yang snying rje dang shes rab nyid gtso cher shin tu rnam par dag pa 'gro ba ci srid du 'gro ba'i don sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir snying rje dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs zhes bya bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, in this case, compassion and wisdom are the most important, and they are extremely pure, accomplishing the welfare of beings for as long as there are beings. Therefore, compassion and wisdom are called the “lineage” of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la ni gang zhig rnam par shes pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid brjod pa de nyid kyis rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la ni gang zhig rnam par shes pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid brjod pa de nyid kyis rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang bstan to //
translated: In this Bhagavatī, the emptiness of consciousness itself is described, and by that very description, the emptiness of nature is also taught.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /🔽nang gi bdag nyid stong nyid la //
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa / nang gi bdag nyid stong nyid la //
translated: As it is said:🔽The emptiness of the inner nature

original: rang bzhin gyi yang stong pa nyid //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi yang stong pa nyid //
translated: is also the emptiness of nature.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo'i rigs //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo'i rigs //
translated: The lineage is the nature of consciousness.

original: snying rje shes rab bdag nyid 'dod //🔽ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje shes rab bdag nyid 'dod // ces bya ba'o //
translated: Compassion and wisdom are its nature.

original: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de gang zhig chos rnams kyi @291b mtshan nyid 'di rnams gzugs su bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs so //
analyzed: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de gang zhig chos rnams kyi @291b mtshan nyid 'di rnams gzugs su bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs so //
translated: One should reflect in this way: “If these characteristics of phenomena exist, then form, etc., would exist, since the characteristic of form is that which is capable of materiality,

original: nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the characteristic of feeling is that which is experienced, and so on.

original: de rnams yod pa la gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams yod pa la gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if these characteristics do not exist, then form, etc., would not exist.”

original: slar 'di ltar nges par byed de /
analyzed: slar 'di ltar nges par byed de /
translated: One should ascertain this in the following way:

original: gal te mtshan nyid 'di rnams ni mtshan gzhi las tha dad pa de rnams kyang mtshan gzhi las sngar nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid 'di rnams ni mtshan gzhi las tha dad pa de rnams kyang mtshan gzhi las sngar nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “If these characteristics exist separately from the basis of those characteristics, then they would arise prior to the basis of those characteristics.

original: de'i tshe mtshan gzhi de mtshan nyid med pa nyid phyis skye ba de'i phyir mtshan nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan gzhi de mtshan nyid med pa nyid phyis skye ba de'i phyir mtshan nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: At that time, since the basis of those characteristics would be without characteristics, what would characteristics do for it?

original: 'on te phyis mtshan nyid rnams yin na de'i tshe mtshan nyid skyes pa'i snga rol tu mtshan gzhi de mtshan nyid med pa de'i phyir phyis kyang 'di'i mtshan nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'on te phyis mtshan nyid rnams yin na de'i tshe mtshan nyid skyes pa'i snga rol tu mtshan gzhi de mtshan nyid med pa de'i phyir phyis kyang 'di'i mtshan nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: But if the characteristics exist later, then prior to the arising of the characteristics, the characterized would be without characteristics. Therefore, what would its characteristics do for it later?

original: 'on te mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag la lhan cig nyid du 'jug pa de'i tshe de dag sngar so sor ma mthong ba dag la mtshan gzhi ni 'di yin mtshan nyid kyang 'di yin zhes bya ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi de mtshan nyid🔽med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag la lhan cig nyid du 'jug pa de'i tshe de dag sngar so sor ma mthong ba dag la mtshan gzhi ni 'di yin mtshan nyid kyang 'di yin zhes bya ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi de mtshan nyid med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the characterized and the characteristics exist simultaneously, then since they would not have been seen separately earlier, the characterized and the characteristics would be indistinguishable. Therefore, the characterized would be without characteristics.

original: 'on te mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag tha mi dad pa nyid yin na de'i tshe mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid ci zhig brjod par 'gyur te mtshan gzhi ma grub pa la ni de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyang ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag tha mi dad pa nyid yin na de'i tshe mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid ci zhig brjod par 'gyur te mtshan gzhi ma grub pa la ni de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyang ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the characterized and the characteristics are not different, then what is characterized and what is a characteristic? Since it is not different from the characterized, the characteristic would not be established if the characterized is not established.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las gzhan na //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi las gzhan na //
translated: If the characteristic is different from the characterized,

original: gal te mtshan gzhi mtshan med 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te mtshan gzhi mtshan med 'gyur //
translated: then the characterized would be without a characteristic.

original: gzhan nyid med la de dag med //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med la de dag med //
translated: If they are not different, then they do not exist.

original: khyod kyis rnam par gsal bar gsungs //
analyzed: khyod kyis rnam par gsal bar gsungs //
translated: You have clearly taught this.

original: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid des grol ba //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid des grol ba //
translated: The characterized is liberated from that characteristic.

original: ngag gi brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: ngag gi brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: It is the abandonment of verbal expression.

original: khyod kyi ye shes spyan gyis ni //
analyzed: khyod kyi ye shes spyan gyis ni //
translated: With your eye of wisdom

original: 'gro ba 'di ni zhi bar gzigs //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di ni zhi bar gzigs //
translated: you see this world as peaceful.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid rnams kyang yongs su brtags pa'i chos kyis yongs su brtags pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid rnams kyang yongs su brtags pa'i chos kyis yongs su brtags pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the characteristics are also imagined, and the imagined is called “empty of its own characteristic.”

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhig yang gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' 'bad par byed pa de rnams la yang dngos po'i lta ba spangs pa'i don du byang chub sems dpas rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid🔽la bsam par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhig yang gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' 'bad par byed pa de rnams la yang dngos po'i lta ba spangs pa'i don du byang chub sems dpas rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid🔽la bsam par byed de /
translated: The thirty-two marks of the great person of the buddhas, for the sake of which the bodhisattvas strive, are also imagined by the bodhisattvas to be empty of their own characteristics in order to abandon the view of real entities.

original: stong pa nyid gsum po 'di dag ni mdo las gzugs la @292a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gsum po 'di dag ni mdo las gzugs la @292a * //
translated: These three kinds of emptiness should be understood as taught by the Lord himself in the sutra, where he shows that form, etc.

original: sogs pa rnams nyid med par bstan par mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bstan pa zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa rnams nyid med par bstan par mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bstan pa zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: are not nonexistent.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs sogs med dang de lus dang // gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig pa ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs med dang de lus dang // gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig pa ni //
translated: The nonexistence of form, etc., its body, and the characteristic of its abiding and perishing

original: don ni go ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don ni go ba zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to be the meaning of emptiness.

original: yang 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad med pa yin na de'i tshe stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams med do //
analyzed: yang 'di ltar bsam par byed de gal te chos thams cad med pa yin na de'i tshe stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams med do //
translated: Moreover, one should consider this: if all things are nonexistent, then the powers, the fearlessnesses, etc.

original: snying rje dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams kyang med pa de'i tshe gang thob pa'i phyir gang 'bad par 'gyur /
analyzed: snying rje dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams kyang med pa de'i tshe gang thob pa'i phyir gang 'bad par 'gyur /
translated: are nonexistent, and the bodhisattva’s practices of compassion, generosity, etc. are nonexistent. In that case, what is it that one strives to attain?

original: de bas na rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams yod do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams yod do //
translated: Therefore, the dharmas of purification exist.

original: de yod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyis kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyis kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And since they exist, the dharmas of affliction also exist.

original: yang nges par byed de gal te don dam pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod pa yin na de rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang nges par byed de gal te don dam pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod pa yin na de rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it is ascertained that if any ultimate phenomenon exists, it would be permanent.

original: gang gi phyir 'gyur ba dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni don dam pa'i rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gyur ba dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni don dam pa'i rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because phenomena that change and transform are not ultimate.

original: de rnams kyi 'di nyid bden pa nyid dang don dam pa nyid gang zhig phyin ci ma log par gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'di nyid bden pa nyid dang don dam pa nyid gang zhig phyin ci ma log par gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is their reality, their ultimate reality, which is called “unmistaken.”

original: de lta na gal te rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams don dam pa yin na de'i tshe de rnams sngar yang yod pa'i phyir 'khor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gal te rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams don dam pa yin na de'i tshe de rnams sngar yang yod pa'i phyir 'khor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the phenomena of purification are ultimate, then since they existed previously, there would be no cyclic existence.

original: 'on te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams don dam pa yin na de lta na ni thar pa nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams don dam pa yin na de lta na ni thar pa nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the phenomena of affliction are ultimate, then liberation would not be established.

original: de bas na chos 'di rnams ni kun du brtags pa ste 'gyur ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos 'di rnams ni kun du brtags pa ste 'gyur ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, these phenomena are imagined because they change. This is called “the emptiness of all phenomena.”

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: What is said?

original: dbang byed bya ba dang bral stong //
analyzed: dbang byed bya ba dang bral stong //
translated: The master of the self is empty of action.

original: sgyu ma bzhin du rkyen las 'byung //🔽mgon po khyod kyis chos rnams kun //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du rkyen las 'byung // mgon po khyod kyis chos rnams kun //
translated: Like an illusion, it arises from conditions.🔽Lord, you have clearly shown

original: rang bzhin med par gsal bar mdzad //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par gsal bar mdzad //
translated: that all phenomena are without intrinsic nature.

original: mdo 'di las ni /🔽ci skad du gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das mngon par grub pa las gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni / ci skad du gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das mngon par grub pa las gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: In this sutra,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams ni dmigs pa ma lags zhes bya ba de nyid kyis 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams ni dmigs pa ma lags zhes bya ba de nyid kyis 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: it is taught by the statement, “Bhagavat, moreover, the phenomena of the buddhas and the phenomena of the bodhisattvas are not apprehended.”

original: yang ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: Also, it is taught by the statement,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams @292b la mi mthong ngo //🔽shes bya la sogs kyis bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams @292b la mi mthong ngo // shes bya la sogs kyis bstan pa //
translated: “The phenomena of the buddhas are not seen in the phenomena of the bodhisattvas.”

original: stobs bcu la sogs stong pa ste //
analyzed: stobs bcu la sogs stong pa ste //
translated: The emptiness of the ten powers and so on

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is taught by the phrase “and so on.”

original: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de nang stong pa nyid la gang zhig 'di bdag la mi dmigs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar 'di ltar bsam par byed de nang stong pa nyid la gang zhig 'di bdag la mi dmigs pa gsungs pa /
translated: Again, one should think as follows. In the emptiness of internal phenomena, it is said that the self is not apprehended.

original: de la mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan yod de gal te mi dmigs pa med par gyur na bdag dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na yang nges par byed de mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan rigs pa ma yin te gal te mi
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan yod de gal te mi dmigs pa med par gyur na bdag dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na yang nges par byed de mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan rigs pa ma yin te gal te mi
translated: If you say that the self is not observed because of the existence of another factor called nonobservation, then it is definitely not tenable to state that the self is not observed due to the existence of another factor called nonobservation.🔽

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba yod par gyur na de'i so sor dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba yod par gyur na de'i so sor dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: As for what is called “non-apprehension,” it is a different thing. If non-apprehension did not exist, the self would be apprehended. But it is not reasonable that there be a different thing called “non-apprehension.” If there were a thing called “non-apprehension,” it would be apprehended as such.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ci ltar mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ste 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ci ltar mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ste 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But how could the nature of apprehension be called “non-apprehension”? Because it is contradictory.

original: de nyid dmigs pa dang de nyid mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dmigs pa dang de nyid mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory to say that it is apprehension and that it is non-apprehension.

original: 'on te mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa med ces bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa med ces bya'o snyam na /
translated: But perhaps you think that non-apprehension is the apprehension of non-apprehension.

original: de lta na ni mi dmigs par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni mi dmigs par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, because it would be the apprehension of non-apprehension, it would not be non-apprehension.

original: de bas na mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no different thing called “non-apprehension.”

original: bdag nyid la dmigs pa med pa ni de dang der mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid la dmigs pa med pa ni de dang der mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of non-apprehension.🔽In this sutra, the Buddha taught the Dharma in order to abandon the great view of self and the view of sentient beings.

original: mdo 'di las ni bdag tu lta ba chen po dang sems can du lta ba spangs pa'i phyir chos bstan pa mdzad par 'gyur zhes bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa de nyid kyis bdag la gdong ma nas zhi ba nyid gsungs kyi de'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni bdag tu lta ba chen po dang sems can du lta ba spangs pa'i phyir chos bstan pa mdzad par 'gyur zhes bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa de nyid kyis bdag la gdong ma nas zhi ba nyid gsungs kyi de'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba
translated: He taught that the self is originally peaceful, but he did not teach that the self is an object of apprehension.

original: ni chos 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni chos 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no such thing as the self.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /🔽bdag sogs lta ba chad pa ni //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / bdag sogs lta ba chad pa ni //
translated: As it is said:🔽The great view of self and so on

original: chen po'i gang zhig byed 'gyur ba //🔽de phyir gang zag bdag med ni //
analyzed: chen po'i gang zhig byed 'gyur ba // de phyir gang zag bdag med ni //
translated: Is what we must abandon.🔽Therefore the Bhagavān taught

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du gsungs //
translated: The selflessness of persons.

original: yang 'di ltar bsam par byed de /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar bsam par byed de /
translated: We should consider the following.

original: chos rnams thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces brjod pa yin te /
translated: All phenomena are said to be essentially unreal.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid du 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid du 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted that the non-existence of things is their intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir chos rnams ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir chos rnams ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to establish the intrinsic reality of non-existence, it is said that things exist with the intrinsic reality of non-existence.

original: 'on te chos rnams kyi gal te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de lta na ni 'dir chos rnams med ces bya ba nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na de la thob pa gang yin thob pa ni yod de gang gi phyir kan du brtags @293a * //
analyzed: 'on te chos rnams kyi gal te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de lta na ni 'dir chos rnams med ces bya ba nyid brjod par 'gyur ro // de bas na de la thob pa gang yin thob pa ni yod de gang gi phyir kan du brtags @293a * //
translated: But if the intrinsic reality of things is non-existence, then it would be said that things do not exist here.

original: ba'i chos rnams thams cad ni rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med ces bya ba khas len par byed par gyur pa la kun brtags pa'i chos de rnams nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ni chos rnams kyi
analyzed: ba'i chos rnams thams cad ni rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med ces bya ba khas len par byed par gyur pa la kun brtags pa'i chos de rnams nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ni chos rnams kyi
translated: Therefore, since it is accepted that all imagined things do not exist in any way whatsoever, the statement “those imagined things exist with the intrinsic reality of non-existence” is a contradiction.

original: cha gcig gis yod pa gsal bar byed pa de bas na thob pa chen po nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: cha gcig gis yod pa gsal bar byed pa de bas na thob pa chen po nyid do zhe na /
translated: One part of it is the illumination of existence. Therefore, it is a great attainment.

original: yang nges par byed de chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba tshig 'di'i don gang yin /
analyzed: yang nges par byed de chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba tshig 'di'i don gang yin /
translated: But it is certain that this is not so. What is the meaning of the words “all things are essentially inexistent”?

original: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba 'dis kun du brtags pa'i chos rnams dang yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba 'dis kun du brtags pa'i chos rnams dang yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams brjod pa yin te /
translated: “All things” refers to imagined and absolute things.

original: de la kun du brtags pa'i chos rnams ni med pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: de la kun du brtags pa'i chos rnams ni med pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces brjod do //
translated: Since imagined things do not exist at all, they are said to be essentially utterly inexistent.

original: yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de des na dngos po las log pa'i rnam pa dngos po med pa zhes bya ba don 'di la bzung nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de des na dngos po las log pa'i rnam pa dngos po med pa zhes bya ba don 'di la bzung nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces brjod do //
translated: Absolute things are the reality of thusness. Therefore, in the sense of being the opposite of existence, they are said to be essentially inexistent.

original: 'byung bas na dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'byung bas na dngos po ste /
translated: Existence is that which arises.

original: de bas na 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni dngos po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni dngos po zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, conditioned things are called entities.

original: de las bzlog pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya bas de bzhin nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya bas de bzhin nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that, the aspect that is inexpressible and to be realized personally, is called the reality of non-entityness. Thus, reality is taught.

original: de lta na ni chos rnams yod pa dang med pa 'di gnyis kyis bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni chos rnams yod pa dang med pa 'di gnyis kyis bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In this way, the teaching is called the teaching of the existence and non-existence of things.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /🔽gang la med pa de des stong pa zhes bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //🔽gang yang 'dir lhag mar gyur pa de 'dir yod pa zhes ci lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid cher so sor 'brel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po med
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa / gang la med pa de des stong pa zhes bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du shes so // gang yang 'dir lhag mar gyur pa de 'dir yod pa zhes ci lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid cher so sor 'brel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po med
translated: As the Bhagavān said:🔽“Whatever is non-existent in that, that is its emptiness.”🔽“Whatever remains here, that exists here.”

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the characteristic of the reality of non-entityness of all things is well-connected. This is called the emptiness of the reality of non-entityness.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di las ci skad du gsungs pa chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis bden pa ste //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di las ci skad du gsungs pa chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis bden pa ste //
translated: Whatever is taught in this Blessed Lady, all phenomena are also by nature true.

original: de ltar na rab 'byor ci srid du chos thams cad kyi dngos po ma byas pa de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rab 'byor ci srid du chos thams cad kyi dngos po ma byas pa de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, for as long as all phenomena are not made into things, the Tathāgata is said to have fully awakened to them.

original: ma byas pa ni dngos po'i ngo bos sam dngos po med pa'i ngo bos ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa ni dngos po'i ngo bos sam dngos po med pa'i ngo bos ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Not made means not arisen by the nature of things or by the nature of non-things.

original: des na 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: des na 'di gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, this is taught.

original: ji skad du @293b gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du @293b gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa //
translated: All phenomena are unborn.

original: shes bya grags mdzad rnam pa des //
analyzed: shes bya grags mdzad rnam pa des //
translated: The knower of the world has proclaimed this.

original: chos kyi bdag med bstan pa ste //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med bstan pa ste //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is taught.

original: de nyid rig pas rnam kun du //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rig pas rnam kun du // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By that very one who knows reality, in every way.

original: rnam pa kun du zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo'am dngos po med pa'i ngo bos kyang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo'am dngos po med pa'i ngo bos kyang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In every way means that even by the nature of things or by the nature of non-things, the absence of intrinsic nature of phenomena is taught.

original: mdo 'di la stong pa nyid rnams bsgrub pa'i don du rigs pa rnams ma brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdo 'di la stong pa nyid rnams bsgrub pa'i don du rigs pa rnams ma brjod pa nyid do //
translated: In this sutra, the arguments are not stated for the purpose of establishing emptiness.

original: 'on kyang mdo gzhan las gsungs pa so sor mtshams sbyar bar bya ba gang zhig slob dpon rnams kyis nye bar bstan par mdzad pa des na 'dir 'thad pa rnams kyi cha tsam bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang mdo gzhan las gsungs pa so sor mtshams sbyar bar bya ba gang zhig slob dpon rnams kyis nye bar bstan par mdzad pa des na 'dir 'thad pa rnams kyi cha tsam bstan to //
translated: However, the arguments that are stated in other sutras are applied here by the masters, and so a mere portion of the arguments is presented here.

original: de ltar na yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: Even so, the master Dignāga says:

original: gtan tshigs ngag rnams 'di min te //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ngag rnams 'di min te //
translated: These are not the arguments

original: bya ba tsam ni mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba tsam ni mtshon pa'o //
translated: but merely indicate the activity.

original: tshangs pa'i dra sogs mdo rnams la //🔽kun du rigs pa rnams zhes bya //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dra sogs mdo rnams la // kun du rigs pa rnams zhes bya //
translated: In the sutras such as the Brahma’s Net

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: they are called “reasonings.”

original: gsung rab las 'byung ba'i rigs pa 'di dag bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas rtogs pa la thabs su gyur pa nyid kyis mdo sde dang de rnams las mthong nas 'phags pa slob dpon rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa
analyzed: gsung rab las 'byung ba'i rigs pa 'di dag bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas rtogs pa la thabs su gyur pa nyid kyis mdo sde dang de rnams las mthong nas 'phags pa slob dpon rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa
translated: These reasonings that occur in the scriptures are methods for realizing the view from the perspective of the wisdom of reflection.🔽

original: dbu ma la sogs pa'i bstan bcos rnams la rtog ge ba'i rigs pa rnams las mtshan nyid dang mi 'dra ba nyid rgyas par mdzad do //
analyzed: dbu ma la sogs pa'i bstan bcos rnams la rtog ge ba'i rigs pa rnams las mtshan nyid dang mi 'dra ba nyid rgyas par mdzad do //
translated: These reasonings that occur in the scriptures are methods for realizing the meaning of the scriptures from the perspective of the wisdom of reflection. Therefore, the noble masters, having seen them in the sūtras and tantras, extensively set them forth in treatises such as the perfection vehicle🔽and the middle way.

original: gang gi phyir rtog ge ba'i rigs pa rnams ni pha rol po pham pa tsam gyi 'bras can te rtogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog ge ba'i rigs pa rnams ni pha rol po pham pa tsam gyi 'bras can te rtogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The reasonings of logicians are only effective in defeating others; they are not methods for realizing the meaning of the scriptures.

original: de bas na gsung rab kyi don bsam pa la nye bar mkho ba kho na ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gsung rab kyi don bsam pa la nye bar mkho ba kho na ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be understood not to be necessary for reflecting on the meaning of the scriptures.

original: stong pa nyid 'di rnams ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa bsgom pa 'phel bar bya ba'i don du yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so sor brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di rnams ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa bsgom pa 'phel bar bya ba'i don du yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so sor brtags pa yin no //
translated: These emptinesses are investigated by the bodhisattvas with the knowledge of thorough familiarization in order to increase the cultivation of the non-observation of all phenomena.

original: de bas na ci lta ci ltar sgro 'dogs pa 'byung ba de lta de ltar rab tu 'jug pa de bas na mdo tha dad pa dang bstan bcos tha dad pas don tha dad pa la nye bar dmigs nas som nyi mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na ci lta ci ltar sgro 'dogs pa 'byung ba de lta de ltar rab tu 'jug pa de bas na mdo tha dad pa dang bstan bcos tha dad pas don tha dad pa la nye bar dmigs nas som nyi mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, just as superimposition occurs, so too does engagement. Thus, having observed the different meanings through different sūtras and different treatises, one should not be doubtful,

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa bsgom pa rnam pa thams cad du 'phel bar byed pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽de @294a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa bsgom pa rnam pa thams cad du 'phel bar byed pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de @294a * //
translated: because the cultivation of the non-observation of all phenomena increases in every way and arises correctly.

original: nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams la sa'i dbye bas rtogs pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams la sa'i dbye bas rtogs pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, realization does not occur through the divisions of the levels in these.

original: dngos po rnams kha cig stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos rtogs pa dang / kha cig ni gzhan du zhes bya ba de bas na rnam pa thams cad du gsung rab kyi don mi mkhas pa rnams kyis 'di ltar bshad pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kha cig stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos rtogs pa dang / kha cig ni gzhan du zhes bya ba de bas na rnam pa thams cad du gsung rab kyi don mi mkhas pa rnams kyis 'di ltar bshad pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Some things are realized by the nature of emptiness, and some things are realized by other means. Therefore, in every way, the meaning of the scriptures is not to be explained by the unwise in this way.

original: gsung rab la yang 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos rnams kyi rigs pas zlos pa'i skyon spangs pa'i don du 'bad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gsung rab la yang 'jig rten pa'i bstan bcos rnams kyi rigs pas zlos pa'i skyon spangs pa'i don du 'bad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the scriptures should not be made to conform to the reasoning of worldly treatises, for the purpose of avoiding the fault of contradiction.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin dang // chos skyob yon tan phyir na bstan bcos te //
analyzed: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin dang // chos skyob yon tan phyir na bstan bcos te //
translated: The treatises are for the purpose of eliminating all the afflictions, the enemies, for protecting from the miserable realms and existence, and for the qualities of the Dharma.

original: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med //
translated: These two are not found in other systems.

original: ces bya bas /
analyzed: ces bya bas /
translated: Thus,

original: gsung rab ni bstan bcos su brjod do //
analyzed: gsung rab ni bstan bcos su brjod do //
translated: the scriptures are called treatises.

original: de ltar gang zhig bstan pa dang po la nye bar ma zhugs pa de rnams rtogs pa'i don du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang zhig bstan pa dang po la nye bar ma zhugs pa de rnams rtogs pa'i don du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, for the sake of those who have not yet entered the first teaching, it is taught for the purpose of realization.

original: shin tu zab pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi don la gang rnams kyis rtogs pa ma byas pa de rnams kyis rtogs pa'i don du yang dang yang du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu zab pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi don la gang rnams kyis rtogs pa ma byas pa de rnams kyis rtogs pa'i don du yang dang yang du bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught again and again for the sake of those who have not understood the meaning of emptiness because of its profundity.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir mi skye ba'i don la bzod pa thob pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams gnas dang gnas rnams su 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir mi skye ba'i don la bzod pa thob pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams gnas dang gnas rnams su 'don pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the fruits of attaining receptivity to the nonarising of all things and so on are presented in their proper order.

original: rtogs pa thob pa dang dgos pa rdzogs pa kha cig rnams la yang chos la gus pa'i phyir gnas pa dang kha cig la bstan pa ma rdzogs pa nyid la rang gi gnas su 'gro ba dang gzhan rnams nye bar 'gro ba dang de rnams kyi don du
analyzed: rtogs pa thob pa dang dgos pa rdzogs pa kha cig rnams la yang chos la gus pa'i phyir gnas pa dang kha cig la bstan pa ma rdzogs pa nyid la rang gi gnas su 'gro ba dang gzhan rnams nye bar 'gro ba dang de rnams kyi don du
translated: For some who have attained understanding and completed their purpose, the teaching continues out of respect for the Dharma. For some who have not completed their purpose, the teaching continues because they have not yet understood. For others, the teaching continues because they have come from afar. For the sake of those who have not come, the teaching continues so that they may come in the future.

original: slar bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slar bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the “repetition of the teaching.”

original: de bas na 'dir bstan pa'i dus nyid du mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa thob pas gdul bya rnams la 'khor ba dang ngan 'gro rnams las yongs su skyob pa ci lta ci ltar sgrub pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bstan par mdzad de de bas
analyzed: de bas na 'dir bstan pa'i dus nyid du mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa thob pas gdul bya rnams la 'khor ba dang ngan 'gro rnams las yongs su skyob pa ci lta ci ltar sgrub pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bstan par mdzad de de bas
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgatas teach the disciples just as much as they are able to attain the path of seeing and so on in this very lifetime, and they completely protect them from cyclic existence and the miserable realms.

original: na 'dir zlos pa'i skyon la phrag dog bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: na 'dir zlos pa'i skyon la phrag dog bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should not be jealous of the fault of repetition here.

original: bstan pa la ni zlos pa'i rgyan kho na ste skyon ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa la ni zlos pa'i rgyan kho na ste skyon ni ma yin no //
translated: In the teaching, repetition is only an ornament, not a fault.🔽May those who are learned never be separated from the compilation of the teaching.

original: thos pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi bstan pa rnam par sdud pa dang bral ba sngar yang ma gyur cig / de bas na don 'di nyid don gzhan la brten pas brjod do //
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi bstan pa rnam par sdud pa dang bral ba sngar yang ma gyur cig / de bas na don 'di nyid don gzhan la brten pas brjod do //
translated: Therefore, this very meaning is expressed by relying on another meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: don 'di nyid ni skor ba ste //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni skor ba ste //
translated: This very meaning is repeated,

original: slar yang don gzhan brten pa ni //
analyzed: slar yang don gzhan brten pa ni //
translated: Relying again on another meaning.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: bstan bcos @294b mkhan rnams la bar skabs nyid du gsungs pa'i don rnams kyi rtogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos @294b mkhan rnams la bar skabs nyid du gsungs pa'i don rnams kyi rtogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The authors of treatises do not understand the meaning of the passages that they quote out of context.

original: 'on kyang thos pa tsam ste rtogs pa ni don de rnams kyi bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim pas dus gzhan la 'byung ba de rnams la zlos pa ni skyon yin pa'i phyir 'byung bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang thos pa tsam ste rtogs pa ni don de rnams kyi bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim pas dus gzhan la 'byung ba de rnams la zlos pa ni skyon yin pa'i phyir 'byung bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But they do understand the meaning of the passages, since they will understand it at a later time through the process of reflecting on and meditating on the meaning of the passages.🔽Those who, having misunderstood the meaning of the passages in this sutra, accuse us of repetition, are like those who, having gone astray on a journey,

original: gang zhig mdo 'di la mi rigs par gyur pa nyid kyi don gyi dbye ba rang nyid kyis log par rtogs nas zlos pa slong bar byed pa de rnams kyi mkhas pa rnams kyis song ba dang nye bar song ba lam spangs nas log pa'i lam la zhugs
analyzed: gang zhig mdo 'di la mi rigs par gyur pa nyid kyi don gyi dbye ba rang nyid kyis log par rtogs nas zlos pa slong bar byed pa de rnams kyi mkhas pa rnams kyis song ba dang nye bar song ba lam spangs nas log pa'i lam la zhugs
translated: take a wrong path and then accuse the wise who have taken the right path of being lazy for not arriving at their destination.

original: pa rnams kyi gcig pu ngal ba nyid mdo'i don shes pa'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: pa rnams kyi gcig pu ngal ba nyid mdo'i don shes pa'i don ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is not that one should understand the meaning of the sutra by being lazy.

original: log pa'i lam ni dor 'dod cing //
analyzed: log pa'i lam ni dor 'dod cing //
translated: The wise do not say that one should abandon the right path

original: slar yang de la rjes mi 'gro //
analyzed: slar yang de la rjes mi 'gro //
translated: and then not proceed on it again.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so sor brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so sor brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not the reasoning that we are presenting.

original: de rnams kyi bshad pa ngan pa bdag cag gis sun dbyung bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bshad pa ngan pa bdag cag gis sun dbyung bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: We will refute their bad explanations.

original: rjes su rig pa rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni rjes su rig pa'i le'u ste le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
analyzed: rjes su rig pa rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni rjes su rig pa'i le'u ste le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
translated: The chapter that expresses the subsequent knowledge is the chapter on subsequent knowledge, the twenty-ninth.

original: // / de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par mdzad nas ji ltar 'di btsal bar bya zhes bya ba des gnas brtan rab 'byor la bos nas rtag tu ngu'i gtam gyis bstan par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: // / de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par mdzad nas ji ltar 'di btsal bar bya zhes bya ba des gnas brtan rab 'byor la bos nas rtag tu ngu'i gtam gyis bstan par mdzad pa ni /
translated: Thus, having taught the perfection of wisdom, the Blessed One, in order to show how it should be sought, addressed the elder Subhūti and taught through the story of Sadāprarudita:

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti... and so on.

original: yongs su btsal ba zhes bya ba la ai shu zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su btsal ba zhes bya ba la ai shu zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Should be sought - iṣu means application to desire.

original: de bzhin du yongs su btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ai sh'i zhes bya ba'i yod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du yongs su btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ai sh'i zhes bya ba'i yod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dag go //
translated: Should be sought in the same way - iṣa means the applications of existence and so on.

original: gang zhig yongs su tshol ba'i dus su 'phags pa chos 'phags de ni da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa sgra dbyangs mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su tshol ba'i dus su 'phags pa chos 'phags de ni da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa sgra dbyangs mi zad pa'o //
translated: The noble Dharmodgata who was searching for the perfections at that time is now the Tathagata Aksayamati.

original: bar snang las zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'i sgra nyid kyis sgra don yod pa nyid du srid pas spro ba'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: bar snang las zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'i sgra nyid kyis sgra don yod pa nyid du srid pas spro ba'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so //
translated: From the sky means that the very marvelous sound is the cause of delight because it is possible that the meaning of the sound exists.

original: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus ngal ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnams la yongs su tshol ba las ldog pa'i rgyu rnams la sems kyi 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus ngal ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnams la yongs su tshol ba las ldog pa'i rgyu rnams la sems kyi 'bad pa'o //
translated: Mental attention is the exertion of the mind toward the causes of turning away from the search for the arising or non-arising of bodily fatigue, etc.

original: 'dis ni brtson 'grus khyad par la nges par sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni brtson 'grus khyad par la nges par sbyor bar byed de /
translated: This is the application of effort to the special.

original: gang la yang sems smon par ma byed cig ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam par g-yeng ba dgag pa'o //
analyzed: gang la yang sems smon par ma byed cig ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam par g-yeng ba dgag pa'o //
translated: Do not wish for anything at all and so on prohibits distraction.

original: smon par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni zhugs par ma byed @295a * //
analyzed: smon par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni zhugs par ma byed @295a * //
translated: Do not wish for means do not long for.

original: cig pa'o // gang la yang zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: cig pa'o // gang la yang zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Anything at all is a summary.

original: nang ngam phyi rol zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nang ngam phyi rol zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The inner and outer are explained at length.

original: nang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rten gyi don no //
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rten gyi don no //
translated: The word inner has the meaning of basis.

original: byed tshig gi don la ni mi zad pa'i ngo bo'i bslu ba'o //
analyzed: byed tshig gi don la ni mi zad pa'i ngo bo'i bslu ba'o //
translated: In the meaning of the verbal root, there is the deception of the nature of non-exhaustion.

original: aa tsa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i mtha'o /
analyzed: aa tsa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i mtha'o /
translated: The word aṭa has the meaning of conclusion.

original: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni phyi rol zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni phyi rol zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word outer has the meaning of external.

original: g-yon dang g-yas zhes bya ba ni ma lta bar song shig ces bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas zhes bya ba ni ma lta bar song shig ces bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: The words left and right are connected with the phrase go in the direction of.

original: g-yon dang g-yas su zhes bya ba ni logs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas su zhes bya ba ni logs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The words left and right have the meaning of side.

original: shar du ma yin lhor ma yin zhes bya bas phyogs rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shar du ma yin lhor ma yin zhes bya bas phyogs rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: The words not east, not south indicate the directions.

original: gal te yang 'di gang gis shar gyi phyogs su des zhugs pa de lta na yang gnya' shing tsam las lhag pa'i lta ba dgag pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di gang gis shar gyi phyogs su des zhugs pa de lta na yang gnya' shing tsam las lhag pa'i lta ba dgag pa 'di yin te /
translated: Even if one were to go in the direction of east, this is the prohibition against looking more than a yoke's length ahead,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba yongs su spangs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba yongs su spangs pa'i don du'o //
translated: for the purpose of abandoning distraction.

original: phyogs mtshams su zhes bya ba ni phyogs mtshams rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams su zhes bya ba ni phyogs mtshams rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: The directions are the cardinal directions.

original: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yang dang yang du'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yang dang yang du'i don to //
translated: The word after means again and again.

original: phyogs mtshams dang phyogs mtshams su zhes bya ba ni rjes su phyogs mtshams so //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams dang phyogs mtshams su zhes bya ba ni rjes su phyogs mtshams so //
translated: The directions are the cardinal directions. After means in the directions.

original: mi zad pa'i dngos po bsdu ba 'di la aa ci zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i dngos po bsdu ba 'di la aa ci zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i mtha'o //
translated: The word also is a particle of collection.

original: slar gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su chol ba dang 'gal ba can gyi don la dgag par byed pa ni /
analyzed: slar gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su chol ba dang 'gal ba can gyi don la dgag par byed pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the negation of the meaning that is contrary to the search for the perfection of wisdom is as follows:

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Son of noble family, and so on.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang dngos por 'dzin pa chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bcom ldan 'das ma yongs su tshol ba dang 'gal pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang dngos por 'dzin pa chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bcom ldan 'das ma yongs su tshol ba dang 'gal pa'o //
translated: The grasping of self and the grasping of entities are contrary to the search for the Blessed Lady, which has the characteristic of not observing any phenomena.

original: 'jig par gyur pas na 'jig tshogs te spungs pa yin pa'i phyir lus so //
analyzed: 'jig par gyur pas na 'jig tshogs te spungs pa yin pa'i phyir lus so //
translated: The perishing collection is the body, because it is a heap that perishes.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i spungs pa ni mi rtag pa 'jig tshogs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i spungs pa ni mi rtag pa 'jig tshogs zhes brjod do //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc. are called the impermanent “perishing aggregates.”

original: de nyid ni bdag tha snyad pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag tha snyad pa'i yul lo //
translated: That is the conventional object of the self.

original: de bas na bdag las ma g-yos shing 'jig tshogs las kyang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i gang zag gi dngos po las ma yin tha snyad du yod pa las kyang ma g-yos shing zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na bdag las ma g-yos shing 'jig tshogs las kyang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i gang zag gi dngos po las ma yin tha snyad du yod pa las kyang ma g-yos shing zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, “not moving from the self” and “not moving from the perishing aggregates” means not moving from the substantial existence of the person and not moving from conventional existence.

original: gnyi ga la yang don dam par stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang don dam par stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because both are essentially emptiness in the ultimate.

original: gang gi phyir gang gi stong pa nyid ni de las gzhan du yongs su tshol bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi stong pa nyid ni de las gzhan du yongs su tshol bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because the emptiness of something is not to be sought elsewhere.

original: stong pa nyid tha dad pa yongs su @295b btsal ba la de las g-yos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid tha dad pa yongs su @295b btsal ba la de las g-yos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one seeks a different emptiness, one moves from that.

original: de lta na ni de'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni de'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would not be the emptiness of that.

original: chos kyi bdag med gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med gsungs pa ni //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is taught

original: gzugs las kyang ma g-yos pa dang // zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs las kyang ma g-yos pa dang // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: not moving from form,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams las kyang ma g-yos zhes bya ba ni de rnams la yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa yongs su btsal ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams las kyang ma g-yos zhes bya ba ni de rnams la yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa yongs su btsal ba med do //
translated: This means that in them also, emptiness is not sought as something different from its own essence.

original: gang 'di las zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams spangs shing 'di rnams kyi stong pa nyid gzhan du yongs su btsal ba de rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba ni log par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'di las zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams spangs shing 'di rnams kyi stong pa nyid gzhan du yongs su btsal ba de rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba ni log par 'gyur ro //
translated: “ Whoever rejects these and seeks the emptiness of these elsewhere” is a failure, that is, is mistaken.

original: chos thams cad la mos pa bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin te zhes nges pa bskyed nas chos thams cad ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mos pa bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin te zhes nges pa bskyed nas chos thams cad ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: “ Having generated devotion to all dharmas” means having generated certainty in that, i.e., in the fact that all dharmas are just as they are. What are all dharmas?

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: They are the perfected nature, which is empty of the imagined nature.

original: de rnams kyi brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don dam pa'i mtshan nyid nam mkha' ltar mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don dam pa'i mtshan nyid nam mkha' ltar mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the ultimate, which is not to be expressed by those, is signless, because it is free from signs like space.

original: de nyid dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su mi mthun pa'i 'du shes bskyed nas smon lam ma byas pa gnas pa ma byas pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mthong ba smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su mi mthun pa'i 'du shes bskyed nas smon lam ma byas pa gnas pa ma byas pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mthong ba smon pa med pa'o //
translated: That very [ultimate] is wishless, because in the state of being with defilements, one sees the non-arising of the conception of disharmony, the non-making of aspirations, the non-making of abodes, and the nature of non-existence.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i 'don pa la rang gi don la ta la'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i 'don pa la rang gi don la ta la'o //
translated: In the recitation called Emptiness, one's own aim is in tala.

original: mtshan ma yongs su spong ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'khrul pa'i rgyu dngos po la mngon par zhen pa de ni mtshan ma ste de yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma yongs su spong ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'khrul pa'i rgyu dngos po la mngon par zhen pa de ni mtshan ma ste de yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: Abandoning signs means that which is a sign, the clinging to things as the cause of delusion, is abandoned.

original: mtshan ma de nyid kyi yongs su spong ba ni rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: mtshan ma de nyid kyi yongs su spong ba ni rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: The abandonment of those very signs is taught as twofold:

original: dngos po yongs su spang ba dang sems can du lta ba yongs su spong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su spang ba dang sems can du lta ba yongs su spong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: abandoning things and abandoning the view of sentient beings.

original: dngos po ni chos kyi lta ba dang sems can gyi lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni chos kyi lta ba dang sems can gyi lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba'o //
translated: Entity is the view of phenomena, and the view of sentient beings is the view of self.

original: de dag yongs su spangs pas so //🔽gang chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang mtshams med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽gang chos rnams ston pa dag la zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de dag yongs su spangs pas so // gang chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang mtshams med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / gang chos rnams ston pa dag la zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: Because they are completely abandoned.🔽Because all phenomena are emptiness, signlessness,

original: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad ni stong pa nyid dang mtshams med pa dang smon pa med pa des na skye ba med pa'o //🔽gang gi skye ba @296a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad ni stong pa nyid dang mtshams med pa dang smon pa med pa des na skye ba med pa'o // gang gi skye ba @296a * //
translated: and wishlessness, they are unborn.

original: med pa des na ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: med pa des na ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Because they are unborn, they are unarisen.

original: skyes pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis skyed par byed pa dang skye ba ni rang nyid kyis kyang bya ba bye brag go //🔽gang gi phyir ma byung ba de nyid kyi phyir 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis skyed par byed pa dang skye ba ni rang nyid kyis kyang bya ba bye brag go // gang gi phyir ma byung ba de nyid kyi phyir 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: What is born is produced by causes and conditions, and what arises is also produced by itself.🔽Because they are not arisen, they are unceasing.

original: gang gi phyir 'gag pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i chos thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gag pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i chos thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Because they are unceasing, they are non-entities.

original: gang zhig chos ston par byed pa de rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba shugs las go ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig chos ston par byed pa de rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba shugs las go ba yin no //
translated: Those who teach the Dharma are called spiritual friends.

original: 'di las log par ston par byed pa ni sdig pa'i grogs po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las log par ston par byed pa ni sdig pa'i grogs po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those who teach contrary to this are called evil companions.

original: de ltar bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnas shing zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽byas pa gzo ba ni thos pa shes pas so //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnas shing zhes bya ba'i don to // byas pa gzo ba ni thos pa shes pas so //
translated: Having thus served them means having attended them.🔽They are grateful for what they have heard.

original: byas pa rig pa ni thos pa'i 'bras bu rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa rig pa ni thos pa'i 'bras bu rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are appreciative of what they have heard because they know the result of hearing.

original: yongs su rtogs la zhes bya ba ni bsam par byed pas so //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs la zhes bya ba ni bsam par byed pas so //
translated: They are fully aware means they reflect on it.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa rnams la 'dod pa dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa rnams la 'dod pa dang bcas pas so //
translated: They are worldly means they have desire for food, drink, clothing, and so on.

original: phyi bzhin 'brang bar bya ba ni phyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang bar bya ba ni phyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: They are to be followed means they are to be understood later.

original: chos don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la thos pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: chos don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la thos pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: One who is devoted to the Dharma is one who is devoted to the perfection of wisdom through listening, etc.

original: chos la gus par bya bas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'os pa'i spyod lam gyis gnas pas de'i don rtog pa la rtse gcig pas so //
analyzed: chos la gus par bya bas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'os pa'i spyod lam gyis gnas pas de'i don rtog pa la rtse gcig pas so //
translated: By respecting the Dharma is meant by abiding in the proper deportment, by being one-pointed in the investigation of its meaning.

original: rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de ma rtogs par dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ma gus pas don che ba'i thos pa la sogs pa rnams las nyams pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de ma rtogs par dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ma gus pas don che ba'i thos pa la sogs pa rnams las nyams pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should realize it, because if one does not realize it, one will lose the great benefit of listening, etc., due to disrespect for the spiritual friend.

original: de la rtogs pa gsungs pa ni yod de zhes bya ba ni 'di yod do //
analyzed: de la rtogs pa gsungs pa ni yod de zhes bya ba ni 'di yod do //
translated: The statement there is realization of that means that it exists.

original: 'grogs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum po 'di chung ba dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'grogs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum po 'di chung ba dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas so //
translated: The three phrases beginning with associating refer to the small, medium, and great stages.

original: zil gyis mnan nas zhes bya ba ni ngan song du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i nus pa mtshang ba mngon par chags pa'i yul nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab tu phyogs pa'i ngo bo byed pa la mi tshang bar byas nas so ;
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas zhes bya ba ni ngan song du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i nus pa mtshang ba mngon par chags pa'i yul nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab tu phyogs pa'i ngo bo byed pa la mi tshang bar byas nas so ;
translated: Having overcome means that by the object of manifest attachment to the power of going to the lower realms, etc., one makes it powerless, and turns one's back on nirvana.

original: ;'di ci ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: ;'di ci ltar byed ce na /
translated: How does one do this?

original: gsungs pa ni thabs la mkhas pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni thabs la mkhas pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said: by skill in means.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgom pas rnam par dag pa rnams byang chub nyid kyi nye bar mkho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgom pas rnam par dag pa rnams byang chub nyid kyi nye bar mkho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are purified by cultivating the three gates of liberation become fit for enlightenment itself.

original: ci ltar nad dang ldan pa rnams kyi dug ni sngags rnams kyis nus pa @296b nyams pa lus la phan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ltar nad dang ldan pa rnams kyi dug ni sngags rnams kyis nus pa @296b nyams pa lus la phan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as for those who are sick, poison loses its power and becomes beneficial to the body.
