original: ji skad du thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa rnams stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su bsgoms pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa rnams stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su bsgoms pa ste /
translated: As the Skill in Means Sūtra says, the afflictions of a bodhisattva are cultivated by the wisdom of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: gang gis 'di dga' ba dang rtse bar byed pa thams cad la yongs su longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis 'di dga' ba dang rtse bar byed pa thams cad la yongs su longs spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He who is delighted and plays with all of them, enjoys them completely.

original: rnam par ltung bar 'gro ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin zhes bya ga'o //
analyzed: rnam par ltung bar 'gro ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin zhes bya ga'o //
translated: He who goes to a downfall is not a holder.🔽The monk who expounds the Dharma.

original: dge slong chos smra ba la zhes bya ba ni dge slong ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams so //🔽ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba la zhes bya ba ni dge slong ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams so // ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: The monk is of five kinds:

original: ming gi dge slong dang / dam bcas pa'i dge slong dang / zas slong ba'i ngang tshul gyi dge slong dang nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir dge slong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ming gi dge slong dang / dam bcas pa'i dge slong dang / zas slong ba'i ngang tshul gyi dge slong dang nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir dge slong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the nominal monk, the monk by vow, the monk by begging, the monk by destruction of the defilements, and the monk by the four essentials of full ordination.

original: de bas na 'di bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir dge slong ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir dge slong ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not a monk by full ordination.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge slong gi bslab pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge slong gi bslab pa la gnas pa /
translated: Because the bodhisattvas abide in the training of the monks.

original: bstan pa'i dben gyi dogs pas 'dod pa rnams la cher spyod pa thob par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa'i dben gyi dogs pas 'dod pa rnams la cher spyod pa thob par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But he does not become one who indulges in desires to a great degree, fearing a schism in the religion.

original: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bcas pa'i kha na ma thob la cher spyod kyang dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pa rnams la phan par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bcas pa'i kha na ma thob la cher spyod kyang dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pa rnams la phan par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: And even if the bodhisattvas do indulge in a proscribed action to a great degree, they do not wish to harm those who are established in the monk's vow.

original: ci ltar gzhan gyi don las brtsams te ri rab tsam gyi gser gyi phung po blangs kyang de lta na yang me thun bsten pa byang chub sems dpa' dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pas bstan pa'i dbyen byed pa bsrung ba'i don du brtags pa ma yin
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan gyi don las brtsams te ri rab tsam gyi gser gyi phung po blangs kyang de lta na yang me thun bsten pa byang chub sems dpa' dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pas bstan pa'i dbyen byed pa bsrung ba'i don du brtags pa ma yin
translated: Just as, beginning with the benefit of others, he would take up a mass of gold even as large as Mount Meru, so also, in order to protect the schism in the religion, the bodhisattva who is established in the monk's vow would not take up a proscribed action even as small as a sesame seed.

original: no zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa las so //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i sa las so //
translated: This is from the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: ci nas kyang 'dod pa la longs spyod pa sems can gyi don la ltos pas kyang dbang po gnyis sprad pa las skyes pa'i bde ba myong ba srid pa yin no //
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'dod pa la longs spyod pa sems can gyi don la ltos pas kyang dbang po gnyis sprad pa las skyes pa'i bde ba myong ba srid pa yin no //
translated: And it is possible that he will experience the pleasure born of the union of the two organs by indulging in desires, but only in dependence on the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de nyid ni dge slong gi sdom pa nyams pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni dge slong gi sdom pa nyams pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: That is the cause for the degeneration of the monk’s vow.

original: sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu bsgom pa'i bde ba myong ba ma yin pa'i rgyu dang dge slong gi sdom pa nyams pa med pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba lung 'ga' zhig la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu bsgom pa'i bde ba myong ba ma yin pa'i rgyu dang dge slong gi sdom pa nyams pa med pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba lung 'ga' zhig la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no scripture that says that the cause for not experiencing the bliss of meditation on the illusion-like and dream-like is the cause for not degenerating the monk’s vow.

original: slob dpon rnams ni 'di ltar brjod pa yin te /🔽gal te byang chub sems @297a * //
analyzed: slob dpon rnams ni 'di ltar brjod pa yin te / gal te byang chub sems @297a * //
translated: The masters say this:

original: dpa' 'dod pa la longs spyod pas pha rol po rnams kyi don gyi phung po chen po mthong na de'i tshe tshul khrims la chags pas byang chub sems dpa' pha rol po la btang snyoms su mi byed cing /
analyzed: dpa' 'dod pa la longs spyod pas pha rol po rnams kyi don gyi phung po chen po mthong na de'i tshe tshul khrims la chags pas byang chub sems dpa' pha rol po la btang snyoms su mi byed cing /
translated: If a bodhisattva sees that by enjoying sense objects he will accomplish the great mass of others’ aims, then at that time, out of attachment to moral discipline, the bodhisattva does not remain indifferent to others.

original: ci skad du thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las gsungs pa ;
analyzed: ci skad du thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las gsungs pa ;
translated: As it says in the Sūtra on Skill in Means:

original: bskal pa brgya stong du yang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la phan pa'i phyir ltung ba la lhag par spyad nas dmyal bar gnas par bzod pa yin gyi sems can gcig gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dor ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya stong du yang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la phan pa'i phyir ltung ba la lhag par spyad nas dmyal bar gnas par bzod pa yin gyi sems can gcig gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dor ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For the sake of benefiting other bodhisattvas, he would endure remaining in hell for hundreds of thousands of eons by committing a downfall. But he would not abandon the wholesome roots of a single sentient being.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i dben bsrung ba'i don du bslab pa dor nas 'dod pa rnams la bsten pa yin zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i dben bsrung ba'i don du bslab pa dor nas 'dod pa rnams la bsten pa yin zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
translated: At that time, a bodhisattva would not abandon the training and rely on sense objects in order to protect a solitary buddha. This is not possible.

original: gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pa rnam grangs gang gis yang 'dod pa rnams pa bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pa rnam grangs gang gis yang 'dod pa rnams pa bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By what method could a bodhisattva who is a fully ordained monk rely on sense objects?

original: de bas na 'di nyon mongs pa bcom pas na dge slong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyon mongs pa bcom pas na dge slong ngo //
translated: He is a monk because he has destroyed the afflictions.

original: 'di'i nyon mongs pas ngan song dbyung ba bcom pa ste des na 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i nyon mongs pas ngan song dbyung ba bcom pa ste des na 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is an arhat because he has destroyed the afflictions that lead to lower realms. That is the meaning of “noble one.”

original: dge slong gi sgra ni bstan pa la rab tu zhugs pa rnams la grags pa'i phyir bstan pa la zhugs pa nyid gsal ba'i /
analyzed: dge slong gi sgra ni bstan pa la rab tu zhugs pa rnams la grags pa'i phyir bstan pa la zhugs pa nyid gsal ba'i /
translated: The term bhikṣu is well known to those who have entered the doctrine, so it clarifies that this is for those who have entered the doctrine.🔽

original: don du de la rab tu sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: don du de la rab tu sbyar ba'o //
translated: The term bhikṣu is applied to them in order to make clear that they are engaged in the teaching, because that term is well known to those who have entered the teaching.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa la gdul bya rnams la ltos pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams mu stegs pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa yang 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa la gdul bya rnams la ltos pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams mu stegs pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa yang 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that when there is no appearance of a Buddha, the bodhisattvas, in consideration of those to be trained, take up the banner of the tīrthikas.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma che ba las ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba nyid 'don pa yin gyi dge slong gi zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma che ba las ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba nyid 'don pa yin gyi dge slong gi zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In the Mahāvairocana Tantra, the term bodhisattva is used, not the term bhikṣu.

original: slar ci zhig 'dod pa rnams la chags pa nyid 'dod pa rnams las bsnyen pa sems can 'dul bas de'i phyir sems can rnams la 'dul ba'i don du dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bzung ba dang 'phel ba de'i slad du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slar ci zhig 'dod pa rnams la chags pa nyid 'dod pa rnams las bsnyen pa sems can 'dul bas de'i phyir sems can rnams la 'dul ba'i don du dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bzung ba dang 'phel ba de'i slad du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is meant is that they are attached to the objects of desire, and they are close to the objects of desire, because they train sentient beings. Therefore, they take up wholesome actions for the sake of training sentient beings.

original: ci skad du thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Skill in Means Sūtra:

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It is just as,

original: bcom ldan 'das ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi gang zhig dang ba'i sems sam gdug pa'i sems dang ldan pa rtsar nye bar 'gro ba ste de rnams thams cad kha dog gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi gang zhig dang ba'i sems sam gdug pa'i sems dang ldan pa rtsar nye bar 'gro ba ste de rnams thams cad kha dog gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Blessed One, when someone with a pure mind or an angry mind approaches Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, they all become the same color.

original: 'di lta ste gser gyi kha dog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gser gyi kha dog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is just as if they were to have the color of gold.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan @297b 'das gang kha cig dang ba'i sems sam gdug pa'i sems sam kun nas chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa rtsar nye bar 'gro ba de rnams thams cad kha dog gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan @297b 'das gang kha cig dang ba'i sems sam gdug pa'i sems sam kun nas chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa rtsar nye bar 'gro ba de rnams thams cad kha dog gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, when someone with a pure mind or an angry mind or an attached mind approaches the bodhisattvas, they all become the same color.

original: 'di lta ste thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyi kha dog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyi kha dog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is just as if they were to have the color of the mind of omniscience.

original: slar de nyid du blta na sdug pa zhes bya ba sman gyi rigs yod de de la gang kha cig nad sna tshogs pas nyon mongs pa'i sems can rnams rab tu mthong ba de rnams thams cad kyi nad de rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar de nyid du blta na sdug pa zhes bya ba sman gyi rigs yod de de la gang kha cig nad sna tshogs pas nyon mongs pa'i sems can rnams rab tu mthong ba de rnams thams cad kyi nad de rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that very place, there is a kind of medicine called “beautiful to behold.” Whatever sick beings afflicted with various diseases see it, all their diseases are cured.

original: de bzhin du gang kha cig dang ba'i sems sam gdug ba'i sems sam kun nas chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' rab tu mthong ba de rnams thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nad rnams rab tu zhi bar 'gyur🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang kha cig dang ba'i sems sam gdug ba'i sems sam kun nas chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' rab tu mthong ba de rnams thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nad rnams rab tu zhi bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, whatever beings with a pure mind, or a malicious mind, or a mind full of attachment, see a bodhisattva, all their diseases of passion, aggression, and folly are cured.

original: de nyid du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid du yang gsungs pa /
translated: It says in the same text:

original: kun dga' bo 'di'i yon tan ci lta bu ni khyod ltos shig / gang gis sems can gzhan dag dmyal bar 'gro ba 'di lta bu //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di'i yon tan ci lta bu ni khyod ltos shig / gang gis sems can gzhan dag dmyal bar 'gro ba 'di lta bu //
translated: Ānanda, look at the qualities of this bodhisattva! Whatever other beings would go to hell,

original: de nyid kyis ni dpa' bo rnams la skye bo rtag tu chags //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni dpa' bo rnams la skye bo rtag tu chags //
translated: by that very thing, the heroes are always loved by people.

original: mtho ris dang ni skye bo nyid ni 'gro ba de ltar yin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris dang ni skye bo nyid ni 'gro ba de ltar yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The higher realms and the very state of being are just like that.

original: chags pa ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni srid pa'o //
translated: Attachment is existence.

original: sgrib pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Obscuration is the object.

original: skad cig de nyid la zhes bya ba ni sems dang ba med pa 'gag pa'i dus la'o //
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la zhes bya ba ni sems dang ba med pa 'gag pa'i dus la'o //
translated: In that very moment means at the time of the cessation of the impure mind.

original: yang dag pa'i tshul ni don dam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshul ni don dam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The correct method is the ultimate classification.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not afflicted because it is free from afflictions.

original: rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not purified because it is free from purification.

original: stong pa nyid kho na gsal bar byed pa ni chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kho na gsal bar byed pa ni chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Emptiness itself is clarified by the words all phenomena are empty, etc.

original: sems can med pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis gang zag gi bdag med pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can med pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis gang zag gi bdag med pa gsungs so //
translated: The words “without sentient beings” and so on teach the selflessness of persons.

original: sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis chos kyi bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis chos kyi bdag med pa'o //
translated: The words “like an illusion” and so on teach the selflessness of phenomena.

original: med pa'i don ci ltar spyod yul du 'gyur pa zhes bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i don du sgyu ma lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: med pa'i don ci ltar spyod yul du 'gyur pa zhes bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i don du sgyu ma lta bu nyid do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, How can the meaning of non-existence be an object? [it is said that] it is like an illusion.

original: don med pa la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la ci ltar nye bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i don du rmi lam lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: don med pa la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la ci ltar nye bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i don du rmi lam lta bu nyid do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, How can there be enjoyment of what is desired and not desired in what is meaningless? [it is said that] it is like a dream.

original: don dam pa la sna tshogs pa'i tha snyad dang / brjod pa 'jug pa ji ltar zhes the tshom bzlog pa'i don du sgra brnyan lta bu nyid @298a * //🔽do ; / don med pa la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa /
analyzed: don dam pa la sna tshogs pa'i tha snyad dang / brjod pa 'jug pa ji ltar zhes the tshom bzlog pa'i don du sgra brnyan lta bu nyid @298a * // do ; / don med pa la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa /
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, How can there be the engagement of various conventions and expressions in the ultimate? [it is said that] it is like an echo.🔽In order to eliminate the doubt, How can there be the engagement of various kinds of consciousness in what is meaningless? [it is said that] it is like an optical illusion.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i don du mi g-yor lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i don du mi g-yor lta bu nyid do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, How can there be the engagement of various kinds of consciousness in what is meaningless? [it is said that] it is like a mirage.

original: brnyas par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa brtan par byed pa'i ngo bo brtag pa la sogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: brnyas par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa brtan par byed pa'i ngo bo brtag pa la sogs pa'i don du'o //

analyzed: mi skyo ba ni ngal ba med pa'o //

analyzed: mya ngan byed pa ni phrad par 'dod pa'o //

original: smre ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o ;

original: ra ba bdun dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ra ba bdun dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with seven walls.

original: bskor ba ni dkrigs pa'o //
analyzed: bskor ba ni dkrigs pa'o //

translated: with five hundred...

original: bar ni nang du'o /
analyzed: bar ni nang du'o /

original: tshong khang ni nyo ba dang 'tshong pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: tshong khang ni nyo ba dang 'tshong pa'i gnas so //

original: phreng ba ni de'i phreng ngo //
analyzed: phreng ba ni de'i phreng ngo //

original: de'i lnga brgyas phigs par gyur pa ni ma lus par @298b 'brel ba'o //🔽ri mo ni sna tshogs pa'i ra ba'i mthar gnyi ga nas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rdzing bu brgyad brgyad ces bya ba ni yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus gang ba'o //
translated: The eight ponds are filled with water possessing the eight qualities.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i de dang de'i yan lag bsgom pa la ngal ba bsal brgyu ni rdzing bu brgyad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i de dang de'i yan lag bsgom pa la ngal ba bsal brgyu ni rdzing bu brgyad do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is engaged in cultivating the eightfold noble path, in order to remove fatigue in the cultivation of this or that factor, has the eight ponds.

original: de la gang zhig sngar rgyu med pa dang mi mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid ma brten pas bde ba rnams la phyin ci ma log par mthong ba so sor rnyed pa de nyid thob ste shes rab gang zhig bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i🔽don du rnam par gzhag par byed pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta ba ste yan lag dang po'o //
analyzed: de la gang zhig sngar rgyu med pa dang mi mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid ma brten pas bde ba rnams la phyin ci ma log par mthong ba so sor rnyed pa de nyid thob ste shes rab gang zhig bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i don du rnam par gzhag par byed pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta ba ste yan lag dang po'o //
translated: Therein, the one who previously, due to the absence of a cause and the non-equivalence of the cause, has not attained the unmistaken perception of the pleasant, in order to abandon the afflictions to be abandoned by cultivation through the cultivation of that very wisdom,🔽establishes the correct view, which is the first factor.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i lta ba dang par byas nas nges par 'byung ba la sogs pa yang dag par rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i lta ba dang par byas nas nges par 'byung ba la sogs pa yang dag par rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: Having made the correct view the first, the correct conception is the conception of renunciation, etc.

original: brdzun dang phra ma la sogs pa'i tshig las log pa dang / chos kyi gtam ni yang dag pa'i dag go //🔽srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dar 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'i log pa'i las kyi mtha' rnams sngom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i lam gyi yan lag tu gyur pa de bzhin du chos kyi bsod snyoms dang chos gos la sogs pa yongs su btsal ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: brdzun dang phra ma la sogs pa'i tshig las log pa dang / chos kyi gtam ni yang dag pa'i dag go // srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dar 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'i log pa'i las kyi mtha' rnams sngom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i lam gyi yan lag tu gyur pa de bzhin du chos kyi bsod snyoms dang chos gos la sogs pa yongs su btsal ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o //
translated: Right speech is the avoidance of lying, slander, etc.🔽Right action is the avoidance of killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct, and is the restraint of the other wrong actions.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni log pa'i 'tsho ba la sogs pa so sor rtogs nas log pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni log pa'i 'tsho ba la sogs pa so sor rtogs nas log pa'o //
translated: Right livelihood is the search for the alms of the Dharma and for the robes of the Dharma, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa la brten pas bsgom pa la sbyor ba'i 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa la brten pas bsgom pa la sbyor ba'i 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
translated: Right effort is the will and exertion to cultivate the path, based on right view, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang ldan pa'i gang zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin yid la byed cing sems gnas @300b pa de ni yang dag pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang ldan pa'i gang zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin yid la byed cing sems gnas @300b pa de ni yang dag pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: The correct mindfulness of one who is endowed with correct effort and who attends to the four foundations of mindfulness and the stilling of the mind is correct mindfulness.

original: gong nas gong du bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa 'grib pa'i phyir 'jug pa bden pa'i mtshan nyid gnas pa dang sems rtse gcig pa'i khyad par ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to /🔽de ltar na yan lag brgyad po 'di rnams bsgoms pa las skyes pa'i dal ba bsal ba'i don du gang rnams la khrus byed pa dang zhugs pa la sogs pa spyod pa de rnams rim pa ci lta bar bzang po dang shin tu bzang po nyid dang ldan
analyzed: gong nas gong du bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa 'grib pa'i phyir 'jug pa bden pa'i mtshan nyid gnas pa dang sems rtse gcig pa'i khyad par ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to / de ltar na yan lag brgyad po 'di rnams bsgoms pa las skyes pa'i dal ba bsal ba'i don du gang rnams la khrus byed pa dang zhugs pa la sogs pa spyod pa de rnams rim pa ci lta bar bzang po dang shin tu bzang po nyid dang ldan
translated: Correct meditative concentration is the special stilling of the mind and one-pointedness of mind that is blissful to engage in because it is cultivated more and more and because it diminishes the afflictions.🔽Thus, these eight factors are the eight ponds that are named according to their meaning and that are endowed with goodness and supreme goodness, respectively, for the purpose of removing the fatigue that arises from cultivating the eight factors.

original: pa don ci lta bar ming gis tha snyad du byas pa'i rdzing bu rnams so //
analyzed: pa don ci lta bar ming gis tha snyad du byas pa'i rdzing bu rnams so //
translated: They are the conduct of bathing, entering, and so on.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni dran pas des pa'i chos la nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni dran pas des pa'i chos la nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “definite” means that the mind is still because it is fixed on the Dharma by means of mindfulness.

original: mi 'bab ces bya ba la 'bab pa ni 'di dang de las sems 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'bab ces bya ba la 'bab pa ni 'di dang de las sems 'khor ba'o //
translated: “Not falling” means that the mind does not move from this and that.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi gsal ba ste /
translated: “Clarity” means the clarity of meditative concentration.

original: de dang ldan pas mi 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas mi 'bab pa'o //
translated: “Not falling” means not falling from that.

original: them skas nyid ni them pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir them pa'o //
analyzed: them skas nyid ni them pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir them pa'o //
translated: “Stairway” means a staircase.

original: bug pa ni mtshams so //
analyzed: bug pa ni mtshams so //
translated: “Hole” means a crevice.

original: de la bar ni go skabs so //
analyzed: de la bar ni go skabs so //
translated: “In between” means an interval.

original: ldan pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan de rnams nyid kyis yang dag par shar ba'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan de rnams nyid kyis yang dag par shar ba'o //
translated: “Possessing” means being endowed with those very qualities of desire.

original: dbang du gyur pa ni dbang po thams cad kyis rjes su bzung ba ste de dang ldan pas na dbang du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa ni dbang po thams cad kyis rjes su bzung ba ste de dang ldan pas na dbang du gyur ba'o //
translated: “Having control” means being supported by all the faculties. “Having control” means being endowed with that.

original: rtse ba zhes bya ba la sog pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtse ba zhes bya ba la sog pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: “Playing” and so on have been explained.

original: ji ltar sems can rnams kyi tshogs 'phel ba de thams cad lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi sems can yongs su smin pa'i don du sten par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ltung ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams kyi tshogs 'phel ba de thams cad lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi sems can yongs su smin pa'i don du sten par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ltung ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, all the increase in the assemblies of sentient beings is for the purpose of bringing sentient beings to maturity through physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: ma lus rgyal dang nyon mongs bcom //
analyzed: ma lus rgyal dang nyon mongs bcom //
translated: The Victorious Ones have conquered all afflictions,

original: dug ni sngags kyis bcom pa ltar //
analyzed: dug ni sngags kyis bcom pa ltar //
translated: just as poison is conquered by a mantra.

original: nyon mongs kyis ni nyon mongs zad //
analyzed: nyon mongs kyis ni nyon mongs zad //
translated: Afflictions are exhausted by afflictions,

original: de rnams thams cad mkhyen nyid thob //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad mkhyen nyid thob //
translated: and they all attain omniscience.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the verse.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dran pa'i ye shes kyi ni bcom pa sna tshogs yon tan 'grub pas spang pa ste //
analyzed: dran pa'i ye shes kyi ni bcom pa sna tshogs yon tan 'grub pas spang pa ste //
translated: The Conqueror is abandoned by the wisdom of mindfulness, accomplished by various qualities.

original: nyon mongs rnams ni khyed kyi byang chub nye bar mkho ba nyid du son pa yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs rnams ni khyed kyi byang chub nye bar mkho ba nyid du son pa yin /
translated: Afflictions have become just what is necessary for your enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dus de srid du zhes bya ba ni dus nyung ba'o //
analyzed: dus de srid du zhes bya ba ni dus nyung ba'o //
translated: For that long means for a short time.

original: gser gyi rkang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas gdan gyi khyad par te /
analyzed: gser gyi rkang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas gdan gyi khyad par te /
translated: The special seat is mentioned by golden feet, etc.

original: 'phang du rgyang grags phyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phang du rgyang grags phyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Half a krośa high is the meaning.

original: shing bal bting ba'am bar tshang can bting ba ste bar tshad ma ni la ba'i rigs khyad par can no //
analyzed: shing bal bting ba'am bar tshang can bting ba ste bar tshad ma ni la ba'i rigs khyad par can no //
translated: Spread with cotton means spread with cotton cloth. Spread with woolen cloth means spread with woolen cloth. Spread with woolen cloth means spread with woolen cloth.

original: snying po can ni tsan ni'i gos bting ba'o //
analyzed: snying po can ni tsan ni'i gos bting ba'o //
translated: Rich in essence means spread with sandalwood cloth.

original: de @301a * //🔽'di'i steng du yod pas na steng snying po can no //
analyzed: de @301a * // 'di'i steng du yod pas na steng snying po can no //
translated: It is on top of that, therefore it is called “having a top-most essence.”

original: snying po can ni sngas nang tshangs can zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag go //
analyzed: snying po can ni sngas nang tshangs can zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag go //
translated: “Having an essence” is a pillow with a filling.🔽Kashyapa means “born from the Brahmins.”

original: ka shi ka'i gos ni b'a r'a ni s'i nas byung ba'am lha las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ka shi ka'i gos ni b'a r'a ni s'i nas byung ba'am lha las byung ba'o //
translated: Kashyapa cloth is from Varanasi or from the gods.

original: de bting ba 'di la yod pas na de ltar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bting ba 'di la yod pas na de ltar brjod pa'o //
translated: It is spread out here, therefore it is called that.

original: ci ltar mnyam par gyur pa ni mnyam pa ni ma yin pa de ltar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar mnyam par gyur pa ni mnyam pa ni ma yin pa de ltar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: How is it not equal? It is grasped as not equal.

original: lhan cig tu zhes bya ba ni skye bo rnams ci tsam gyis 'dzin pa de tsam 'dus pa tshang ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig tu zhes bya ba ni skye bo rnams ci tsam gyis 'dzin pa de tsam 'dus pa tshang ba'o //

original: bres pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bres pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang bcas pa'o //

analyzed: yang bar snang la rten med par 'dzin par ci ltar nus she na gsungs pa ni /

analyzed: legs par gnas pa sna tshogs pa rnam par smin pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Well-placed various maturations.”

original: legs par gnas pa des gnas par bya zhes bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i stobs nyid las bar snang du byang chub sems dpa' la gnas zhes bya ba'o //

translated: The phrase by the power of the maturation of karma means that the bodhisattva's seat in the sky is due to the power of the maturation of karma.

analyzed: mu tig gis brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' ma rnams su dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa 'phyang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Adorned with pearls means that it is adorned with nets and half-nets hanging from the edges.

original: dbus su mu tig gi tshogs rags pa'o //
analyzed: dbus su mu tig gi tshogs rags pa'o //

analyzed: chos la gus pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa'i yid la byed pa'o //

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: de 'di la skyes pas na de ltar brjod pa'o //

analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

translated: Samadhis are the doors. The one-pointed mind associated with equanimity, which is the antidote to the afflictions, is called samadhi. This is the general definition of samadhi.

analyzed: de rnams la lta ba ni mthong ba po'o //
translated: The one who sees those is the seer.

analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid shin tu yod pa mi dmigs pa ni med par nges pa'o //

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid kyis shes pa gang zhig brdzun par snang ba tsam nyid kyis yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid kyis shes pa gang zhig brdzun par snang ba tsam nyid kyis yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The reality of all phenomena is known by the dependent characteristic, which is known by the mere appearance of falsity.

original: de las nges par 'byung ba ni brdzun par snang ba tsam nyid kyis shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las nges par 'byung ba ni brdzun par snang ba tsam nyid kyis shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Liberation from that is due to the knowledge of the mere appearance of falsity.

original: yang gang gi tshe shes pas nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'don pa ste /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe shes pas nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'don pa ste /
translated: Moreover, when it is recited as “liberation through knowledge,”

original: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi shes pas nges par 'byung ba shes pa'i snang ba brdzun pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi shes pas nges par 'byung ba shes pa'i snang ba brdzun pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: that is understood by the knowledge of the nature of knowledge, by the mere falsity of the appearance of liberation.

original: chos thams cad tha dad pa med pa ni mnyam pa nyid de de bzhin nyid kyis gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad tha dad pa med pa ni mnyam pa nyid de de bzhin nyid kyis gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The non-difference of all phenomena is sameness, the single nature of suchness.

original: de dmigs par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni @302a * //
analyzed: de dmigs par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni @302a * //
translated: The samadhi that takes that as its object

original: de ltar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'o //
translated: is expressed like that.

original: de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis chos thams cad 'gyur ba med par mthong ba de bas na chos thams cad 'gyur ba med par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de nyid kyis chos thams cad 'gyur ba med par mthong ba de bas na chos thams cad 'gyur ba med par mthong ba'o //
translated: By that suchness itself, one sees all phenomena as unchanging. Therefore, one sees all phenomena as unchanging.

original: chos thams cad kyi ci lta ba bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid gsum rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ci lta ba bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid gsum rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of the three realities of all dharmas just as they are.

original: de nyid kyi mun pa gang zhig rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa med pa de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi mun pa gang zhig rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa med pa de dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is the removal of the darkness of that, which is the non-realization of all aspects.

original: de nyid kyi gang zhig mi shes pa ni phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi gang zhig mi shes pa ni phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the non-understanding of that, which is the realization of the opposite.

original: de sel bar byed pa ni sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de sel bar byed pa ni sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the removal of that, which is the removal of that.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin 'di rnams ngo bo nyid gsum 'ga' zhig thams cad dang 'ga' zhig tu phyogs gcig la brten nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin 'di rnams ngo bo nyid gsum 'ga' zhig thams cad dang 'ga' zhig tu phyogs gcig la brten nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these meditative stabilizations should be explained as being based on some of the three realities and on some of the aspects.

original: gang zhig me tog bkram pa la sogs pa de rnams kyang me tog bzhin du me tog rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: gang zhig me tog bkram pa la sogs pa de rnams kyang me tog bzhin du me tog rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams te /
translated: Those, such as the scattering of flowers, are like flowers. The flowers are the limbs of enlightenment.

original: de rnams kyis bkram pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis bkram pa'o //
translated: They are scattered by them.

original: shes pa'i snang ba brdzun pa tsam nyid kyis de rnams nye bar gnas pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i snang ba brdzun pa tsam nyid kyis de rnams nye bar gnas pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: The appearance of consciousness is just false, and they should be explained in the manner of their presence, etc.

original: de bzhin du ci srid du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ci srid du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, up to: “I see all the Tathāgatas.”

original: gang gi stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnas gcig tu gnas pa nyid mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gnas gcig tu gnas pa nyid mthong ngo //
translated: By whose power do you see the Tathāgatas dwelling in the various world-realms gathered in one place?

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag la zhes bya ba ni rim gyis thams cad la gnas pas ting nge 'dzin tha ma'i yon tan ting nge 'dzin snga ma'i yon tan yongs su mi 'dor bar gnas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag la zhes bya ba ni rim gyis thams cad la gnas pas ting nge 'dzin tha ma'i yon tan ting nge 'dzin snga ma'i yon tan yongs su mi 'dor bar gnas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: “In those meditative concentrations” means that, by abiding in all of them in sequence, one abides in the qualities of the final meditative concentration without abandoning the qualities of the earlier meditative concentrations.

original: phyogs bcu 'di la yod pas na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu 'di la yod pas na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten no //
translated: “The worlds of the ten directions” means the worlds of the ten directions.

original: phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rtogs par khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la rtogs pa ni thogs pa med pa ste de thob pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams zhes bya ba'i don to // rtogs par khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la rtogs pa ni thogs pa med pa ste de thob pa'o //
translated: The meaning is: the world-realms that exist in the ten directions.🔽“Realization” means unobstructed attainment.

original: bslab po zhes bya ba ni bslab pa thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bslab po zhes bya ba ni bslab pa thob par byed pa'o //
translated: “Training” means causing the attainment of training.

original: des byas pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sngar des byas pa'o //
analyzed: des byas pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sngar des byas pa'o //
translated: “What he has done” means what he has done previously.

original: zung shig ces bya ba ni sems kyis mi brjed par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zung shig ces bya ba ni sems kyis mi brjed par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Hold it” means “do not forget it with your mind.”

original: de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis khyod kyi slad du slar byas pa nye bar gnas pa'i spyod pa byed nus pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis khyod kyi slad du slar byas pa nye bar gnas pa'i spyod pa byed nus pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: “Such a spiritual teacher is able to act for your sake with the conduct of service” means

original: rigs kyi bu gal te khyod kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te khyod kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, if you”🔽“For the sake of service” means “for the sake of attendance.”

original: bsnyen bkur gyi phyir ram nye bar gnas @302b pa'i phyir spyod pa'i mchog rnam pa gsum gyis gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur gyi phyir ram nye bar gnas @302b pa'i phyir spyod pa'i mchog rnam pa gsum gyis gsungs pa ni /
translated: The three kinds of supreme service are stated as

original: bskal pa gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “for one eon” and so forth.

original: de la rnam pa gsum ni dus kyi rab dang lus kyis bsnyen bkur dang bde ba'i dngos po dbul ba las so //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum ni dus kyi rab dang lus kyis bsnyen bkur dang bde ba'i dngos po dbul ba las so //
translated: Therein, the three kinds are service with time, service with the body, and service with the things of happiness.

original: de la dus kyi rab bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la dus kyi rab bstan pa ni /
translated: Among them, the teaching of time is

original: bskal pa gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “for one eon” and so forth.

original: lus kyis bsnyen bkur gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyis bsnyen bkur gsungs pa ni /
translated: The teaching of service with the body is🔽“with my own hands” and so forth.

original: mgo la thod bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽thod pa n'i tsee lo na ta ka zhes bya ba'i skad de de la tsee la ni gos ring ba'o //
analyzed: mgo la thod bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / thod pa n'i tsee lo na ta ka zhes bya ba'i skad de de la tsee la ni gos ring ba'o //
translated: Like a turban on the head, etc.🔽 The word turban is in the language of Cīna, and there cīna means long cloth.

original: de'i lo na ta ka ni gcig tu bsdus nas ni dkris pa ste mgo la ras kyis dkris pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽bde ba'i dngos po dbul ba ni //
analyzed: de'i lo na ta ka ni gcig tu bsdus nas ni dkris pa ste mgo la ras kyis dkris pa zhes bya ba'i don to // bde ba'i dngos po dbul ba ni //
translated: When that is lo-nata, it is wrapped around, that is, wrapped around the head with cloth.🔽The offering of the things of happiness is

original: bde ba'i yo byad thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i yo byad thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: all the articles of happiness, etc.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: Then those Tathāgatas disappeared.

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin de dag las langs te zhes bya ba ni de rnams cig car nyid du mi snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin de dag las langs te zhes bya ba ni de rnams cig car nyid du mi snang bar gyur te /
translated: And he arose from those samādhis means that they all disappeared at once,

original: de yang langs zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang langs zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: and he is to be seen as having arisen.

original: ci ltar bcom ldan 'das grong khyer du bzhugs pa dang me tog gi char yang nam mkha'i dkyil nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar bcom ldan 'das grong khyer du bzhugs pa dang me tog gi char yang nam mkha'i dkyil nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the Blessed One was dwelling in the city and a rain of flowers fell from the midst of the sky, it is said.

original: gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin las ma bzhengs par ci ltar mi snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin las ma bzhengs par ci ltar mi snang bar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the Tathagatas not appear when one has not arisen from the samadhi called Seeing All Tathagatas by the power of samadhi?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gang nas byon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gang nas byon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Where did those Tathagatas come from? and so on.

original: 'on de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams la gnas pa 'dir gnas pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dis mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams la gnas pa 'dir gnas pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dis mthong ba yin te /
translated: But by the power of the samadhi of seeing the Tathagatas, he sees the Tathagatas abiding in the worlds of the ten directions right here.🔽And when he arises from samadhi, he does not see them. This meaning is clear.

original: ting nge 'dzin las langs nas kyang mi mthong zhes bya ba don 'di gsal ba nyid de de bas na rtogs pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gang nas byon /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las langs nas kyang mi mthong zhes bya ba don 'di gsal ba nyid de de bas na rtogs pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gang nas byon /
translated: Therefore, this thought Where did the Tathagatas come from?

original: de dag gang du bzhud ces bya /🔽ci ltar yang dag par 'byung /
analyzed: de dag gang du bzhud ces bya /🔽ci ltar yang dag par 'byung /
translated: Where did they go?

original: rang rang gi 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi nus pas mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na bde na mod kyi 'on kyang sngar bstan pa'i gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku byung bar gyur zhes bya la
analyzed: rang rang gi 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi nus pas mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na bde na mod kyi 'on kyang sngar bstan pa'i gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku byung bar gyur zhes bya la
translated: But even so, the passage previously cited states, “The bodies of the Tathagatas who have come forth.

original: / de bzhin @303a * //
analyzed: / de bzhin @303a * //
translated: And likewise,🔽

original: gshegs pa rnams kyi sku ni tshogs te de bzhin gshegs pa mang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gshegs pa rnams kyi sku ni tshogs te de bzhin gshegs pa mang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodies of the Tathagatas are the collection of many Tathagatas.

original: gang yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is also said:🔽“Those Tathagatas gave their approval.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyis legs so zhes bya ba ni byin par gyur to zhes bya ba la de yang sngar mthong ba dang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na gnas pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyis legs so zhes bya ba ni byin par gyur to zhes bya ba la de yang sngar mthong ba dang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na gnas pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: This means that they gave their approval to both the vision and the dwelling in other world systems.

original: gang zhig yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang zhig yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is also said:

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams mi snang bar gyur nas zhes bya ba de la yang sngar mdun du mthong ba dang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na gnas pa mthong ba dus mnyam du mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams mi snang bar gyur nas zhes bya ba de la yang sngar mdun du mthong ba dang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na gnas pa mthong ba dus mnyam du mi snang ba'o //
translated: Here, the former ones who were seen in front and those who were seen dwelling in other world-realms disappeared simultaneously.

original: gang zhig yang de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams gang nas byon gang du bzhud snyam pa'i rtog pa 'di 'ong ba srid pa rnams la de de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku byung bar gyur zhes bya ba dang por bstan pa rnams la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yang de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams gang nas byon gang du bzhud snyam pa'i rtog pa 'di 'ong ba srid pa rnams la de de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku byung bar gyur zhes bya ba dang por bstan pa rnams la blta bar bya'o //
translated: For those who think, “Where did those Tathagatas come from? Where did they go?” the answer is given in the first part of the verse, “The Tathagata’s body is a coming into being.”

original: gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
translated: Sorrow is grief.

original: mi dga' ba ni sdug bsngal gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba ni sdug bsngal gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: Displeasure is dwelling in suffering.

original: gzungs thob pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzungs thob pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The attainment of retention is fourfold:

original: bzod pa'i gzungs dang / chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: bzod pa'i gzungs dang / chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs so //
translated: the retention of patience, the retention of the Dharma, the retention of meaning, and the retention of spells.

original: 'dir yi ge rnams thams cad bsgoms par gyur pa rnams chos thams cad rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yi ge rnams thams cad bsgoms par gyur pa rnams chos thams cad rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, all the letters that are contemplated become the cause for understanding all phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: yi ge aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste gdod nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste gdod nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The letter A is the door to all phenomena because it is primordially unborn.

original: de ltar na yi ge de dang de la brten nas chos thams cad la so sor rtog par byed par gyur pa dang skye bar gyur pa la dran pa dang shes rab dag de'i don du 'dzin pa'i phyir gzungs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na yi ge de dang de la brten nas chos thams cad la so sor rtog par byed par gyur pa dang skye bar gyur pa la dran pa dang shes rab dag de'i don du 'dzin pa'i phyir gzungs zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, based on this and that letter, when one contemplates all phenomena and gives rise to mindfulness and wisdom that apprehend their meaning, it is called a dhāraṇī.

original: de gzungs kyi rgyu las skye ba yin te 'di ni chos thams cad kyi don dam pa la dmigs pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de gzungs kyi rgyu las skye ba yin te 'di ni chos thams cad kyi don dam pa la dmigs pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It arises from the cause of dhāraṇī. This is called the acceptance that focuses on the ultimate meaning of all phenomena.

original: dran pa dang shes rab de dag bzod pa'i gzungs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes rab de dag bzod pa'i gzungs zhes brjod do //
translated: Those mindfulness and wisdom are called the dhāraṇī of acceptance.

original: yang yi ge rnams de nyid 'bad pa thams cad kyis yang dag par goms par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rgyun mi 'chad par shin tu myur bar chos kyi rgyun dang de'i don rnams ston par gyur ba dag la yang dag par 'dzin pa🔽la rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams la shin tu @303b goms pa nyid kyis yang dag par 'dzin pa la rgyur gyur pa de bas na dran pa dang shes rab dag de nyid chos kyi gzungs dang don
analyzed: yang yi ge rnams de nyid 'bad pa thams cad kyis yang dag par goms par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rgyun mi 'chad par shin tu myur bar chos kyi rgyun dang de'i don rnams ston par gyur ba dag la yang dag par 'dzin pa la rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams la shin tu @303b goms pa nyid kyis yang dag par 'dzin pa la rgyur gyur pa de bas na dran pa dang shes rab dag de nyid chos kyi gzungs dang don
translated: Again, the letters are the cause of perfect retention, since the buddhas and bodhisattvas uninterruptedly and very quickly teach the Dharma and its meaning in order to perfectly familiarize one with those letters through all one's efforts.

original: gyi gzungs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gyi gzungs zhes brjod do //
translated: The cause of perfect retention is the perfect familiarity with the collections of names, words and letters, which are the reasons for that. Therefore, mindfulness and wisdom are called the Dharma and meaning retentions, respectively.

original: slar yang byang chub sems dpas de nyid yi ge rnams yang dag par bsgom pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar dngos po thams cad star bar gyur pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slar yang byang chub sems dpas de nyid yi ge rnams yang dag par bsgom pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar dngos po thams cad star bar gyur pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, the bodhisattva's perfect cultivation of the letters is like a wish fulfilling jewel that grants all things.

original: smon lam gyi stobs kyis de rnams la ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis nye bar 'tshe ba la sogs pa thams cad rnam par 'jig pa'i don dang sdig pa thams cad zad pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dgos pas byin gyis brlabs pa don thams
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs kyis de rnams la ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis nye bar 'tshe ba la sogs pa thams cad rnam par 'jig pa'i don dang sdig pa thams cad zad pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dgos pas byin gyis brlabs pa don thams
translated: By the power of aspiration, for the sake of all those who are harmed by the power of meditative concentration, and so on, for the sake of destroying all that, and for the sake of exhausting all evil, and so on, the consecration is blessed with all purposes.

original: cad sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de brten pa'i ye shes ni sngags kyi gzungs zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: cad sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de brten pa'i ye shes ni sngags kyi gzungs zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: When all those are accomplished, the wisdom that is based on that is called the dhāraṇī of mantra.

original: gzungs de dmigs par 'gyur bas yi ge rnams kyang gzungs kyi sgras brjod do //🔽man zhes bya ba ni yid de shes pa la'o //🔽tram zhes bya ba ni skyob pa la ste /
analyzed: gzungs de dmigs par 'gyur bas yi ge rnams kyang gzungs kyi sgras brjod do // man zhes bya ba ni yid de shes pa la'o // tram zhes bya ba ni skyob pa la ste /
translated: Since that dhāraṇī is the object, the syllables are also expressed by the word dhāraṇī.🔽The word man is for the mind, and tra is for protection.

original: yid skyob pas na man tra te zhes bya ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yid skyob pas na man tra te zhes bya ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Since it protects the mind, it is mantra. It is the wisdom called protection of the mind.

original: snying rje yang sngags kyi sgras brjod do //
analyzed: snying rje yang sngags kyi sgras brjod do //
translated: Compassion is also expressed by the word mantra.

original: de dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i phyir de'i yi ge rnams kyang sngags zhes brjod de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go 'phang gi gnas yin pa'i phyir tshig rnams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i phyir de'i yi ge rnams kyang sngags zhes brjod de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go 'phang gi gnas yin pa'i phyir tshig rnams zhes brjod do //
translated: Because they are the natural outcome of those, their letters are called “mantras” because they are the basis for the state of omniscience, they are called “words”.

original: de bas na gzungs kyi sngags kyi tshig ces ming thob pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzungs kyi sngags kyi tshig ces ming thob pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “the words of the mantra dhāraṇī”.

original: de la bzod pa'i gzungs ni yang dag par yongs su rdzogs pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa la mngon par brtson pa'i stobs kyis skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i gzungs ni yang dag par yongs su rdzogs pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa la mngon par brtson pa'i stobs kyis skye ba yin no //
translated: Among them, the dhāraṇī of acceptance arises from the power of striving for the stage of perfect practice through perfect faith.

original: gzungs lhag ma gsum po ni smon lam gyi stobs las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gzungs lhag ma gsum po ni smon lam gyi stobs las skye ba yin no //
translated: The remaining three dhāraṇīs arise from the power of aspiration.

original: sa dang po la ni chung ngur gyur pa ste gong ma gong ma'i sa rnams la gzungs rnams thams cad kyang gong ma gong ma'i khyad par gyis 'bring dang che ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: sa dang po la ni chung ngur gyur pa ste gong ma gong ma'i sa rnams la gzungs rnams thams cad kyang gong ma gong ma'i khyad par gyis 'bring dang che ba skye ba'o //
translated: On the first stage, they are small. On the higher and higher stages, all the dhāraṇīs arise with the distinction of higher and higher, as medium and great.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gzungs thob pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzungs thob pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Having attained the dhāraṇīs”

original: dga' ba ni mthar phyin pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni mthar phyin pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the joy of completion.

original: dang ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la sems rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dang ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la sems rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: Faith is a clear mind toward those who have good qualities.

original: ri mor byed pa ni de'i yon tan rnams la ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: ri mor byed pa ni de'i yon tan rnams la ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Respect is a sense of wonder at their good qualities.

original: gus par bya ba ni mngon par mchod pa'o //
analyzed: gus par bya ba ni mngon par mchod pa'o //
translated: Reverence is the desire to make offerings to them.

original: bdag 'di bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i yo byad med par ro //
analyzed: bdag 'di bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i yo byad med par ro //
translated: I will do the same means without the requisites for worship.

original: bdag gi lus btsongs la zhes bya ba ste /🔽gal te yang ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang yo byad skyed @304a * //
analyzed: bdag gi lus btsongs la zhes bya ba ste / gal te yang ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang yo byad skyed @304a * //
translated: I will sell my body means:

original: pa la 'di nus pa de lta na yang lus dang srog la mi ltos pa nyid kyis tshogs shin tu 'phel ba'i don du 'di ltar bsam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa la 'di nus pa de lta na yang lus dang srog la mi ltos pa nyid kyis tshogs shin tu 'phel ba'i don du 'di ltar bsam par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, in order to attain meditative concentration, one is able to generate the requisites in some other way, still, in order to increase the stores by not caring about body and life, one should think as follows.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyo ba'i bya ba'i khyad par gtan du ba bdag skad cig ma gcig gis byed nus pa gang gis bdag nyid kyang gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa nyid kyis thos pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba zhes yang dag par bsam par mi byed do
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyo ba'i bya ba'i khyad par gtan du ba bdag skad cig ma gcig gis byed nus pa gang gis bdag nyid kyang gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa nyid kyis thos pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba zhes yang dag par bsam par mi byed do
translated: Therefore, one should not think that the special activity of buying is done by one momentary self, because one would be under the control of another.

original: // zhig cing zhes bya ba ni yan lag cig shos zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // zhig cing zhes bya ba ni yan lag cig shos zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Destroyed” means because one part is destroyed.

original: zad pa ni bsrabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa ni bsrabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Exhausted” means because it is reduced.

original: 'gags pa ni shi ba'i mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni shi ba'i mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Ceased” means because it ends in death.

original: btsongs pa ni 'bangs la sogs pa'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: btsongs pa ni 'bangs la sogs pa'i ngo bor ro //
translated: “ Sold” means in the form of a slave, and so on.

original: 'di ni don med pa'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni don med pa'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa ni /
translated: If it is said that this is meaningless, it is said:

original: 'dod pa'i rgyu dang zhes bya ba ste /🔽'dod pa'i rgyu ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu dang zhes bya ba ste / 'dod pa'i rgyu ni dngos po'o //
translated: “For the sake of desire”🔽The object of desire is a thing.

original: 'dod pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni brgyud nas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni brgyud nas so //
translated: The basis of desire is indirectly.

original: sgra zhes bya ba ste khyad par gzhan gyis gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba ste khyad par gzhan gyis gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The word “only” clarifies another distinction.

original: sgra bsgrags shing zhes bya ba ste shin tu che ba'i sgra ni skad do //
analyzed: sgra bsgrags shing zhes bya ba ste shin tu che ba'i sgra ni skad do //
translated: The word sound is a very loud voice.

original: skad gang zhe na /
analyzed: skad gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gsungs pa ni mi su 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni mi su 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is Whoever wants to, let him come out, etc.

original: nga'i yul las 'da' bar byed par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni 'dir thung ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nga'i yul las 'da' bar byed par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni 'dir thung ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The phrase will go beyond my domain does not occur here.

original: sems la chags pa dang bral ba'am zhes bya ba 'di la 'am gyi sgra rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang rnam par bshad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la chags pa dang bral ba'am zhes bya ba 'di la 'am gyi sgra rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang rnam par bshad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word or is used here because of the inclusion of the word or in the text, and because of the knowledge of the principles of explanation.

original: shin tu'i sgra ni 'dir nye ba'i sgra'i don la 'jug go //
analyzed: shin tu'i sgra ni 'dir nye ba'i sgra'i don la 'jug go //
translated: The word very here has the meaning of the word near.

original: yul de las zhes bya ba lnga pa rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul de las zhes bya ba lnga pa rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The fifth case ending is appropriate in the phrase from that place.

original: gang gi sgra ni de'i phyir gyi don la'o //
analyzed: gang gi sgra ni de'i phyir gyi don la'o //
translated: The word of has the meaning for the sake of.

original: de ltar yongs su bsgribs so zhes bya ba ni rtse gcig par byas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su bsgribs so zhes bya ba ni rtse gcig par byas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase thus obscured means not one-pointed.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: The word how means for what reason.

original: ga la ba der song ste zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi bsod nams lhag pa nyid kyis bdud rnams kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ga la ba der song ste zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi bsod nams lhag pa nyid kyis bdud rnams kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The demons cannot overpower him because of the superiority of Sakra's merit.

original: rkang zhes bya ba la mdzdza zhes bya ba'i skad do //
analyzed: rkang zhes bya ba la mdzdza zhes bya ba'i skad do //
translated: The word bone is the word marrow in the language of Magadha.

original: de bas na mdzdza zhes bya ba'i sgra la mo rtags la da pa si m'a bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bas na mdzdza zhes bya ba'i sgra la mo rtags la da pa si m'a bzhin du'o //
translated: Therefore, the word mar means marrow, just as the word si means mother.

original: rus pa dang rkang zhes bya ba ni rus pa'i rkang ngo //
analyzed: rus pa dang rkang zhes bya ba ni rus pa'i rkang ngo //
translated: Bone and marrow means bone marrow.

original: sems bde ba dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ba de nyid kyis las su rung ba'i sems so //
analyzed: sems bde ba dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ba de nyid kyis las su rung ba'i sems so //
translated: The word mind means the mind that is fit for action due to that very joy.

original: sems rab tu dga' ba ni de las kyang dga' ba nyis 'gyur du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rab tu dga' ba ni de las kyang dga' ba nyis 'gyur du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word very joyful means that it is twice as joyful as that.

original: bram ze'i khye'u khyod la @304b sbyin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u khyod la @304b sbyin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The word give means I will give to you, young brahmin.

original: 'o na rkang la sogs pa sbyin pas srog zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na rkang la sogs pa sbyin pas srog zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you give away your bones and so on, your life will be exhausted.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa la bar chad chen po 'di yod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa la bar chad chen po 'di yod do //
translated: There is this great obstacle to listening to the perfection of wisdom.

original: de rtag tu ngus ci ltar blangs she na /
analyzed: de rtag tu ngus ci ltar blangs she na /
translated: How did Sadaprarudita accept it?

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis song shig dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyon zhes bya ba la nges par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis song shig dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyon zhes bya ba la nges par sbyar ba'o //
translated: The idea is this: “Go ahead, and listen to the perfection of wisdom, as taught by the Tathagatas.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsungs ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba ma yin te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mthu nyid kyis slar lus yongs su rdzogs pa nyid dang srog 'phrog par byed pa'i na tsha rnams kyis srog la bar chad med par mthong ngo bdag nyid kyi bsod nams kyi mthu yang shes pa dang bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs pa'i
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsungs ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba ma yin te / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mthu nyid kyis slar lus yongs su rdzogs pa nyid dang srog 'phrog par byed pa'i na tsha rnams kyis srog la bar chad med par mthong ngo bdag nyid kyi bsod nams kyi mthu yang shes pa dang bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs pa'i
translated: The Tathagatas’ word does not go for nothing.🔽By the power of the Tathagatas themselves, the Bodhisattvas see that their bodies are restored and that the pain which would have ended their lives is removed.

original: stobs kyang shes pa'o //
analyzed: stobs kyang shes pa'o //
translated: They know the power of their own merit, and the power of the blessing of the truth.

original: ji skad du bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: As will be explained:

original: bdag gi lus yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i gnas 'di la ni lha'i dbang po khyod brtson pa chung bar gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i gnas 'di la ni lha'i dbang po khyod brtson pa chung bar gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “In this matter of restoring your body, O Lord of Gods, you have done very little.”

original: des na 'di nyan par 'dod kyang rus pa dang rkang la sogs pa sbyin pa la yang 'jug go //
analyzed: des na 'di nyan par 'dod kyang rus pa dang rkang la sogs pa sbyin pa la yang 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, although he wishes to listen to this, he engages in giving away his bones, marrow, and so on.

original: yon tan gyi rigs zhes bya ba ni mi rnams dang thun mong ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rigs zhes bya ba ni mi rnams dang thun mong ba'i yon tan no //
translated: The type of virtue is the virtue common to humans.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par ni mi rnams las 'das pa'i yon tan no//
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par ni mi rnams las 'das pa'i yon tan no//
translated: The special virtue is the virtue that surpasses humans.

original: bzod do zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis dngos su byed pa nyid kyis kyang 'dod pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod do zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis dngos su byed pa nyid kyis kyang 'dod pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: He endures means that he desires it because he himself directly practices it.

original: brgya byin gyi dang ba'i khyad par gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi dang ba'i khyad par gsungs pa ni /
translated: The special faith of Śakra is stated:

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods...

original: nus pa zhes bya ba ni mthu'o //
analyzed: nus pa zhes bya ba ni mthu'o //
translated: Power means strength.

original: dgongs pa shes nas gsungs pa ni brtson pa chung bar gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa shes nas gsungs pa ni brtson pa chung bar gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having understood the intention, he says, Be of little effort, and so on.

original: brtson pa zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa'o //
translated: Effort means undertaking.

original: skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The instant... and so on.

original: dus nyung ba nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir skad cig la sogs pa gsum po la yang rnam grangs su gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: dus nyung ba nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir skad cig la sogs pa gsum po la yang rnam grangs su gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The three, moment, etc., are also synonyms because they illustrate a short time.

original: dus nyung ba nye bar mtshon pa nyid bstan pa'i don du gsum nye bar smos pa'o //
analyzed: dus nyung ba nye bar mtshon pa nyid bstan pa'i don du gsum nye bar smos pa'o //
translated: The three are mentioned in order to illustrate a short time.

original: nad ni nad chen po rnams so //
analyzed: nad ni nad chen po rnams so //
translated: Sickness is a great illness.

original: gnod pa ni nad chung ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa ni nad chung ba'o //
translated: Injury is a small illness.

original: spobs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o /
analyzed: spobs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o /
translated: Lack of eloquence is the brief statement.

original: rtag tu ngu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ngu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: Constantly weeping, etc., is the extensive explanation.

original: lan glan pa zhes bya ba ni lan gyi rgyu mtshan du'o //
analyzed: lan glan pa zhes bya ba ni lan gyi rgyu mtshan du'o //
translated: Answer is the reason for the answer.

original: @305a * // ma skyes nas zhes bya ba ni rnyed par gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: @305a * // ma skyes nas zhes bya ba ni rnyed par gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not having received means not having obtained.

original: bdag la stsol cig ces bya ba la stsol cig ces bya ba ni sbyin pa la'o //
analyzed: bdag la stsol cig ces bya ba la stsol cig ces bya ba ni sbyin pa la'o //
translated: Give to me is the request.

original: rol mo'i cha byad ces bya ba ni rol mo'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rol mo'i cha byad ces bya ba ni rol mo'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Musical instruments are the forms of music.

original: mang zhing zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang zhing zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Many is because of the many forms.

original: rgya che ba ni rnam pa re rer mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni rnam pa re rer mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is vast because each aspect is infinite.

original: longs spyod ni nor rnams so //
analyzed: longs spyod ni nor rnams so //
translated: Enjoyment is wealth.

original: rgyas btab nas zhes bya ba ni spong ba srid pas spyod yul gyi ngo bo dgag pa'i don dang dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rnyed par dga' ba nyid kyis mthong ba la sogs pa na gdung ba nyid kyi don du'o //
analyzed: rgyas btab nas zhes bya ba ni spong ba srid pas spyod yul gyi ngo bo dgag pa'i don dang dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rnyed par dga' ba nyid kyis mthong ba la sogs pa na gdung ba nyid kyi don du'o //
translated: Having sealed it means that it is the object of the domain of the abandonment of existence, and it is the object of the delight of those endowed with faith, etc., in seeing, etc., because of the absence of distress.

original: sems can rnams mgu ba la sogs pa'i thabs rdzu 'phrul gyi chos 'phrul bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams mgu ba la sogs pa'i thabs rdzu 'phrul gyi chos 'phrul bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the magical emanation of the Dharma of the means of delighting sentient beings, etc.,

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: is by them, etc.

original: spyi bo'i steng na zhes bya ba ni dbu'i steng du'o //
analyzed: spyi bo'i steng na zhes bya ba ni dbu'i steng du'o //
translated: On the crown of his head means on the top of his head.

original: zhig tu gyur to zhes bya ba ni rab kyi sgra ste so so'i don la'o //
analyzed: zhig tu gyur to zhes bya ba ni rab kyi sgra ste so so'i don la'o //
translated: It became a billion-world universe means the word “billion” is for each individual meaning.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni bar snang la'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni bar snang la'o //
translated: In the sky means in the atmosphere.

original: rdzu 'phrul che zhing zhes bya ba ni sems mngon par 'du byas pa nyid kyis de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che zhing zhes bya ba ni sems mngon par 'du byas pa nyid kyis de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great miraculous power means that he performs such miracles by the mere intention to do so.

original: mthu che zhing zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul mdzad pa la bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis chud mi gzon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu che zhing zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul mdzad pa la bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis chud mi gzon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great might means that he cannot be overcome by Mara, etc. in performing miracles.

original: gzi brjid che ba zhes bya ba ni mu stegs dang bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis de'i phyogs su nye bar mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzi brjid che ba zhes bya ba ni mu stegs dang bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis de'i phyogs su nye bar mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Great splendor means that the tirthikas, Mara, etc. cannot approach him.

original: thal mo sbyar te zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar bas na thal mo sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar te zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar bas na thal mo sbyar ba'o //
translated: With palms joined means that he joins his palms in reverence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byon pa dang bzhud pa dri ba'i gnas skabs su brtsams pa'i don du rang gi gtam brjod cing gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byon pa dang bzhud pa dri ba'i gnas skabs su brtsams pa'i don du rang gi gtam brjod cing gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement The Tathagatas do not come or go is stated in the context of the question about the coming and going of the Tathagatas.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di na bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di na bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement Son of noble family, here, the self, etc. is made in order to explain the meaning of the question.🔽 The statement The Tathagatas do not come or go is made in order to explain the meaning of the question.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya bas bos pa nyid kyis 'phags pa chos 'phags dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pa ma yin te gzhan du na btsun pa zhes bya bas bos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya bas bos pa nyid kyis 'phags pa chos 'phags dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pa ma yin te gzhan du na btsun pa zhes bya bas bos par 'gyur ro //
translated: The term son of noble family itself indicates that the noble Avalokiteśvara is not abiding in the vows of a monk. Otherwise, he would be addressed as venerable.

original: khyad par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o //
translated: Having attained means having obtained.

original: mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rgyu las mthong ba dang lhan cig nyid du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rgyu las mthong ba dang lhan cig nyid du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Immediately upon seeing means that the seeing is simultaneous with the cause of seeing.

original: rtag tu dus nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni rtag tu du'i le'u ste le'u sum cu pa'o /
analyzed: rtag tu dus nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni rtag tu du'i le'u ste le'u sum cu pa'o /
translated: The chapter that always illustrates time is the chapter on always time, the thirtieth chapter.

original: // / gzugs kyi sku la de bzhin gshegs par 'dzin pa dgag pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: // / gzugs kyi sku la de bzhin gshegs par 'dzin pa dgag pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to stop the apprehension of the Tathāgata as the form body, it is said:

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Son of noble family, and so on.

original: gal @305b te byon pa dang bzhud pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs kyi sku de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin na 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin zhes bya ba 'di dgos pa la de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can don dam
