analyzed: gal @305b te byon pa dang bzhud pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs kyi sku de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin na 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin zhes bya ba 'di dgos pa la de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can don dam
translated: If the form body that has coming and going is not the Tathāgata, then what is the Tathāgata?

original: pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: In response to this question, the ultimate Tathāgata, whose nature is suchness and whose nature is the body of truth, is stated:

original: de bzhin nyid las ma g-yos te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las ma g-yos te /
translated: He does not move from suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That suchness is the Tathāgata.

original: 'dis de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pas bsdus pa'i phyir rtag pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pas bsdus pa'i phyir rtag pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that the body of truth, which has the characteristic of permanence, is subsumed by suchness, which is pure.

original: de yang rnam par byang ba'i cha can gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su 'gyur bas rnyed par bya ba zhes bya ba'i skye ba dogs pa la skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'i gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de yang rnam par byang ba'i cha can gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su 'gyur bas rnyed par bya ba zhes bya ba'i skye ba dogs pa la skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'i gsungs pa ni /
translated: Moreover, in response to the question, “Is it attained through the transformation of the dependent nature that is the component of purification?”

original: mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is unborn is called the Tathagata.🔽This is said with respect to the characteristic of the mirror-­like gnosis,

original: me long dang mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa dang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la brten pa'i mtshan nyid 'di la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: me long dang mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa dang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes la brten pa'i mtshan nyid 'di la gsungs pa ni /
translated: the equality gnosis, the all-­discerning gnosis, and the accomplishing gnosis.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ultimate reality is the Tathagata.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rnam par shes pa'i phung po yongs su gyur pa'i slad du gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can rnam par shes pa'i phung po yongs su gyur pa'i slad du gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de la gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is said with respect to the characteristic of the transformation of the aggregate of consciousness, which has the nature of the realization of things as they are.

original: stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The emptiness is the Tathagata.🔽This is said with respect to the characteristic of the nonduality, which has the nature of the transformation of the aggregate of form.

original: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang med pa'i ngo bos spyod pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang don dam par yod pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang med pa'i ngo bos spyod pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang don dam par yod pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: The emptiness is not the nature of the imagined and the relative, which are devoid of an existent nature, nor is it the nature of the ultimate reality, which is the emptiness of the nature of the nonexistent.

original: so so rang gis rig par bya'i mtshan nyid de'i go skabs su byed cing gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig par bya'i mtshan nyid de'i go skabs su byed cing gsungs pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of the reality that is to be realized by each one individually is indicated and taught as follows:

original: ci lta ba bzhin gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci lta ba bzhin gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “That which is just as it is is the Tathāgata.”

original: ci lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni 'dir ci lta ba nyid do //
analyzed: ci lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni 'dir ci lta ba nyid do //
translated: Here, “just as it is” is the realization of just as it is.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'i go skabs su byed cing gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'i go skabs su byed cing gsungs pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of the reality that is to be realized by each one individually is indicated and taught as follows:

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: “That which is free from attachment is the Tathāgata.”

original: las mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ston cing gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: las mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ston cing gsungs pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of the reality that is to be realized by each one individually is indicated and taught as follows:

original: 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “That which is cessation is the Tathāgata.”

original: las mngon par 'dus byas pa dag pa ni 'dir 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: las mngon par 'dus byas pa dag pa ni 'dir 'gog pa'o //
translated: Here, cessation is the purification of action that is not accumulated.

original: khyab par byed pa nyid dang rtogs par bya dka' @306a * //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa nyid dang rtogs par bya dka' @306a * //
translated: The characteristic of the reality that is to be realized by each one individually is indicated and taught as follows:🔽“That which is the inconceivable is the Tathāgata.”🔽Here, the inconceivable is the inconceivable realm.

original: pa nyid kyis nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de de la go skabs su byed cing gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: pa nyid kyis nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de de la go skabs su byed cing gsungs pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of space is just that, and it is said to be the opportunity for that.

original: nam mkha'i khams gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which is the space element is the Tathagata.

original: 'o na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes pa'i sku de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes pa'i sku de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: Well, the Tathagata is the body beautified by the thirty-two marks and eighty signs of a great being.

original: slar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: slar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is not the characteristic of reality, etc.

original: rigs kyi bu chos de dag las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan na med de zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos de dag las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan na med de zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Son of noble family, the Tathagata is not other than those dharmas.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that the extremely pure thusness is called the Tathagata.

original: gang gi phyir de de rnams kyi don dam pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de rnams kyi don dam pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the ultimate body of those.

original: de ltar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag la tha mi dad pa brjod nas shin tu tha mi dad pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag la tha mi dad pa brjod nas shin tu tha mi dad pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, having stated the non-difference of suchness, etc. and the Tathagatas, he declares the following in order to teach their utter non-difference:

original: rigs kyi bu chos 'di dag gi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos 'di dag gi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, that suchness of these dharmas...

original: chos 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: “These dharmas” refers to suchness, etc.

original: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni kun brtags kyi ngo bos stong pa nyid de kun brtags kyi ngo bos de bzhin nyid kyang don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni kun brtags kyi ngo bos stong pa nyid de kun brtags kyi ngo bos de bzhin nyid kyang don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “That suchness” refers to emptiness with respect to the imagined nature, because suchness is not the ultimate with respect to the imagined nature.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: “That suchness of all dharmas” refers to the aggregates, elements, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa 'di dag ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa 'di dag ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: “That suchness of the Tathagatas” is the single suchness, etc. This is the brief teaching.

original: gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /🔽rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste / rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason stated is “because it does not exist.”🔽It does not exist substantially.

original: don dam par yod pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //🔽da ni gzugs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin zhes bya ba gang zhig shugs kyis gsungs pa de la gzhan dbang gi ngo bo'i med pa nyid dpes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no // da ni gzugs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin zhes bya ba gang zhig shugs kyis gsungs pa de la gzhan dbang gi ngo bo'i med pa nyid dpes gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is not because it does not exist by the characteristic of ultimate existence.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the nonexistence of the Tathāgata in form, which was stated implicitly, is stated by way of example in the line, “Son of noble family, it is thus.”

original: nyi ma gung gi dus la zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'ongs pas na dus so //
analyzed: nyi ma gung gi dus la zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'ongs pas na dus so //
translated: The line “at noon” means “at the time of the sun’s arrival.”

original: nyi ma gung gi dus 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyi ma gung gi dus 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the time of the sun’s arrival?

original: nyi ma gung @306b gi dus la 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyi ma gung @306b gi dus la 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means “at the time of the sun’s arrival.”

original: byis pa'i rang bzhin can ni de ma yin pa la de'i blo yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa'i rang bzhin can ni de ma yin pa la de'i blo yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those of childish nature have the idea of water where there is no water.

original: shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can ni //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can ni //
translated: Those of foolish nature

original: de'i blo yod de yongs su mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i blo yod de yongs su mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: have the idea of water and do not give it up.

original: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu gang su dag de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs sam sgrar mngon par chags pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu gang su dag de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs sam sgrar mngon par chags pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Likewise, O son of noble family, those who are attached to the Tathāgata as form or sound...

original: bi sha ste zhes bya ba'i khams kyi don la 'gro ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir byed pa po la kta'o //
analyzed: bi sha ste zhes bya ba'i khams kyi don la 'gro ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir byed pa po la kta'o //
translated: The meaning of viśati is “to go” in the sense of a particular destination, so the suffix kta is added to the agent.

original: dper na grong khyer du zhugs pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grong khyer du zhugs pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like “one who enters a city.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is the dharma body.

original: 'di rnams kyi chos kyi sku yod pas na chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi chos kyi sku yod pas na chos kyi sku'o //
translated: They are the dharma body because they possess the dharma body.

original: yang na chos nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: yang na chos nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Or, the reality of those is suchness.

original: de'i ngo bo thob pa'i chos rnams kyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo thob pa'i chos rnams kyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The body of those dharmas that attain that nature is the dharma body.

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi sku zhes bya ba ni kha cig go //
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi sku zhes bya ba ni kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the dharma body is the body of reality.

original: 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa la yang gzhan dbang gi don dam par yod pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa la yang gzhan dbang gi don dam par yod pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: This shows that the engagement of mind and mental factors does not exist ultimately in the dependent nature.

original: smig rgyu la chu ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Like a mirage, water.

original: gal te gzhan dbang med pa yin na ci ltar med pa yin zhes bya ba la sgyu ma'i dpe gnyis pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dbang med pa yin na ci ltar med pa yin zhes bya ba la sgyu ma'i dpe gnyis pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: If the dependent is nonexistent, how can it be nonexistent? The second example of an illusion is stated:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this:

original: glang po che rnams kyi tshogs ni tshogs te glang po che'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che rnams kyi tshogs ni tshogs te glang po che'i tshogs so //
translated: An elephant herd is a group of elephants.

original: gal te gzhan dbang med pa yin na ci ltar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod ces bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i don du rmi lam gyi dpe gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dbang med pa yin na ci ltar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod ces bya ba'i the tshom bzlog pa'i don du rmi lam gyi dpe gsungs pa ni /
translated: If the dependent is nonexistent, how can it be enjoyed as desirable or undesirable? The example of a dream is stated in order to eliminate that doubt:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this:

original: gnyid kyis log pa'i zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa'i zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Having gone to sleep means having entered into drowsiness.

original: rmi lam du zhes bya ba ni brdzun par snang ba'i snod du rung ba'i khyad par thob pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam du zhes bya ba ni brdzun par snang ba'i snod du rung ba'i khyad par thob pa'o //
translated: In a dream means having attained a special capacity for false appearances.

original: yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa nyid do //
translated: The fully present reality is true reality.

original: brdzun te zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun te zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: False means not real.

original: de dang chos mtshungs pas slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang chos mtshungs pas slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is similar to that, it is called deceptive.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni //
translated: That is why it is said:

original: yang dag pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is not real.”

original: ming gi sku ni chos bstan pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ming gi sku ni chos bstan pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The body of names is the nature of the teaching of the Dharma.

original: gzugs kyi sku ni mtshan la sogs pas 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku ni mtshan la sogs pas 'bar ba'o //
translated: The body of form is the blazing of the major and minor marks.

original: don yod par ni sbyin pa po rnams la 'bras bu mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yod par ni sbyin pa po rnams la 'bras bu mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not futile because the givers receive a great result.

original: yul 'khor ni 'jig @307a * //🔽rten te de'i bsod snyoms ni 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: yul 'khor ni 'jig @307a * // rten te de'i bsod snyoms ni 'tsho ba'o //
translated: The realm is the world.🔽The alms are the livelihood.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sbyin gnas te sbyin par 'os pas na sbyin gnas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sbyin gnas te sbyin par 'os pas na sbyin gnas so //
translated: That is why it is the field of merit, because it is worthy of the gift.

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba brgya phrag mang po dang / bskal pa grangs med pa rnams mtshan la sogs pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i las rnams ci'i phyir skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' rnams dka' ba brgya phrag mang po dang / bskal pa grangs med pa rnams mtshan la sogs pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i las rnams ci'i phyir skyed pa yin te /
translated: But why do the bodhisattvas generate the actions that are the causes of the major and minor marks, which are so difficult to perform, over many hundreds of eons?

original: de bas na gzhal du med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po yongs su bzung pa dang gzugs kyi sku skyed pa'i 'dod pa dang smon lam la sogs pa rnams don med par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na gzhal du med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po yongs su bzung pa dang gzugs kyi sku skyed pa'i 'dod pa dang smon lam la sogs pa rnams don med par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the desire to take up an immeasurable mass of merit, to generate the form body, and the prayers, etc., would be meaningless.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning “Son of noble lineage! It is thus” is as follows.

original: yang gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if the form body of the tathāgatas does not exist ultimately,

original: de lta na yang rdzas su yod pa yin te rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang rdzas su yod pa yin te rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it still exists substantially because it is of the nature of consciousness.

original: de la kun brtags ni tha snyad du yod pa dang gzhan dbang ni sgrub pa'i kun rdzob tu rdzas yod pa dang yongs su grub pa ni srid pa'i kun rdzob tu don dam par yod pa zhes lan du brjod do //
analyzed: de la kun brtags ni tha snyad du yod pa dang gzhan dbang ni sgrub pa'i kun rdzob tu rdzas yod pa dang yongs su grub pa ni srid pa'i kun rdzob tu don dam par yod pa zhes lan du brjod do //
translated: In response to this, we say that the imputed exists conventionally, the dependent exists substantially in the relative, and the real exists ultimately in the relative.

original: sgrub pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs bas bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan dbang sgrub pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs bas bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan dbang sgrub pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa'o //
translated: Existence in the relative of accomplishment is the relative existence of the dependent because it is produced by the collection of causes and conditions.

original: gal te sgrub pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan dbang med par 'gyur na de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur la rnam par byang ba yang med de gnyi ga yang de la brten ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan dbang med par 'gyur na de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur la rnam par byang ba yang med de gnyi ga yang de la brten ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the dependent were not to exist by the intrinsic reality of existence in the relative of accomplishment, then there would be no defilement and also no purification, because both are based on that.

original: gzugs kyi sku nyid bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku nyid bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The form body itself is to be accomplished by the Lord Buddhas,

original: gzhan don la rtse gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan don la rtse gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are one-pointed in the aim of others.

original: rang gi don grub pa ni de rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don grub pa ni de rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The accomplishment of one’s own aim is the cause of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan dbang yod kyang yongs su mi 'dor ba'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can sku gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi byang chub bsgrub par bya ba de'i phyir mtshan sgrub par byed pa'i las dang
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan dbang yod kyang yongs su mi 'dor ba'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can sku gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi byang chub bsgrub par bya ba de'i phyir mtshan sgrub par byed pa'i las dang
translated: Therefore, since the dependent nature exists, the attainment of the enlightenment that is the nature of the three bodies, which has the characteristic of not abiding in cyclic existence or nirvana because it is not relinquished, is not meaningless.

original: smon lam la sogs pa rnams don med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: smon lam la sogs pa rnams don med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The activities of the marks, the deeds, the aspirations, and so on are not meaningless.

original: 'o na gal te rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid ci nas kyang blang bar bya ba yin na de'i phyir de nyid don dam par yod par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid ci nas kyang blang bar bya ba yin na de'i phyir de nyid don dam par yod par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the dependent nature that is produced from causes and conditions is to be accepted, then why would it not be ultimate existence?

original: @307b rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: @307b rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is dependently arisen.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
analyzed: gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
translated: That which is dependently arisen🔽Is explained to be emptiness.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi de ma skyes //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi de ma skyes //
translated: That which is not arisen from itself,🔽From another, from both, or causelessly.🔽And:

original: zhes bya ba dang // gang phyir rang bzhin ma bcos pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang // gang phyir rang bzhin ma bcos pa //
translated: Because it is unfabricated by nature,

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: It does not rely on another.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di'i rkyen nyid tsam la //
analyzed: 'di'i rkyen nyid tsam la //
translated: Here, the mere condition

original: don dam pa nyid de dang der //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid de dang der //
translated: of that ultimate itself

original: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: is not from itself, nor from another,🔽and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas shing rta chen po rnams kyi bkag pa zhes re zhig bzhag par zad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas shing rta chen po rnams kyi bkag pa zhes re zhig bzhag par zad do //
translated: This is the refutation of the great charioteers.🔽Son of noble family, in the same way, the perfect bodies of those tathāgatas

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sku yongs su grub pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sku yongs su grub pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: are also like that.

original: de bzhin du gal te rgyu rkyen la rag las pa sku yongs su grub pa yin na de'i tshe skye ba'i snga rol du med pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te rgyu rkyen la rag las pa sku yongs su grub pa yin na de'i tshe skye ba'i snga rol du med pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the perfect body depends on causes and conditions, then it would be said to not exist prior to arising.

original: byon pa dang bzhud pa dag skyes pa la ci ltar dgag pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: byon pa dang bzhud pa dag skyes pa la ci ltar dgag pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: As for the refutation of coming and going in relation to arising, it is said:

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gang nas kyang //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gang nas kyang //
translated: From no world in the ten directions

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: sangs rgyas rnams der byon pas sangs rgyas mthong ba med pa dang gzhan du bzhud pas mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams der byon pas sangs rgyas mthong ba med pa dang gzhan du bzhud pas mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The buddhas do not come there and then not see it, nor do they go elsewhere and not see it.

original: 'on kyang rtag tu bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la yang snod rnam par dag pa dang rnam par ma dag pas bsdus pa sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthong ba dang mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtag tu bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la yang snod rnam par dag pa dang rnam par ma dag pas bsdus pa sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthong ba dang mi mthong ba'o //
translated: However, the buddhas do see and do not see the tathāgatas who always abide there, due to the purity and impurity of the vessel.

original: ci skad du theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma nas gsungs pa /
translated: As the Supreme Continuum of the Great Vehicle teaches:

original: dge ba skye 'jig las sangs rgyas //
analyzed: dge ba skye 'jig las sangs rgyas //
translated: The buddhas arise and disintegrate through virtue.🔽The reflection arises and disintegrates,

original: gzugs brnyan skye dang 'jig pa dang // thub pa skye min 'jig pa min //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan skye dang 'jig pa dang // thub pa skye min 'jig pa min //
translated: but the sage does not arise or disintegrate.

original: brgya byin bzhin du chos sku las //
analyzed: brgya byin bzhin du chos sku las //
translated: Like Indra in the realm of phenomena,

original: 'bad pa med par mdzad pa zhes //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par mdzad pa zhes //
translated: his deeds are effortless.🔽Thus, seeing and so on occur

original: de ltar mthong ba la sogs 'jug / skye ba med pa'i chos sku las //🔽ji srid 'gag med srid par gnas //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba la sogs 'jug / skye ba med pa'i chos sku las // ji srid 'gag med srid par gnas //
translated: from the unborn dharmakāya.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As long as there is no cessation, it abides in existence.

original: mdo sde rgyan las kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las kyang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also taught in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras:

original: ci ltar chu snod chag pa la //
analyzed: ci ltar chu snod chag pa la //
translated: Just as when a vessel of water is broken,

original: zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi mthong ste //🔽de bzhin sems can sdug rnams la //
analyzed: zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mi mthong ste // de bzhin sems can sdug rnams la //
translated: The reflection of the moon is not seen in a broken water pot.

original: sangs rgyas gzugs brnyan mthong ba min //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs brnyan mthong ba min // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the reflection of the Buddha is not seen in suffering sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni gzugs kyi sku la ltos pas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byon pa dang bzhud pa med do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs kyi sku la ltos pas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byon pa dang bzhud pa med do //
translated: This shows that the Tathāgatas do not come and go even in relation to the form body.

original: 'on kyang rnam par dag pa nyid yod pa la gdul bya rnams kyi de bzhin @308a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par dag pa nyid yod pa la gdul bya rnams kyi de bzhin @308a * //
translated: However, it shows that the appearance of the Tathāgatas exists for those to be trained, in the purity of their own minds,

original: gshegs pa rnams kyi bdag por byas nas skyes pa'i snang ba de yod ces bstan to //
analyzed: gshegs pa rnams kyi bdag por byas nas skyes pa'i snang ba de yod ces bstan to //
translated: as if they were the lords of that appearance.

original: 'o na gdul bya rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snang ba rang gi bsod nams kyis nges par 'byung ba nyid yod mod //
analyzed: 'o na gdul bya rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snang ba rang gi bsod nams kyis nges par 'byung ba nyid yod mod //
translated: Well then, the appearance of the Tathāgata for those to be trained definitely arises from their own merit.

original: dbang du byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku la ni rnam par gzhag pa ci lta bu zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dbang du byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku la ni rnam par gzhag pa ci lta bu zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: But what is the status of the form body of the Tathāgata, who is the one who controls that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sku rgyu med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sku rgyu med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The bodies of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are not without a cause.

original: 'dis ni gzugs kyi sku la rdzas su yod pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs kyi sku la rdzas su yod pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows that the body of form is substantially existent.

original: rdzas su yod pa yang de'i byon pa dang bzhud pa med do //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa yang de'i byon pa dang bzhud pa med do //
translated: And it is substantially existent, but there is no coming or going of it.

original: 'on kyang gdul bya rnams la de bdag po'i dbang gis de'i rnam pa snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gdul bya rnams la de bdag po'i dbang gis de'i rnam pa snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, for those to be trained, its aspect appears by the power of its lord.

original: de bas na mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ngo mtshar ba'i phrin las can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bas na mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ngo mtshar ba'i phrin las can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagatas have the activity of the most inconceivable wonder.

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: The noble Asanga also says:

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: byang chub ston mdzad 'ga' zhig tu //
analyzed: byang chub ston mdzad 'ga' zhig tu //
translated: In some places, the teacher of enlightenment

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: In some places, nirvana.

original: nam yang med min ma yin te //
analyzed: nam yang med min ma yin te //
translated: Never nonexistent, never existent,

original: brtags pa'i sku can de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: brtags pa'i sku can de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The Tathagata has a constructed body.

original: 'di rnams kun du rnam spyod de //
analyzed: 'di rnams kun du rnam spyod de //
translated: All of these are his conduct,

original: 'ga' zhig tu yang spyod pa min //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu yang spyod pa min //
translated: But in some places, he does not conduct himself.

original: bdag gi dngos po kun mthong ba //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po kun mthong ba //
translated: All of my own nature is seen,

original: dbang po drug gi spyod yul min //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po drug gi spyod yul min // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not as the domain of the six senses.

original: dmyal ba pa rnams kyis kyang sprul pa'i sku mthong ba'i phyir bdag gi dngos po kun gyis mthong ste /
analyzed: dmyal ba pa rnams kyis kyang sprul pa'i sku mthong ba'i phyir bdag gi dngos po kun gyis mthong ste /
translated: Because even hell beings see the emanation body, all of my own nature is seen.

original: sku kun gyi ngo bo nyid gang gis dbang po gang yang rung bas kyang spyod yul du byed par nus pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sku kun gyi ngo bo nyid gang gis dbang po gang yang rung bas kyang spyod yul du byed par nus pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By whatever sense faculty one is able to make it an object, it is not the essence of the entire body.

original: slar de lta bu'i rnam pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di la dpe gzhan gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: slar de lta bu'i rnam pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di la dpe gzhan gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to illustrate this kind of dependent origination, another example is given: “Son of noble family, it is like this. For example, when a lute is played, the sound that arises does not come from the lute’s body, neck, strings, or the fingernails and palms of the player’s hands.

original: shing bu ni rgyud rnams dkris pa'i rten no //🔽rgyud rten zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i rgyud mangs so //
analyzed: shing bu ni rgyud rnams dkris pa'i rten no // rgyud rten zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i rgyud mangs so //
translated: The stick is the support for the entwined strings.🔽The strings are the support for the sound.🔽The sound does not arise from the beginning or end of the strings, but from the middle.”

original: thog ma dang tha ma dag las sgra mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i tshig ni dbus thams cad du 'brel ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma dag las sgra mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i tshig ni dbus thams cad du 'brel ba'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “from the beginning and end” is that it is connected to the entire middle.

original: rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra las rang gi don la ka na ste des na rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra las rang gi don la ka na ste des na rgyu med pa'o //
translated: The word “without cause” means “without a cause of its own.”

original: pi wang gi sgra'i dpes bstan pa'i chos 'grub pa ni rgyu rkyen la rag las pa zhes bya ba mtshon te zhes bya ba kha cig go //
analyzed: pi wang gi sgra'i dpes bstan pa'i chos 'grub pa ni rgyu rkyen la rag las pa zhes bya ba mtshon te zhes bya ba kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the establishment of the Dharma taught by the example of the sound of the lute is indicated by the words “dependent on causes and conditions.”

original: dkrogs shing zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba nyid thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: dkrogs shing zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba nyid thob pa rnams so //
translated: “Shaken” means those that have attained distraction.

original: @308b spa bkod bar gyur pa ni grib ma 'jig pa rnams so //
analyzed: @308b spa bkod bar gyur pa ni grib ma 'jig pa rnams so //
translated: “Shivering” means those that have attained the destruction of the shadow.

original: de logs su rab tu 'dud par gyur to zhes bya ba ni chos nyid las thob pa sems med pa rnams kyis kyang chos bstan pa la rnam par 'gyur ba 'di des byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i lha'i byin gyis brlabs pas so //
analyzed: de logs su rab tu 'dud par gyur to zhes bya ba ni chos nyid las thob pa sems med pa rnams kyis kyang chos bstan pa la rnam par 'gyur ba 'di des byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i lha'i byin gyis brlabs pas so //
translated: “They bowed down to him” means that even those without minds, having attained the nature of things, through the blessing of the gods who bless the teaching of the Dharma, this transformation was produced by them.

original: 'thor zhing zhes bya ba ni grol bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'thor zhing zhes bya ba ni grol bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Scattered” means they became liberated.

original: nam mkha' la 'phags nas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'phags nas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la'o //
translated: “Having risen into the sky” means in the sky.

original: bdag gi lus kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la mngon par bkab ste de'i mdun du lus thams cad kyis sa la phab nas 'di la rang gi lus 'bul zhing 'dug pas so //
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la mngon par bkab ste de'i mdun du lus thams cad kyis sa la phab nas 'di la rang gi lus 'bul zhing 'dug pas so //
translated: With my body I covered the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata, and in front of him I fell to the ground with my whole body, and I remained there offering myself.

original: 'bul ba de nyid rjod par byed pa ni rigs kyi bu de dang mtshungs par bya ba la sogs pa bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bul ba de nyid rjod par byed pa ni rigs kyi bu de dang mtshungs par bya ba la sogs pa bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He is expressing that very offering with “Son of a good family, I will do what is similar to that and so on,” and so on.

original: khyod la zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos nyan pa la sogs pa la de'i rtsa ba can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod la zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos nyan pa la sogs pa la de'i rtsa ba can gyi phyir ro //
translated: “To you” is because they are the root of listening to the Buddha’s teachings and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs par gyur cing zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni ting nge 'dzin zhes brjod de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs par gyur cing zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni ting nge 'dzin zhes brjod de /
translated: “Having entered into a single meditative stabilization” is the one-pointedness of mind that is concomitant with uncontaminated equanimity, which is called “meditative stabilization.”

original: de bya ba tha dad pa nyid kyis dpa' bar 'gro ba dang seng ge rnam par rol pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po dang chos thams cad kyi yang dag par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis tha snyad du byed cing rang bzhin tha dad
analyzed: de bya ba tha dad pa nyid kyis dpa' bar 'gro ba dang seng ge rnam par rol pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po dang chos thams cad kyi yang dag par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i ming rnams kyis tha snyad du byed cing rang bzhin tha dad
translated: It is conventionally designated by different names such as the Heroic One, the Lion’s Play, the King of Samādhis, the Source of All Dharmas, and so on, due to its different functions,

original: pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not due to different natures.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan du 'don pa yin te bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan du 'don pa yin te bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: For that reason, it is recited elsewhere: “The Bhagavān entered into the samādhi called the King of Samādhis,

original: gang du ting nge 'dzin thams cad nang du 'dus pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang du ting nge 'dzin thams cad nang du 'dus pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: where all samādhis are gathered.”

original: des na ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs pa dang ting nge 'dzin stong phrag du ma rnams kyis gnas par gyur to zhes bya ba 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs pa dang ting nge 'dzin stong phrag du ma rnams kyis gnas par gyur to zhes bya ba 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in saying, “Having entered into one samādhi, he abided in many thousands of samādhis.”

analyzed: mthong ngo // skyil mo krung gcig gis ting nge 'dzin stong phrag rnams la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya bas gcig la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes @309a * //

original: 'don pa 'di nyid bshad pa yin no //🔽slar 'phags pa chos 'phags lo bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid ci zhig bzhugs par 'gyur /🔽rtag tu du'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs pa'i don dang chos 'dod pa thams cad kyi mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar brjod do //
analyzed: 'don pa 'di nyid bshad pa yin no //🔽slar 'phags pa chos 'phags lo bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid ci zhig bzhugs par 'gyur /🔽rtag tu du'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs pa'i don dang chos 'dod pa thams cad kyi mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar brjod do //
translated: The meaning

original: dus 'da' bar byed de zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dus 'da' bar byed de zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: “They pass the time” means they are engaged in it.

original: bdag cag gis kyang khri gang la zhes bya ba ni dus gang la bdag cag gis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang khri gang la zhes bya ba ni dus gang la bdag cag gis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “We too will follow the example of those who” means “we too will follow the example of those who” at that time.

original: de'i rjes su 'jug go zhes bya ba ni rjes su byed pa rnams so ;
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug go zhes bya ba ni rjes su byed pa rnams so ;
translated: “We will follow their example” means those who imitate them.

original: ; lha'i zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ; lha'i zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' las byung ba'o //
translated: “Divine” means arisen from the sky.

original: sems gzhan du 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni sa gzhi chag chag gdab pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan du 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni sa gzhi chag chag gdab pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: “Their minds are elsewhere” means they are not paying attention to sprinkling the ground.

original: nus pa med pa'i bya ba 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni le lo can gyi lus zhig par bya ba ni nus pa dang bral ba de cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i bya ba 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni le lo can gyi lus zhig par bya ba ni nus pa dang bral ba de cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is not because they desire to do something that they are incapable of doing” means that the lazy are incapable of doing anything to destroy their bodies.

original: de ltar bsams nas zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa'i rim pa 'dis lhan cig skyes pa'i lus la zhen pa bsal nas rang gi khrag gis sa phyogs de dag thams cad du chag chag btang po zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i ngo mtshar ba'i sa la brgya
analyzed: de ltar bsams nas zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa'i rim pa 'dis lhan cig skyes pa'i lus la zhen pa bsal nas rang gi khrag gis sa phyogs de dag thams cad du chag chag btang po zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i ngo mtshar ba'i sa la brgya
translated: Having thought in this way, with this process of analysis, having removed attachment to the co-emergent body, with one's own blood one should sprinkle all those places.

original: byin la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis smad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid khrag gi chag chag go skabs su byed cing 'di ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: byin la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis smad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid khrag gi chag chag go skabs su byed cing 'di ltar byas pa'o //
translated: Having done this, with the blessing of Indra and so forth, one should not be criticized, and the blood should be made to serve as a basis.

original: de dag thams cad kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni bu mo brgya phrag rnams so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni bu mo brgya phrag rnams so //
translated: All of them, the hundreds of girls,

original: yang de dang des zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la mtshon cha'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: yang de dang des zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la mtshon cha'i khyad par ro //
translated: with that and that, the special weapons,

original: glags ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: glags ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: the opportunity, the entry,

original: byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba byed par 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba byed par 'gyur bar ro //
translated: having blessed, having made,

original: chos yongs su tshol ba yang zhes bya ba ni yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: chos yongs su tshol ba yang zhes bya ba ni yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: the search for the Dharma, the thorough search,

original: me tog bkram par gyis shig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: me tog bkram par gyis shig ces bya ba ste /
translated: the spreading of flowers,

original: me tog gzhan gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la mchod pa'i don du bzhag nas 'dug go zhes bya ba 'don pa'o //
analyzed: me tog gzhan gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la mchod pa'i don du bzhag nas 'dug go zhes bya ba 'don pa'o //
translated: and the other flowers were scattered by the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita in order to make offerings to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata.

original: mdun du yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu du bu mo de dag dang lhan cig tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la mchod pa byas par gyur to //
analyzed: mdun du yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu du bu mo de dag dang lhan cig tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la mchod pa byas par gyur to //
translated: And in front of him, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita together with those girls made offerings to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata.

original: @309b de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu du mthong ba dang lhan cig pa nyid kyis nub byang mtshams kyi yul nas 'ongs ba'i bcom ldan 'das ma las mthong ste /
analyzed: @309b de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu du mthong ba dang lhan cig pa nyid kyis nub byang mtshams kyi yul nas 'ongs ba'i bcom ldan 'das ma las mthong ste /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita together with those he had seen came from the northwest and saw the Blessed Lady.

original: de nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: That is reasonable.

original: me tog kha cig ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la gtor to zhes bya ba gang du 'don pa de ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: me tog kha cig ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags la gtor to zhes bya ba gang du 'don pa de ji ltar rigs /
translated: How is it reasonable to say that some of the flowers were scattered on the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata, where it is recited?

original: de'i tshe chos 'phags ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos 'phags ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time Dharmodgata was not seen.

original: der 'phags pa chos 'phags kyis bstan pa ci lta bu byung bar gyur zhes bya ba de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: der 'phags pa chos 'phags kyis bstan pa ci lta bu byung bar gyur zhes bya ba de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to explain how the teaching of the noble Dharmodgata came to be, it is said:

original: de la ston pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ston pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teacher is this... and so on.

original: spyir bstan nas khyad par du gsal bar byed pa ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyir bstan nas khyad par du gsal bar byed pa ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having taught in general, it is clarified in particular with namely.

original: rnam pa sum cu po 'di rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa sum cu po 'di rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is by these thirty aspects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i thos pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa rnam pa sum cu po 'di nyid rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin rnams 'don par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i thos pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa rnam pa sum cu po 'di nyid rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin rnams 'don par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the power of his hearing, he recited the samadhis by these very thirty aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mnyam pa nyid ni rigs par bya zhes bya ba tha mar gsungs pa 'dir yang 'brel bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mnyam pa nyid ni rigs par bya zhes bya ba tha mar gsungs pa 'dir yang 'brel bar bya'o //
translated: The equality of the perfection of wisdom should be understood. This is said at the end and should be connected here as well.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni mi mnyam pa nyid med pa de'i ngo bo gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni mi mnyam pa nyid med pa de'i ngo bo gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Equality is the absence of inequality. The meaning is its single nature.

original: de bas na chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa las de gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo cung zad ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa las de gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo cung zad ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, what is the nature of anything that is different from the realization of the nature of all phenomena?

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, “Because all phenomena are sameness.”

original: chos thams cad kyang spyi'i ngo bo nyid de de bas na chos thams cad la don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin gcig rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang spyi'i ngo bo nyid de de bas na chos thams cad la don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin gcig rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since all phenomena are the nature of the universal, the realization of the one ultimate nature of all phenomena is the meaning of “perfection of wisdom.”🔽Like the Vedāntins, it is said, “What is the sameness of the nature of things such as the self?”

original: rig byed kyi mthar smra ba ltar bdag la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang ci zhig mnyam pa nyid yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni chos thams cad dben pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rig byed kyi mthar smra ba ltar bdag la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang ci zhig mnyam pa nyid yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni chos thams cad dben pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, “Because all phenomena are voidness.”

original: chos thams cad kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo rnams kyis gang zhig dben pa nyid ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo rnams kyis gang zhig dben pa nyid ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: The voidness of all phenomena that are the imagined and dependent natures is emptiness.

original: de rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po'i ngo bo ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po'i ngo bo ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The realization of that is the perfection of wisdom. It is not the nature of an entity.

original: sngar dngos po'i ngo bo ci zhig gnas sam phyis dben pa nyid kyis yongs su 'gyur ba ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes @310a * //
analyzed: sngar dngos po'i ngo bo ci zhig gnas sam phyis dben pa nyid kyis yongs su 'gyur ba ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes @310a * //
translated: What is the nature of an entity before, and what is the transformation by voidness later?

original: gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni /
translated: He says:

original: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are without movement.

original: chos thams cad kyi dus thams cad du g-yo ba med pa'i ngo bo 'di ni rang bzhin te rtogs pa'i dus la de ltar yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dus thams cad du g-yo ba med pa'i ngo bo 'di ni rang bzhin te rtogs pa'i dus la de ltar yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of all phenomena at all times is without movement. This is their nature. It is not like that at the time of realization.🔽If it existed before, then when one realizes it, what is realized?

original: gal te sngar yang yod na de'i phyir gang gi tshe na rtogs par byed na de'i tshe ci zhig rtogs pa yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: gal te sngar yang yod na de'i phyir gang gi tshe na rtogs par byed na de'i tshe ci zhig rtogs pa yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni //
translated: He says:

original: chos thams cad rlom pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rlom pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are without conceit.

original: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not the domain of conceptual consciousness.

original: 'on kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: However, the meaning of “non-conceptual” is as follows.

original: ; gal te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin na de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa dang gdod ma nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan la ci zhig rtogs par 'gyur ram ma yin zhes gsungs
analyzed: ; gal te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin na de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa dang gdod ma nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan la ci zhig rtogs par 'gyur ram ma yin zhes gsungs
translated: If it has the nature of non-conceptual wisdom, then what other thing, such as unarisen, unceasing, primordially peaceful, and so on, is realized in form and so on?

original: pa ni / chos thams cad khengs pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa ni / chos thams cad khengs pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, “Because all phenomena are devoid of arrogance.”

original: dngos po gcig nyid dang rang bzhin gcig nyid dang ye shes gang la khengs pa yod pa ma yin te 'on kyang dngos po thams cad gdod ma nas zhi ba dang rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa don dam pa pa'i ngo
analyzed: dngos po gcig nyid dang rang bzhin gcig nyid dang ye shes gang la khengs pa yod pa ma yin te 'on kyang dngos po thams cad gdod ma nas zhi ba dang rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa don dam pa pa'i ngo
translated: In a single thing, a single nature, and in any wisdom, there is no arrogance. However, all things are primordially peaceful, naturally thoroughly passed beyond sorrow, and so on, and all entities of the ultimate

original: bo thams cad kyis shes pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bo thams cad kyis shes pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: are not known. This is the thought.

original: de bas na gnyid dang myos pa dang brgyal ba mthug pa la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ci zhig rnam par gzhag pa yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na gnyid dang myos pa dang brgyal ba mthug pa la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ci zhig rnam par gzhag pa yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “What is called non-conceptuality is like deep sleep, intoxication, and fainting. What is established? What is not?”

original: chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, “Because all phenomena are of one taste.”

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i ngo bo rtogs pa'i rang bzhin der 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thog mar sa dang po la skye ba de bas na gang zhig mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo rnams dmigs pa'i dus su des mthong ba des mthong ba de rnams nyid gcig tu ro gcig pa nyid kyis ci zhig shes sam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i ngo bo rtogs pa'i rang bzhin der 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thog mar sa dang po la skye ba de bas na gang zhig mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo rnams dmigs pa'i dus su des mthong ba des mthong ba de rnams nyid gcig tu ro gcig pa nyid kyis ci zhig shes sam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The nature of realizing the universal essence of all phenomena is the supramundane wisdom that first arises on the first bhumi. Therefore, when the essence of what is seen, heard, suspected, and cognized is observed, it is said, “What is seen by that seeing is of one taste with those very things. What is known? What is not?”

original: chos thams cad mu med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mu med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, “Because all phenomena are limitless.”

original: dngos po gcig ni gang gis de nyid du mi mthong /
analyzed: dngos po gcig ni gang gis de nyid du mi mthong /
translated: One thing is not seen as thatness.

original: dngos po thams cad de nyid du ni des mthong ba zhes bya ba'i rigs pas chos thams cad la khyad par byed @310b pa nyid kyis rtogs pa 'di yin pa ste so sor nges pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad de nyid du ni des mthong ba zhes bya ba'i rigs pas chos thams cad la khyad par byed @310b pa nyid kyis rtogs pa 'di yin pa ste so sor nges pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: This is the realization that all things are the same in suchness, by the reasoning that “all things are seen to be the same in suchness.”

original: 'o na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin de ni de'i tshe nyid du ci zhig skyes sam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin de ni de'i tshe nyid du ci zhig skyes sam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: But if the nature of things is not produced at that time, then what is produced?

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are non-arisen.

original: 'o na snga ma 'jig rten pa'i dmigs pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin ci zhig 'gag pa yin nam zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na snga ma 'jig rten pa'i dmigs pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin ci zhig 'gag pa yin nam zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: But if the nature of the object of worldly perception does not cease, then what ceases?

original: chos thams cad 'gag pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gag pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are unceasing.

original: gal te 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid kyis ye shes 'di la da ltar nyams su myang ba med pa de bas na don 'di dpe med pa ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid kyis ye shes 'di la da ltar nyams su myang ba med pa de bas na don 'di dpe med pa ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: If this supramundane wisdom does not experience itself in the present, then what is the meaning of “unprecedented”?

original: nam mkha' mu med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mu med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because space is infinite means

original: ci ltar nam mkha' ni khyab byed dang rtogs par dka' ba de bzhin du 'di yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar nam mkha' ni khyab byed dang rtogs par dka' ba de bzhin du 'di yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: just as space is all-pervading and difficult to realize, so is this, is the meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa nam mkha' bzhin du ro gcig pa dang rtogs par dka' ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa nam mkha' bzhin du ro gcig pa dang rtogs par dka' ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, like space, it is of one taste and of an essence difficult to realize.

original: gal te stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
translated: If the perfection of wisdom itself has the nature of emptiness,

original: de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: that very thing is the Tathagata.

original: de bas na 'di 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba rnam par spangs pa ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na 'di 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba rnam par spangs pa ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said, How is it that this is devoid of the activity of the welfare of beings?

original: rgya mtsho mu med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho mu med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because the ocean is infinite means

original: ci ltar sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la rgya mtsho mu ma mchis pa rin po che sna tshogs pa'i 'byung gnas rnam pa mang pos 'gro ba'i don byed pa dang 'gro ba rnams la nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: ci ltar sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la rgya mtsho mu ma mchis pa rin po che sna tshogs pa'i 'byung gnas rnam pa mang pos 'gro ba'i don byed pa dang 'gro ba rnams la nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs
translated: Just as the oceans in the various world systems are the source of many kinds of various jewels, and benefit beings in many ways, and are the means of subsistence for beings,

original: pa rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can gyis kyang chos kyi sku la brten pa'i kun rdzob pa mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rin po cher 'bar ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs
analyzed: pa rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can gyis kyang chos kyi sku la brten pa'i kun rdzob pa mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rin po cher 'bar ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs
translated: in the same way, the Tathagatas, who are the nature of the perfection of wisdom, the nature of the Dharma Body, also, by means of the Enjoyment Body, which is the blazing jewel of the major and minor marks, which is based on the Dharma Body, and which is produced from the various buddha fields,🔽always benefit the bodhisattvas who have entered the great stages.

original: pa las phyung ba rnams kyis sa chen po rnams la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dus thams cad du don du gnyer zhing mdzad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa las phyung ba rnams kyis sa chen po rnams la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dus thams cad du don du gnyer zhing mdzad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is called “activity.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The inconceivable supramundane and so on.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las nyan thos dang so so'i skye bo rnams kyi don 'grub pa ci zhig mi srid pa yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni //🔽ri rab @311a * //
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las nyan thos dang so so'i skye bo rnams kyi don 'grub pa ci zhig mi srid pa yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni // ri rab @311a * //
translated: But is it not possible for the disciples and ordinary beings to accomplish their goals through the Tathagatas? He says, No, and explains why.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The variety refers to the fact that there are different kinds of Merus.

original: ci ltar gling bzhi so sor gser dang shel la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ri rab rnams de bzhin du don dam pa'i chos kyi sku la brten pa'i sprul pa'i skus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid 'gro ba ma lus pa'i
analyzed: ci ltar gling bzhi so sor gser dang shel la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ri rab rnams de bzhin du don dam pa'i chos kyi sku la brten pa'i sprul pa'i skus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid 'gro ba ma lus pa'i
translated: Just as there are different kinds of Merus, golden, crystal, and so on, in the four continents, in the same way, the emanation bodies based on the ultimate reality body perform the function of accomplishing the goals of all beings through the perfection of wisdom.

original: don mdzad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //🔽de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
analyzed: don mdzad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes bya ba'o // de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
translated: The Tathagatas are those who have thus gone.

original: sems can rnams la smin don du //🔽'ga' zhig tu ni me ltar snang //
analyzed: sems can rnams la smin don du // 'ga' zhig tu ni me ltar snang //
translated: For this very reason, he says, In order to bring beings to maturity.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In some places he appears as fire, and so on.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: stong pa nyid la brten pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skye ba ma yin te nam mkha' la sa bon rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la brten pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skye ba ma yin te nam mkha' la sa bon rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: The qualities of the Buddha, which are based on emptiness, do not arise, like seeds in the sky.

original: 'dus byas la brten pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skye ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas la brten pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skye ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The qualities of the Buddha, which are based on the conditioned, do arise.

original: sems can rnams la ltos pas sangs rgyas rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos don du gnyer ba 'khrul pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin yang longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku dag nye bar 'dzin par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la ltos pas sangs rgyas rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos don du gnyer ba 'khrul pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin yang longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku dag nye bar 'dzin par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The Buddhas, in their concern for sentient beings, take on the nature of the conventional, which is the essence of error, and they take on the enjoyment body and the emanation body.

original: 'o na rang gi ngo bos rlom pa med pa'i rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin mod //
analyzed: 'o na rang gi ngo bos rlom pa med pa'i rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin mod //
translated: Well, if the perfection of wisdom is the nature of the absence of the conceit of intrinsic reality,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i longs spyod dang sprul pa rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa la 'bad pa med par mi nus pa'i phyir cis kyang rnam par rtog pa srid dam zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i longs spyod dang sprul pa rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa la 'bad pa med par mi nus pa'i phyir cis kyang rnam par rtog pa srid dam zhe na /
translated: how is it possible that it is able to accomplish the aims of beings by means of the various enjoyments and emanations without effort?🔽To this question, the reply is:

original: ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The answer is “no.”🔽

original: nam mkha' rtog pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' rtog pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because space is nonconceptual.

original: ci ltar nam mkha' cung zad rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: ci ltar nam mkha' cung zad rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
translated: Just as space does not engage in any conceptualization,

original: 'on kyang thams cad la mgo sbyin pa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad la mgo sbyin pa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: so also do the Tathagatas, who are the bestowers of the gift of the heads of generosity, morality, and patience, etc.

original: de lta na yang mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: de lta na yang mdo sde rgyan las /
translated: And so, in the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras,

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni chos kyi 'khor lo brgya phrag mang po'i sgo nas de ni ston par mdzad //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni chos kyi 'khor lo brgya phrag mang po'i sgo nas de ni ston par mdzad //
translated: In some places, he teaches through many hundreds of Dharma wheels.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni skye dang mi snang 'ga' zhig tu yang skye po'i spyod pa sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni skye dang mi snang 'ga' zhig tu yang skye po'i spyod pa sna tshogs pa //
translated: In some places, he is born and in some places, he does not appear. In some places, he has various human activities.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni byang chub ma lus 'ga' zhig tu yang mi mnyam mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni byang chub ma lus 'ga' zhig tu yang mi mnyam mya ngan 'das pa ni //
translated: In some places, he has all the enlightenments. In some places, he has the unequaled nirvana.

original: rang gi gnas nas rnam par g-yo ba med cing de ni thams cad du yang mdzad pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi gnas nas rnam par g-yo ba med cing de ni thams cad du yang mdzad pa ste // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He does not move from his own place, and he does everything.

original: rang gi gnas nas zhes @311b bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings las so //
analyzed: rang gi gnas nas zhes @311b bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings las so //
translated: His own place is the nonconceptual realm.

original: 'o na gal te de lta bu'i 'jig rtan  las 'das pa'i ye shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams rnams las de tha dad pa nyid yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de lta bu'i 'jig rtan  las 'das pa'i ye shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams rnams las de tha dad pa nyid yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, is that supramundane wisdom, the perfection of wisdom, different from the aggregates, such as form, and the elements?🔽It is said:🔽Because the form element is infinite, the perfection of wisdom is infinite.

original: gzugs mu med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rnam par shes pa'i khams mu med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzugs mu med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rnam par shes pa'i khams mu med pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Because the consciousness element is infinite, the perfection of wisdom is infinite.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa //🔽stong pa nyid las gzhan du gzugs med do //🔽gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa // stong pa nyid las gzhan du gzugs med do // gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽Form does not exist apart from emptiness.🔽Form itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'di chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yang yod pas 'khor ba'i gnas skabs la rtsa ba med pa'i dri ma rnams kyis dor bar byed pa de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis yang dag par shes pa rnams kyi mthong ba
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'di chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yang yod pas 'khor ba'i gnas skabs la rtsa ba med pa'i dri ma rnams kyis dor bar byed pa de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis yang dag par shes pa rnams kyi mthong ba
translated: Well then, since this is the nature of all phenomena, is it the case that the stains, which are without root in the context of cyclic existence, are cast off, and likewise, are they cast off by supramundane wisdom?

original: yang slar btang bar byas pa yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i chos mnyam pa nyid pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽rdo rje lta bu'i chos ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa gang gi phyir slar dbye bar ni mi nus pa dang mnyam pa'ang yin te de'i ngo bor mnyam pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnod pa dang bral bde ba'i don //🔽rang bzhin gyis ni log rnams te //
analyzed: yang slar btang bar byas pa yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i chos mnyam pa nyid pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / rdo rje lta bu'i chos ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa gang gi phyir slar dbye bar ni mi nus pa dang mnyam pa'ang yin te de'i ngo bor mnyam pa'i phyir ro // gnod pa dang bral bde ba'i don // rang bzhin gyis ni log rnams te //
translated: The response to this is “because of the vajra-like sameness of phenomena,” and so on.

original: gnod pa med pa 'bad ldan yang //🔽blo ni de phyogs byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa 'bad ldan yang // blo ni de phyogs byed pa'i phyir //
translated: The vajra-like phenomena are the nature of emptiness, and because of realization, they cannot be cast off again. They are also the same, because they are the same in their nature.

original: zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:🔽The objects of knowledge are not different from the nature of phenomena.🔽The objects of knowledge are not different from the nature of phenomena.🔽The
