original: slar rtogs pa dbye bar ci zhig mi nus sam slar yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid de de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i mthong ba nyid ni de'i mthong ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: slar rtogs pa dbye bar ci zhig mi nus sam slar yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid de de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i mthong ba nyid ni de'i mthong ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the seeing of form, etc. is the seeing of that.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir ci zhig ma 'dres pa nyid yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci zhig ma 'dres pa nyid yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: “What is not mixed?

original: chos thams cad ma 'dres pa nyid pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: chos thams cad ma 'dres pa nyid pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
translated: All phenomena are not mixed.”

original: ma 'dres pa nyid ni ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa nyid ni ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Not mixed is the nature of not being mixed.

original: stong pa nyid dang lhan cig tu gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang lhan cig tu gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Form, etc. are not mixed with emptiness.

original: de'i ngo bo ni ma 'dres pa nyid de des stong pa nyid du sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni ma 'dres pa nyid de des stong pa nyid du sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is not being mixed. By that, emptiness is not various.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nyid stong pa nyid ni @312a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nyid stong pa nyid ni @312a * //
translated: Form, etc. are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid yin pa de bas na 'khor ba'i gnas skabs su gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs pa mthong ba med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin pa de bas na 'khor ba'i gnas skabs su gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs pa mthong ba med do //
translated: Since it is emptiness, therefore, because form, etc. is seen in the state of cyclic existence, emptiness, etc. is not seen.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The emptiness of form is not form.

original: 'dis ni gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba sel bar byed de de nyid kyi phyir bsdus pa'i don la ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba sel bar byed de de nyid kyi phyir bsdus pa'i don la ni /
translated: This removes the distraction of the conceptual thought of identity, and therefore, in the case of the meaning of inclusion,

original: gzugs ni stong nyid rigs min te //
analyzed: gzugs ni stong nyid rigs min te //
translated: Form is not suitable as emptiness,

original: phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of mutual contradiction.

original: stong nyid ces bya gzugs bral te /
analyzed: stong nyid ces bya gzugs bral te /
translated: That which is called emptiness is free from form,

original: gzugs ni rnam pa dang bral ba //
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam pa dang bral ba //
translated: Form is free from aspects.

original: zhes bya ba gcig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gcig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the fault of the conceptual thought of identity.

original: gal te stong pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang gcig pa'i ngo bo ma yin na 'o na stong pa nyid mthong ba'i dus nyid la gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang stong pa nyid mthong ba yod par 'gyur ram ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang gcig pa'i ngo bo ma yin na 'o na stong pa nyid mthong ba'i dus nyid la gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang stong pa nyid mthong ba yod par 'gyur ram ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni
translated: If emptiness is not the same entity as form and so on, then at the time of seeing emptiness, is there also seeing of form and so on, or not?

original: / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that because all phenomena are unobservable.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams las gtan du ba'i tha dad pa nyid 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams las gtan du ba'i tha dad pa nyid 'di ma yin no //
translated: This is not a permanent difference between emptiness and so on.

original: 'on kyang de nyid don dam par yod pa thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i stobs kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams su snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid don dam par yod pa thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i stobs kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams su snang ngo //
translated: However, due to the power of beginningless ignorance, that which exists ultimately appears as the entities of form and so on.

original: gang gi tshe ma rig pa med pas rang gi ngo bos mthong ba de'i tshe ma rig pa log kyang gzugs la sogs pa med pa rnams la ci ltar snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma rig pa med pas rang gi ngo bos mthong ba de'i tshe ma rig pa log kyang gzugs la sogs pa med pa rnams la ci ltar snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When, due to the absence of ignorance, one sees by one's own nature, at that time, even though ignorance has ceased, how can there be the appearance of non-existent form and so on?

original: de lta na yang don bsdus pa las sna tshogs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang don bsdus pa las sna tshogs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: Nevertheless, the Compendium statement that it is understood through variety is as follows.

original: gzugs ni gzhan du 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzhan du 'dzin pa ste //
translated: Form is the apprehension of other.

original: rnam pa gang gis stong nyid kyi //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis stong nyid kyi //
translated: By what aspect is emptiness🔽understood?

original: gang phyir med nyid snang ba ni //
analyzed: gang phyir med nyid snang ba ni //
translated: Because nonexistence appears,

original: da ni ma rig pas sprul pa //
analyzed: da ni ma rig pas sprul pa //
translated: now, through the power of ignorance,

original: med pa snang ba nus nyid kyis //🔽de ni ma rig pa zhes brjod //
analyzed: med pa snang ba nus nyid kyis // de ni ma rig pa zhes brjod //
translated: nonexistent appearances

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: are called ignorance.

original: tha dad pa'i rnam par thal bar g-yeng ba sngar bkag kyang go skabs gzhan du bkag pa yin te ;
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rnam par thal bar g-yeng ba sngar bkag kyang go skabs gzhan du bkag pa yin te ;
translated: Although the distraction of different aspects was previously refuted, it is refuted in another context.

original: gang zhig 'di chos kyi mi dmigs pa de ye shes gang gis kyang ci zhig rtogs pa yin nam 'on te ma yin rtogs pa yin na ye shes de don dam par yod pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di chos kyi mi dmigs pa de ye shes gang gis kyang ci zhig rtogs pa yin nam 'on te ma yin rtogs pa yin na ye shes de don dam par yod pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that non-apprehension of phenomena is understood by some wisdom, then that wisdom would be ultimately existent and it would follow that it has the nature of object and subject.

original: ma rtogs pa yin na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan @312b 'das kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rtogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pas de ltar ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa yin na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan @312b 'das kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rtogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pas de ltar ci ltar brjod /
translated: If it is not understood, then how could the perfect, complete Buddha, the Bhagavat, have the perfection of understanding all supramundane dharmas?

original: chos kyang so so rang gis rig par bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyang so so rang gis rig par bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the Dharma would not be something to be personally experienced.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ri bong gi rva ltar shin tu med par 'gyur bsam yin zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ri bong gi rva ltar shin tu med par 'gyur bsam yin zhes gsungs pa /
translated: And the perfection of wisdom would be utterly nonexistent, like the horns of an ass.

original: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of the sameness of the complete destruction of all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa gang yin pa 'di ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa gang yin pa 'di ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The complete destruction of all dharmas is not apprehended.

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid ni 'dzin pa'i ye shes la yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid ni 'dzin pa'i ye shes la yang ngo //
translated: Its sameness is also in the apprehending gnosis.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: gang gi tshe lam gyi gnas skabs su ye shes chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la dmigs pa de'i tshe bdag nyid la yang stong pa nyid dmigs par gyur pa mngon du byed pa'i gnas skabs su de yang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid thob pa
analyzed: gang gi tshe lam gyi gnas skabs su ye shes chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la dmigs pa de'i tshe bdag nyid la yang stong pa nyid dmigs par gyur pa mngon du byed pa'i gnas skabs su de yang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid thob pa
translated: When, in the state of the path, wisdom focuses on the emptiness of all phenomena, at that time, itself also focuses on emptiness. In the state of actualization, it also attains the nature of emptiness.

original: yin gyi gzhan du na chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid mngon du byas pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi gzhan du na chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid mngon du byas pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be called “actualizing the emptiness of all phenomena.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i ye shes de brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i ye shes de brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that wisdom abides in the nature of equality, the object observed and the observer being equal.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das //🔽ye shes gnyis med tshul 'chang ba //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das // ye shes gnyis med tshul 'chang ba //
translated: The reality of consciousness is past.🔽Wisdom holds the mode of nonduality.

original: rnam par rtog med lhun gyis grub //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med lhun gyis grub //
translated: Nonconceptual and spontaneous,

original: dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pa //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pa // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It acts for the buddhas of the three times.

original: 'di yang 'thad pa yin te dgongs pa de nyid ji skad du /
analyzed: 'di yang 'thad pa yin te dgongs pa de nyid ji skad du /
translated: This is also tenable, because the intention is just as it is said:

original: slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The statement by the master Candrakirti is:

original: gang tshe skye ba med pa de nyid blo gros kyang ni skye ba dang bral ba //
analyzed: gang tshe skye ba med pa de nyid blo gros kyang ni skye ba dang bral ba //
translated: When the non-arisen itself is also free from arising,

original: de'i tshe de nyid 'gro ba lta bu de yi rnam pa bsnyen pa'i phyir yang ste //
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid 'gro ba lta bu de yi rnam pa bsnyen pa'i phyir yang ste //
translated: then, in order to approach the aspect of that, it is like going to that.

original: zhes bya ba'o //🔽ye shes de'i stong pa nyid dang lhan cig tu bdag nyid gcig dang med pa la bya ba 'ga' zhig yod dam gang gis de'i ngo bo thob pa ci zhig shes par 'gyur ram ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // ye shes de'i stong pa nyid dang lhan cig tu bdag nyid gcig dang med pa la bya ba 'ga' zhig yod dam gang gis de'i ngo bo thob pa ci zhig shes par 'gyur ram ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement:

original: chos thams cad byed pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa med pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Since all things are inactive,🔽there is no activity of the emptiness of that”?

original: 'dir byed pa ni bya ba ste de med pas byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir byed pa ni bya ba ste de med pas byed pa med pa'o //
translated: Here, activity is action; since it does not exist, it is inactive.

original: gal te bya ba yang med na stong pa nyid ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang yang dag par 'das pa rdzas so so cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te bya ba yang med na stong pa nyid ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang yang dag par 'das pa rdzas so so cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no action, emptiness is the characteristic of a thing, and it is not a substance that is a little something that transcends reality.

original: 'dzin par byed pa'i ye shes kyang de'i ngo bo nyid thob pa ste 'on kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes 'di so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i chos zhes bya ba 'di mig 'phrul dang 'dra ba nyid ci zhig rtog ge @313a * //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'i ye shes kyang de'i ngo bo nyid thob pa ste 'on kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes 'di so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i chos zhes bya ba 'di mig 'phrul dang 'dra ba nyid ci zhig rtog ge @313a * //
translated: However, this supramundane wisdom is called “the Dharma to be realized by oneself.” What is it like? Is it an object of thought?

original: ba'i yul gyi bya bas sun dbyung bar bya ba ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ba'i yul gyi bya bas sun dbyung bar bya ba ci zhig yin nam ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Is it something to be refuted by the activity of thought?

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that it is not, because all phenomena are inconceivable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma las /
translated: Therefore, the Mahāyāna Unexcelled Tantric System says:

original: rang 'byung rnams kyis don dam la //
analyzed: rang 'byung rnams kyis don dam la //
translated: The self-arisen ones’ ultimate

original: 'dir ni dad pa nyid kyis 'gro //🔽mig med 'od kyis 'bar ba yi //
analyzed: 'dir ni dad pa nyid kyis 'gro // mig med 'od kyis 'bar ba yi //
translated: Is to be gone to by faith alone.🔽The sun’s orb is not seen

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor mthong ba min //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor mthong ba min //
translated: By the blind with their eyes closed.🔽The buddha element, the enlightenment of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas khams dang sangs rgyas byang chub dang / sangs rgyas yon tan sangs rgyas phrin las te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas khams dang sangs rgyas byang chub dang / sangs rgyas yon tan sangs rgyas phrin las te //
translated: The qualities of the buddhas, and the activity of the buddhas

original: dag pa'i sems can gyis kyang bsam bya min //
analyzed: dag pa'i sems can gyis kyang bsam bya min //
translated: Are not to be reflected upon even by pure sentient beings.

original: 'di ni 'dren pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dren pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin //
translated: This is the domain of the leaders.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi yul 'di la ni mos pa'i blo //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi yul 'di la ni mos pa'i blo //
translated: The mind that is devoted to this domain of the victors

original: yon tan tshogs kyi snod du 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: yon tan tshogs kyi snod du 'gyur ba yin //
translated: becomes a vessel for the accumulation of good qualities.

original: bsam med yon tan mngon dga' ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsam med yon tan mngon dga' ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the delight in the good qualities of the inconceivable,

original: sems can kun gyi bsod nams skyes pa zil gyis gnon //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi bsod nams skyes pa zil gyis gnon // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it surpasses the merit of all sentient beings.

original: de bas na 'dir rtog ge 'jug par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir rtog ge 'jug par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not the domain of speculation.

original: phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis ci skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis ci skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it has been said by the master Dignāga:🔽Those who have fallen far from the teaching of the lord of sages,

original: thub dbang bstan las shin tu ring par nyams pa dang / gang zhig rtog ge'i lam gyis chos nyid la btud pa //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thub dbang bstan las shin tu ring par nyams pa dang / gang zhig rtog ge'i lam gyis chos nyid la btud pa // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and those who bow to reality by the path of speculation,

original: skyon dang bral ba'i chos yongs su tshol bal 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du'i chos bstan pas gang zhig bya ba byas pa de bstan pa la don yod pa nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: skyon dang bral ba'i chos yongs su tshol bal 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du'i chos bstan pas gang zhig bya ba byas pa de bstan pa la don yod pa nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni //
translated: The bodhisattva who is engaged in the quest for the Dharma free from faults, who has done what had to be done through the teaching of the Dharma of the three vehicles, in order to demonstrate the non-futility of the teaching, says:

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu ngu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Sadāprarudita...

original: de ltar 'dug bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thos pa byed pa'i stan las ma langs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dug bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thos pa byed pa'i stan las ma langs pa'o //
translated: Sitting like that means not rising from the seat of listening.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: At that time... and so on.

original: rim pa gang dang rnam pa gang rnams gang nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa rim pa de nyid dang rnam pa gang rnams de nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin rnams skyes pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: rim pa gang dang rnam pa gang rnams gang nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa rim pa de nyid dang rnam pa gang rnams de nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin rnams skyes pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The summarized meaning is: The meditative stabilizations arose in just that order and in just those aspects by which the perfection of wisdom was taught.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa ste de la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin rnams de ltar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa ste de la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin rnams de ltar brjod pa'o //
translated: The meditative stabilizations are expressed in that way because they have as their objects the sameness of all phenomena and so on.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase such as that refers to thirty and so on.

original: 'di rnams la sogs pa nyid kyang 'di rnams nyid kyis de rnams 'phangs pa'i phyir @313b ro ;
analyzed: 'di rnams la sogs pa nyid kyang 'di rnams nyid kyis de rnams 'phangs pa'i phyir @313b ro ;
translated: Since those very [meditative stabilizations] are projected by those very [aspects], they are called such as that.

original: ; chos 'phags kyis mtshon par byas pa'i le'u ni de'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa gcig pa'o /
analyzed: ; chos 'phags kyis mtshon par byas pa'i le'u ni de'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa gcig pa'o /
translated: The chapter illustrated by Dharmodgata is the thirty-first.

original: // / ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phan yon gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: // / ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phan yon gsungs pa ni /
translated: The benefits of attaining meditative concentration are stated:

original: thob ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thob ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Immediately upon attaining them, he sees the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra ni dus mnyam pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra ni dus mnyam pa'i don la'o //
translated: The word “together” means at the same time.

original: gang gi tshe nyid du ting nge 'dzin rnams thob pa de nyid kyi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyid du ting nge 'dzin rnams thob pa de nyid kyi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At just the time he attains the meditative concentrations, at that very time he sees the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i don la drug pa ste /
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i don la drug pa ste /
translated: “Attaining” is the sixth case, the dative.

original: des na thob pa yod pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: des na thob pa yod pa rnams la'o //
translated: Therefore, it is “for those who have attained.”

original: tshul 'di lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni len par byed pa'i don 'di rnams don ston par byed pas na tshul te tshig gi tshogs so //
analyzed: tshul 'di lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni len par byed pa'i don 'di rnams don ston par byed pas na tshul te tshig gi tshogs so //
translated: “This very method” is the method of the collection of words, because it reveals the meaning of these words.

original: ming 'di nyid ces bya ba ni ming gi tshogs rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ming 'di nyid ces bya ba ni ming gi tshogs rnams kyis so //
translated: “This very name” is the collection of names.

original: yi ge 'di nyid ces bya ba ni yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyis so //🔽bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang zhes bya ba ni gnas gcig la gnas pa nyid kyis chos kyi rgyun la ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir dang sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i sangs rgyas las gdams ngag thob pa'i phyir de mang du thos pa
analyzed: yi ge 'di nyid ces bya ba ni yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyis so // bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang zhes bya ba ni gnas gcig la gnas pa nyid kyis chos kyi rgyun la ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir dang sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa'i sangs rgyas las gdams ngag thob pa'i phyir de mang du thos pa
translated: This very letter means the collection of letters.🔽Inconceivable means that he has much learning, because he has attained meditative concentration in the stream of the Dharma by abiding in one place, and because he has received instructions from the Buddhas abiding in various world systems.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Inconceivable means that he has much learning, because he has attained meditative concentration in the stream of the Dharma by abiding in one place, and because he has received instructions from the Buddhas abiding in various world systems.

original: ci skad du gsungs pa /🔽sangs rgyas rnams las chos rgyun gyi //
analyzed: ci skad du gsungs pa / sangs rgyas rnams las chos rgyun gyi //
translated: As it is said:🔽At that time, he receives instructions

original: de tshe gdams ngag thob par 'gyur //🔽rgya ches zhing gnas ye shes kyi //
analyzed: de tshe gdams ngag thob par 'gyur // rgya ches zhing gnas ye shes kyi //
translated: from the Buddhas in the stream of the Dharma.🔽Because of the vastness of his knowledge and the vastness of his abode,

original: rgya che ba nyid 'gro ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rgya che ba nyid 'gro ba'i phyir //
translated: he goes to vastness.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: thos pa rgya mtsho zhes bya ba 'dis ni thos pa tshud mi za ba ste dran pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: thos pa rgya mtsho zhes bya ba 'dis ni thos pa tshud mi za ba ste dran pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: Ocean of learning indicates that his learning is inexhaustible, because he is endowed with mindfulness.

original: skye ba thams cad du yang nam yang sangs rgyas dang bral bar ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad du yang nam yang sangs rgyas dang bral bar ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: In all his births, he was never separated from the Buddha. This is the summary.

original: 'di'i bshad pa ni skye ba thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas tha na rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni skye ba thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas tha na rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The explanation of this is from “in all his births” up to “even in dreams.”

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bos nas yongs su gtad ba la go skabs byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bos nas yongs su gtad ba la go skabs byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, the Blessed One, having addressed Ananda, says “the opportunity for entrusting”

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: . “Then” and so on.

original: yang rab 'byor yongs su dor nas kun dga' bo las brtsams te yongs su gtad pa ci'i phyir go skabs su mdzad ce na /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor yongs su dor nas kun dga' bo las brtsams te yongs su gtad pa ci'i phyir go skabs su mdzad ce na /
translated: Why, having abandoned Subhuti, does the Blessed One begin with Ananda and make the opportunity for entrusting?

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba las pha rol du 'di nye bar dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba las pha rol du 'di nye bar dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is necessary for the other side of final Nirvana.

original: ci skad du 'chad par 'gyur pa las nga 'das nas 'di la yang byos shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci skad du 'chad par 'gyur pa las nga 'das nas 'di la yang byos shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: As will be explained, “After I have passed away, you should do this.”

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni sngar nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' @314a * //🔽ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni sngar nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' @314a * // ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The elder Subhūti has already passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: 'o na gnas brtan kun dga' bo las brtsams nas sngar yongs su gtad pa mdzad pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gnas brtan kun dga' bo las brtsams nas sngar yongs su gtad pa mdzad pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But the elder Ānanda was entrusted with the teaching first, beginning with him.

original: bden te 'on kyang de ni zhar las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang de ni zhar las byung ba'o //
translated: That is true, but that was a digression.

original: gang gi phyir der gnas brtan kun dga' bos 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i dgos pa zhus pa de bas na skabs des yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir der gnas brtan kun dga' bos 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i dgos pa zhus pa de bas na skabs des yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid nye bar bstan to //
translated: Since the elder Ānanda asked the reason for the smile there, by that occasion the perfection of wisdom itself was taught as the cause of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: de bas na yon tan 'di lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyir yongs su gtad pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na yon tan 'di lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyir yongs su gtad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because it has such qualities, it is entrusted.

original: da ltar ni bstan pa rdzogs pa la yongs su gtad pa nyid skabs thob pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar ni bstan pa rdzogs pa la yongs su gtad pa nyid skabs thob pa'o //
translated: Now, the entrusting itself, which is the occasion for the completion of the teaching, is obtained.

original: kun dga' bo de bas na rnam grangs 'dis kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bas na rnam grangs 'dis kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Ānanda, therefore, by this method also, etc.

original: 'phags pa chos 'phags kyis bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa las rtag tu du nyid bla na med pa'i chos rnyed pa'i gtam gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa chos 'phags kyis bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa las rtag tu du nyid bla na med pa'i chos rnyed pa'i gtam gyis kyang ngo //
translated: And by the story of the constant weeping of Dharmodgata, who was listening to the perfection of wisdom taught by the noble Dharmodgata, he found the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: 'dis ni chos thams cad kyi stod pa nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bo 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa dngos po dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis las 'das pa shes pa dang shes
analyzed: 'dis ni chos thams cad kyi stod pa nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bo 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa dngos po dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis las 'das pa shes pa dang shes
translated: Here, the essence of the realization of the emptiness of all phenomena, which is supramundane and non-conceptual, is subsumed by the vajra-like samadhi. It is the knowledge that transcends both existence and non-existence, and is not of the nature of the knower or the known.

original: bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa yod med gnyis las 'das pa rtag chad dang bral ba stong pa gzugs med pa bstan du med pa gnas pa med pa snang ba dang bral ba rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang gnas med pa'i ye shes ni
analyzed: bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa yod med gnyis las 'das pa rtag chad dang bral ba stong pa gzugs med pa bstan du med pa gnas pa med pa snang ba dang bral ba rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang gnas med pa'i ye shes ni
translated: The wisdom that transcends both existence and non-existence, free from eternalism and nihilism, empty, formless, invisible, non-abiding, free from appearance, non-informative, and groundless,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang yang de'i rjes la thob pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa dang bral ba rnams kyang me long dang mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa dang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes de rnams kyang de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu btags🔽pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming nyid thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang de'i rjes la thob pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa dang bral ba rnams kyang me long dang mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa dang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes de rnams kyang de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu btags pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming nyid thob pa yin no //
translated: Also, the subsequent states of the bodhisattvas, which are associated with concepts and free of concepts, are the cause of those mirrorlike, equality, individualizing and dutyfulfilling primordial wisdoms and so they are designated by the name of their result.

original: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pas spyod pa zhes bya ba so so'i skye bo'i sa la brten nas rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa dang 'od byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang sbyang dka' ba dang mngon du gyur pa dang ring
analyzed: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pas spyod pa zhes bya ba so so'i skye bo'i sa la brten nas rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa dang 'od byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang sbyang dka' ba dang mngon du gyur pa dang ring
translated: The bodhisattvas' stage of devoted interest, which is based on the level of ordinary beings, is called the Joyful, the Stainless, the Radiant, the Brilliant, the Immoveable, the Manifested, the Far Reaching, the Unshakable, the Excellent Intelligence and the Cloud of Dharma.

original: du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin sa bcu rnams la thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mngon par 'phel ba chos kyi dbyings la dri ma
analyzed: du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin sa bcu rnams la thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mngon par 'phel ba chos kyi dbyings la dri ma
translated: They increase through the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation and so forth. They are included within the path that is the method for making the dharmadhatu free from stains.

original: med par byed pa'i thabs lam gyis bsdus pa kun du 'gro ba'i don dang / @314b mchog gi don dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i don dang / rgyud tha mi dad pa'i don dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams par dag pa'i don dang /
